to hear / listen — duymak / dinlemek.notes: To hear or listen; distinguishes passive hearing from active zuhören. Duymak ve muzik dinlemek vs. Birini dinlerken zuhören. Hören pasif duymak caba sarfetmeden.

to sound — kulağa gelmek / ses çıkarmak.exde: Das klingt, als ob du eine gute Nachricht hättest.
to sound — kulağa gelmek / ses çıkarmak.exen: That sounds like you have good news.
to sound — kulağa gelmek / ses çıkarmak.notes: To sound or seem; relates to acoustic impression or figurative evaluation.

to get / receive (colloq.) — almak (günd.exde: Ich kriege gleich Besuch, also muss ich noch schnell aufräumen.
to get / receive (colloq.) — almak (günd.exen: I’m getting visitors soon, so I still need to tidy up quickly.
to get / receive (colloq.) — almak (günd.notes: Colloquial for bekommen; informal tone for “to get/receive.”

to laugh — gülmek.exde: Wir haben so laut gelacht, dass die Nachbarn es gehört haben.
to laugh — gülmek.exen: We laughed so loudly that the neighbors heard it.
to laugh — gülmek.notes: To laugh; physical expression of amusement.

to lead / manage — yönetmek / yönlendirm.exde: Er leitet ein großes Projekt, das nächstes Jahr abgeschlossen wird.
to lead / manage — yönetmek / yönlendirm.exen: He leads a big project that will be completed next year.
to lead / manage — yönetmek / yönlendirm.notes: To lead, manage, or direct; emphasizes responsibility or control. Leading a team, department, organization etc.

to deliver — teslim etmek / ulaştırmak.exde: Die Firma liefert die Ware morgen, obwohl sie weit entfernt liegt.
to deliver — teslim etmek / ulaştırmak.exen: The company delivers the goods tomorrow, even though it’s far away.
to deliver — teslim etmek / ulaştırmak.notes: To deliver goods or provide something; commercial or service context.

to lie (not tell truth) — yalan söylemek.exde: Du solltest nicht lügen, auch wenn die Wahrheit unangenehm ist.
to lie (not tell truth) — yalan söylemek.exen: You shouldn’t lie, even if the truth is unpleasant.
to lie (not tell truth) — yalan söylemek.notes: To lie or tell falsehoods; focuses on deliberate untruth.

to avoid — kaçınmak / uzak durmak.exde: Ich meide große Menschenmengen, weil ich mich dort unwohl fühle.
to avoid — kaçınmak / uzak durmak.exen: I avoid large crowds because I feel uncomfortable there.
to avoid — kaçınmak / uzak durmak.notes: To avoid people or situations intentionally. More conscious than vermeiden. Meiden means avoiding something by keeping your distance from people, places, or situations—physical or social avoidance. Vermeiden means avoiding something by preventing it from happening (mistakes, conflict, problems). Meiden = stay away; Vermeiden = prevent an outcome.

to measure — ölçmek.exde: Der Arzt misst meinen Blutdruck, bevor er das Medikament gibt.
to measure — ölçmek.exen: The doctor measures my blood pressure before giving the medicine.
to measure — ölçmek.notes: To measure quantitatively; physical or abstract metrics.

to take with — yanına almak / beraber gö.exde: Ich nehme immer eine Jacke mit, falls es abends kalt wird.
to take with — yanına almak / beraber gö.exen: I always take a jacket with me in case it gets cold in the evening.
to take with — yanına almak / beraber gö.notes: To take along or with oneself; emphasizes accompanying transport.

to name / call — adlandırmak / demek.exde: Sie nennt ihn immer „Chef“, auch privat.
to name / call — adlandırmak / demek.exen: She always calls him “boss,” even in private.
to name / call — adlandırmak / demek.notes: To name or call someone something; can assign a label (jdn etw nennen).

to use / make use of — kullanmak / fayda.exde: Ich nutze jede Gelegenheit, um mein Deutsch zu verbessern.
to use / make use of — kullanmak / fayda.exen: I use every opportunity to improve my German.
to use / make use of — kullanmak / fayda.notes: To make use of something for advantage or benefit; often figurative.

to happen — olmak / meydana gelmek.exde: Was ist passiert, nachdem du gegangen bist?
to happen — olmak / meydana gelmek.notes: To happen or occur (intransitive); neutral tone for events.

to try / taste — denemek / tatmak.exde: Du solltest dieses Gericht probieren, weil es unglaublich gut schmeckt.
to try / taste — denemek / tatmak.exen: You should try this dish because it tastes amazing.
to try / taste — denemek / tatmak.notes: To try or taste something; practical attempt, not planning.

to react — tepki vermek / karşılık verme.exde: Er reagiert immer ruhig, selbst wenn jemand ihn kritisiert.
to react — tepki vermek / karşılık verme.exen: He always reacts calmly, even when someone criticizes him.
to react — tepki vermek / karşılık verme.notes: To react or respond emotionally or physically to a situation.

to calculate — hesaplamak.exde: Ich rechne damit, dass er bald anruft.
to calculate — hesaplamak.exen: I’m expecting that he’ll call soon.
to calculate — hesaplamak.notes: To calculate or expect; literal for math, figurative for anticipation.

to reduce — azaltmak / düşürmek.exde: Wir müssen den Stromverbrauch reduzieren, um Energie zu sparen.
to reduce — azaltmak / düşürmek.exen: We must reduce electricity use to save energy.
to reduce — azaltmak / düşürmek.notes: To reduce or decrease; often in formal, quantitative contexts.

to call / shout — çağırmak / seslenmek.exde: Sie ruft laut, damit jemand sie hört.
to call / shout — çağırmak / seslenmek.exen: She calls loudly so someone can hear her.
to call / shout — çağırmak / seslenmek.notes: To call out loudly; for attracting attention or summoning.

to seem / shine — görünmek / parlamak.exde: Die Sonne scheint, obwohl es gestern noch geregnet hat.
to seem / shine — görünmek / parlamak.exen: The sun is shining, although it rained yesterday.
to seem / shine — görünmek / parlamak.notes: To shine or appear; distinguishes real appearance (aussehen) from impression.

to send — göndermek.exde: Ich schicke dir den Link, sobald ich wieder Internet habe.
to send — göndermek.exen: I’ll send you the link as soon as I have internet again.
to send — göndermek.notes: To send someone or something; broad use, not limited to mail.

to swim — yüzmek.exde: Wir sind geschwommen, bis es angefangen hat zu donnern.
to swim — yüzmek.exen: We swam until it started to thunder.
to swim — yüzmek.notes: To move through water; also figurative for being in abundance (in Geld schwimmen).

to send / broadcast — yayınlamak / gönde.exde: Der Radiosender sendet heute Abend ein interessantes Interview.
to send / broadcast — yayınlamak / gönde.exen: The radio station broadcasts an interesting interview tonight.
to send / broadcast — yayınlamak / gönde.notes: To transmit or broadcast; used for radio, TV, or emails.

to sing — şarkı söylemek.exde: Sie singt, wenn sie glücklich ist.
to sing — şarkı söylemek.notes: To sing vocally; artistic or expressive act.

to jump — zıplamak / atlamak.exde: Das Kind springt ins Wasser, obwohl es kalt ist.
to jump — zıplamak / atlamak.exen: The child jumps into the water even though it’s cold.
to jump — zıplamak / atlamak.notes: To jump or leap; sudden movement, literal or metaphorical (Preis springt hoch).

to steal — çalmak.exde: Jemand hat mein Fahrrad gestohlen, während ich im Supermarkt war.
to steal — çalmak.exen: Someone stole my bike while I was in the supermarket.
to steal — çalmak.notes: To steal or take without permission; criminal act.

to climb / rise — yükselmek / tırmanmak.exde: Die Preise sind gestiegen, weil die Nachfrage so hoch ist.
to climb / rise — yükselmek / tırmanmak.exen: Prices have risen because demand is so high.
to climb / rise — yükselmek / tırmanmak.notes: To climb or increase; can be physical (stairs) or abstract (prices). General verb for rising or climbing, used physically (stairs, height) and abstractly (prices, temperature). Less specific than aufsteigen (move upward to a higher level, upward direction or promotion), erklimmen (climb with great effort, mountains, hard goals), klettern (physical climbing using hands/feet), and ansteigen/sich erhöhen (formal increase in numbers or rates).

to argue / fight — tartışmak / kavga etm.exde: Wir streiten uns oft, aber wir versöhnen uns auch schnell wieder.
to argue / fight — tartışmak / kavga etm.exen: We often argue, but we make up quickly.
to argue / fight — tartışmak / kavga etm.notes: To argue or quarrel; emotional disagreement, often reflexive sich streiten.

to search / look for — aramak / araştırm.exde: Ich suche meine Schlüssel, die ich irgendwo hingelegt habe.
to search / look for — aramak / araştırm.exen: I’m looking for my keys that I put somewhere.
to search / look for — aramak / araştırm.notes: To search or look for something; active pursuit.

to dance — dans etmek.exde: Sie tanzen die ganze Nacht, bis die Musik aufhört.
to dance — dans etmek.exen: They dance all night until the music stops.
to dance — dans etmek.notes: To dance; rhythmic body movement to music, literal or figurative.

to share / divide — bölmek / paylaşmak.exde: Ich teile meine Meinung nur, wenn mich jemand fragt.
to share / divide — bölmek / paylaşmak.exen: I only share my opinion when someone asks me.
to share / divide — bölmek / paylaşmak.notes: To share or divide; emphasizes distribution or joint use. General verb for sharing or dividing something. Broader than aufteilen (split into portions for distribution), verteilen (hand out to many), einteilen (allocate/ organize), unterteilen (subdivide structurally), and abteilen (cut off or separate a section). Teilen can mean sharing (opinions, rooms) or dividing (objects).

to drink — içmek.exde: Wir trinken Tee, während wir auf den Zug warten.
to drink — içmek.exen: We drink tea while waiting for the train.
to drink — içmek.notes: To drink liquids; can be literal or idiomatic (auf jdn trinken).

to do / act / put (colloq.) — yapmak / e.exde: Ich tue die Wäsche in die Waschmaschine. / Ich tue so, als ob ich nichts wüsste. / Mein Rücken tut weh.
to do / act / put (colloq.) — yapmak / e.exen: I put the laundry into the washing machine. / I pretend as if I didn’t know anything. / My back hurts.
to do / act / put (colloq.) — yapmak / e.notes: Soyut “yapmak/etmek” anlamında kullanılır; davranışsal eylemleri ifade eder (tun = machen’dan daha soyut). Bazı sabit ifadelerde zorunludur (wehtun, so tun als ob, mir/dir leid tun). Konuşma dilinde “bir şeyi bir yere koymak” için de kullanılır (die Wäsche in die Maschine tun). Somut üretim/oluşturma için machenkullanılır.

to consider / think about — düşünmek / d.exde: Ich überlege, ob ich wirklich umziehen soll oder nicht.
to consider / think about — düşünmek / d.exen: I’m thinking about whether I should really move or not.
to consider / think about — düşünmek / d.notes: To think about or consider before deciding; reflective process.

to translate — çevirmek / tercüme etmek.exde: Kannst du diesen Satz ins Englische übersetzen?
to translate — çevirmek / tercüme etmek.exen: Can you translate this sentence into English?
to translate — çevirmek / tercüme etmek.notes: To translate from one language to another; also metaphorically to transfer meaning.

to examine / investigate — incelemek / a.exde: Der Arzt untersucht den Patienten, bevor er das Rezept schreibt.
to examine / investigate — incelemek / a.exen: The doctor examines the patient before writing the prescription.
to examine / investigate — incelemek / a.notes: To examine or investigate; detailed inspection, medical or analytical.

to support — desteklemek / yardımcı olma.exde: Meine Eltern unterstützen mich, wenn ich Hilfe brauche.
to support — desteklemek / yardımcı olma.exen: My parents support me when I need help.
to support — desteklemek / yardımcı olma.notes: To support or assist actively; material or moral help.

to improve — iyileştirmek / geliştirmek.exde: Ich verbessere meinen Wortschatz, indem ich viel lese.
to improve — iyileştirmek / geliştirmek.exen: I improve my vocabulary by reading a lot.
to improve — iyileştirmek / geliştirmek.notes: To improve or correct something; emphasize making better.

to forget — unutmak.exde: Ich habe vergessen, dass wir heute einen Termin hatten.
to forget — unutmak.exen: I forgot that we had an appointment today.
to forget — unutmak.notes: To forget; failure of memory or neglect.

to lose — kaybetmek.exde: Er hat sein Handy verloren, als er im Park joggte.
to lose — kaybetmek.exen: He lost his phone while jogging in the park.
to lose — kaybetmek.notes: To lose something or fail to keep it; literal or emotional sense.

to avoid — kaçınmak / önlemek.exde: Man sollte Fehler vermeiden, indem man vorher alles überprüft.
to avoid — kaçınmak / önlemek.exen: You should avoid mistakes by checking everything beforehand.
to avoid — kaçınmak / önlemek.notes: To avoid something undesirable; preventative nuance.

to disappear — kaybolmak / ortadan kaybo.exde: Die Sonne ist verschwunden, und plötzlich wurde es kalt.
to disappear — kaybolmak / ortadan kaybo.exen: The sun disappeared, and suddenly it got cold.
to disappear — kaybolmak / ortadan kaybo.notes: To disappear or vanish; focus on no longer being visible or present.

to promise — söz vermek.exde: Ich verspreche, dass ich pünktlich komme.
to promise — söz vermek.exen: I promise that I’ll come on time.
to promise — söz vermek.notes: To promise or slip of tongue (sich versprechen); commitment or assurance.

to distribute — dağıtmak / paylaştırmak.exde: Der Lehrer verteilt die Arbeitsblätter, bevor der Test beginnt.
to distribute — dağıtmak / paylaştırmak.exen: The teacher hands out the worksheets before the test begins.
to distribute — dağıtmak / paylaştırmak.notes: To distribute items or responsibilities among recipients.

to compare — karşılaştırmak / kıyaslamak.exde: Wir vergleichen die Preise, bevor wir etwas kaufen.
to compare — karşılaştırmak / kıyaslamak.exen: We compare prices before buying something.
to compare — karşılaştırmak / kıyaslamak.notes: To compare; analyzing similarities and differences.

to prepare — hazırlamak / hazırlanmak.exde: Ich bereite mich gut vor, damit ich die Prüfung bestehe.
to prepare — hazırlamak / hazırlanmak.exen: I prepare well so that I pass the exam.
to prepare — hazırlamak / hazırlanmak.notes: To prepare in advance; reflexive for self-preparation.

to change / exchange — değiştirmek / tak.exde: Er wechselt oft seinen Job, weil er sich schnell langweilt.
to change / exchange — değiştirmek / tak.exen: He often changes jobs because he gets bored easily.
to change / exchange — değiştirmek / tak.notes: To change or exchange something; concrete substitution, not transformation (ändern).

to take turns — sırayla yapmak / nöbetle.exde: Wir wechseln uns ab, damit jeder mal eine Pause hat.
to take turns — sırayla yapmak / nöbetle.exen: We take turns so that everyone gets a break.
to take turns — sırayla yapmak / nöbetle.notes: To alternate or take turns; reciprocal action between people or tasks.

to cry — ağlamak.exde: Das Kind weint, weil es sein Spielzeug verloren hat.
to cry — ağlamak.exen: The child cries because it lost its toy.
to cry — ağlamak.notes: To cry or shed tears; emotional expression of sadness or relief.

to wish — dilemek / arzu etmek.exde: Ich wünsche, dass du bald gesund wirst.
to wish — dilemek / arzu etmek.exen: I wish that you get well soon.
to wish — dilemek / arzu etmek.notes: To wish or desire; expresses hope or goodwill.

to pull / move — çekmek / taşınmak / har.exde: Wir ziehen im Sommer nach München, weil ich dort arbeiten werde.
to pull / move — çekmek / taşınmak / har.exen: We’re moving to Munich in summer because I’ll work there.
to pull / move — çekmek / taşınmak / har.notes: To pull or move something along; wide metaphorical use (umziehen, beziehen).

to listen (attentively) — dikkatle dinle.exde: Bitte hör zu, wenn ich etwas erkläre.
to listen (attentively) — dikkatle dinle.exen: Please listen when I explain something.
to listen (attentively) — dikkatle dinle.notes: To listen attentively; implies focus and intention, unlike hören, which can be passive.

to agree — kabul etmek / onaylamak / ayn.exde: Ich stimme dir zu, weil du völlig recht hast.
to agree — kabul etmek / onaylamak / ayn.exen: I agree with you because you’re absolutely right.
to agree — kabul etmek / onaylamak / ayn.notes: To agree or consent; expresses intellectual or moral alignment, used with Dative.

to stay / remain — kalmak / devam etmek.exde: Wir bleiben heute zu Hause, da das Wetter so schlecht ist.
to stay / remain — kalmak / devam etmek.exen: We’re staying home today because the weather is so bad.
to stay / remain — kalmak / devam etmek.notes: To stay or remain; denotes persistence or continuity of state or location.

to work — çalışmak.exde: Ich arbeite an einem neuen Projekt, das nächste Woche fertig sein soll.
to work — çalışmak.exen: I’m working on a new project that should be finished next week.
to work — çalışmak.notes: To work or perform tasks; general term for productive activity or employment.

to discover — keşfetmek / bulmak.exde: Er hat entdeckt, dass jemand sein Passwort benutzt hat.
to discover — keşfetmek / bulmak.exen: He discovered that someone had used his password.
to discover — keşfetmek / bulmak.notes: To discover or uncover something previously unknown; intellectual or literal sense.

to pay — ödemek / parasını vermek.exde: Ich bezahle bar, weil die Karte nicht funktioniert.
to pay — ödemek / parasını vermek.exen: I’ll pay in cash because the card isn’t working.
to pay — ödemek / parasını vermek.notes: To pay for goods or services; action of giving compensation or settling a debt. Restoranda alisveriste genelde bunu kullan daha dogal. Daha cok fatura kira vs icin zahlen kullaniliyor.

to study — üniversitede okumak / öğrenim.exde: Sie studiert Medizin, weil sie Ärztin werden möchte.
to study — üniversitede okumak / öğrenim.exen: She studies medicine because she wants to become a doctor.
to study — üniversitede okumak / öğrenim.notes: To study formally at an institution; focused on higher education, unlike lernen.

to wait — beklemek.exde: Ich warte auf dich, bis du fertig bist.
to wait — beklemek.exen: I’ll wait for you until you’re ready.
to wait — beklemek.notes: To wait or expect patiently; often auf + Akk. for object of waiting.

to travel — seyahat etmek.exde: Wir reisen gern, um neue Kulturen kennenzulernen.
to travel — seyahat etmek.exen: We love traveling to get to know new cultures.
to travel — seyahat etmek.notes: To travel; emphasizes movement for experience, not daily commuting (fahren).

to increase — artırmak / yükseltmek.exde: Die Firma erhöht die Preise, obwohl die Kunden unzufrieden sind.
to increase — artırmak / yükseltmek.exen: The company raises prices even though customers are unhappy.
to increase — artırmak / yükseltmek.notes: To raise or increase something quantitatively; physical or abstract growth.

to consume — tüketmek / harcamak.exde: Das alte Auto verbraucht viel Benzin, daher wollen wir es verkaufen.
to consume — tüketmek / harcamak.exen: The old car uses a lot of fuel, so we want to sell it.
to consume — tüketmek / harcamak.notes: To use up or consume resources completely; focus on depletion. Means consuming or using up resources until they are depleted (fuel, energy, materials, supplies, water, time, electricity etc.). More technical than aufbrauchen (to finish completely) and different from verzehren (eat/drink), zu sich nehmen (ingest food/medicine) or konsumieren (consume goods/media, more economic tone). Focus on resource usage, not ingestion.

to surprise — şaşırtmak / sürpriz yapmak.exde: Ich möchte sie zum Geburtstag überraschen, aber sie ahnt schon etwas.
to surprise — şaşırtmak / sürpriz yapmak.exen: I want to surprise her for her birthday, but she already suspects something.
to surprise — şaşırtmak / sürpriz yapmak.notes: To surprise someone; positive or unexpected emotional effect.

to teach / instruct — öğretmek / ders ve.exde: Der Lehrer unterrichtet seit zwanzig Jahren an dieser Schule.
to teach / instruct — öğretmek / ders ve.exen: The teacher has taught at this school for twenty years.
to teach / instruct — öğretmek / ders ve.notes: To teach or instruct systematically; professional or educational context.

to manage / create — başarmak / yaratmak.exde: Ich habe es geschafft, pünktlich zu kommen, obwohl der Bus Verspätung hatte.
to manage / create — başarmak / yaratmak.exen: I managed to arrive on time even though the bus was late.
to manage / create — başarmak / yaratmak.notes: To manage, accomplish, or create; context decides between success (etwas schaffen) and creation (Gott schuf die Welt). Erschaffen is creating sth new, original, more artistic, inventive, stronger.

to discuss — görüşmek / konuşarak planla.exde: Wir besprechen das Problem morgen im Meeting.
to discuss — görüşmek / konuşarak planla.exen: We’ll discuss the problem tomorrow in the meeting.
to discuss — görüşmek / konuşarak planla.notes: To discuss details jointly; emphasizes coordination or planning.

to change — değiştirmek / farklı hale ge.exde: Ich ändere meine Meinung, wenn ich neue Informationen bekomme.
to change — değiştirmek / farklı hale ge.exen: I change my mind when I get new information.
to change — değiştirmek / farklı hale ge.notes: To change or modify; contrasts with wechseln, which replaces rather than alters.

to answer (a question) — cevaplamak / ya.exde: Ich beantworte deine E-Mail, sobald ich Zeit habe.
to answer (a question) — cevaplamak / ya.exen: I’ll reply to your email as soon as I have time.
to answer (a question) — cevaplamak / ya.notes: To answer a question or message; direct and concrete response.

to breathe — nefes almak.exde: Tief atmen hilft, wenn man gestresst ist.
to breathe — nefes almak.exen: Deep breathing helps when you’re stressed.
to breathe — nefes almak.notes: To breathe; basic biological action, literal or metaphorical for relief.

to meet / encounter — karşılaşmak / rast.exde: Ich bin ihm zufällig im Supermarkt begegnet.
to meet / encounter — karşılaşmak / rast.exen: I ran into him by chance at the supermarket.
to meet / encounter — karşılaşmak / rast.notes: To meet by chance; emphasizes unplanned encounter, with Dative.

to command — emretmek / buyurmak.exde: Der Offizier befiehlt, dass alle sofort zurückkehren.
to command — emretmek / buyurmak.exen: The officer orders everyone to return immediately.
to command — emretmek / buyurmak.notes: To command authoritatively; hierarchical direction, often military or formal.

to claim — iddia etmek / ileri sürmek.exde: Er behauptet, dass er es nicht wusste.
to claim — iddia etmek / ileri sürmek.exen: He claims that he didn’t know it.
to claim — iddia etmek / ileri sürmek.notes: To claim or assert; expresses stating something as true without proof.

to observe — gözlemlemek / izlemek.exde: Die Polizei beobachtet das Haus schon seit Tagen.
to observe — gözlemlemek / izlemek.exen: The police have been observing the house for days.
to observe — gözlemlemek / izlemek.notes: To observe attentively over time; stresses watching carefully, often for analysis. Bir seyin hareketini, davranisini vs dikkatlice izlemek, gozlemlemek. Betrachten ise sabit bir nesneyi dikkatli incelemek gibi. Mesela bir kedi var, kediyi beobachten yapmak hareketlerini, saga sola kosmasini, patisini yalamasini vs incelersin, betrachten de ise tuylerinin rengini, seklini, yuzunu gozunu kulagini tipini vs.

to advise — tavsiye vermek / danışmanlık.exde: Der Experte berät die Firma bei finanziellen Entscheidungen.
to advise — tavsiye vermek / danışmanlık.exen: The expert advises the company on financial decisions.
to advise — tavsiye vermek / danışmanlık.notes: To advise professionally or personally; involves giving recommendations. Means giving structured or expert advice, often professionally. Stronger and more formal than raten, which gives informal personal suggestions and can also mean “to guess.” Beraten = consult/give thorough advice; raten = suggest or guess.

to calculate — hesaplamak / hesap etmek.exde: Ich berechne, wie viel das alles insgesamt kostet.
to calculate — hesaplamak / hesap etmek.exen: I’m calculating how much all this costs in total.
to calculate — hesaplamak / hesap etmek.notes: To calculate precisely; deliberate computation, often for planning or finance.

to damage — zarar vermek / hasar vermek.exde: Der Sturm hat viele Autos beschädigt, die draußen standen.
to damage — zarar vermek / hasar vermek.exen: The storm damaged many cars that were parked outside.
to damage — zarar vermek / hasar vermek.notes: To damage or harm an object; physical or reputational impairment.

to visit/ attend — ziyaret etmek.exde: Wir besuchen unsere Großeltern jedes Wochenende.
to visit/ attend — ziyaret etmek.exen: We visit our grandparents every weekend.
to visit/ attend — ziyaret etmek.notes: To visit a person or place; social or touristic purpose, not residence.

to preserve / keep — korumak / muhafaza.exde: Ich bewahre alte Briefe auf, weil sie mich an meine Kindheit erinnern.
to preserve / keep — korumak / muhafaza.exen: I keep old letters because they remind me of my childhood.
to preserve / keep — korumak / muhafaza.notes: To preserve or keep safe from loss or change. Muhafaza etmek, kaybolmaktan, degismekten, bozulmaktan korumak, duygusal da olabilir, duygusal hatirasi olan bir seyi tutmak gibi. Sakinligini korumak da bewahren. Behalten ise elinde tutmak, saklamaya devam etmek, kendinde kalmasini saglamak (etw behalten:  akilda tutmak anlami da var) aufbewahren: kaldirip saklamak,uygun yerde muhafaza etmek, depolamak. belgeyi saklamak/ dolapta tutmak, yiyecekler, evrak dosya vs. dolaba cekmeceye kasaya vs. ornek: fotolari saklamak. behalten ise bende kalsin fotolar. bewahren ise duygusal anisi var. aufbewahren ise dolapta cekmecede tutuyorum.

to apply (for) — başvurmak / müracaat et.exde: Ich habe mich beworben, weil der Job perfekt zu mir passt.
to apply (for) — başvurmak / müracaat et.exen: I applied because the job suits me perfectly.
to apply (for) — başvurmak / müracaat et.notes: To apply for a position or opportunity; reflexive for job or school applications.

to move — hareket etmek / kımıldamak.exde: Ich bewege mich jeden Tag, damit ich gesund bleibe.
to move — hareket etmek / kımıldamak.exen: I exercise every day to stay healthy.
to move — hareket etmek / kımıldamak.notes: To move oneself or something; reflexive for bodily motion, also figurative for emotion.

to print — yazdırmak / basmak.exde: Ich drucke das Formular aus, bevor ich es unterschreibe.
to print — yazdırmak / basmak.exen: I print the form before signing it.
to print — yazdırmak / basmak.notes: To print using a machine; physical production of text or images.

to receive — teslim almak / karşılamak.exde: Wir haben gestern viele Gäste empfangen, weil mein Geburtstag war.
to receive — teslim almak / karşılamak.exen: We received many guests yesterday because it was my birthday.
to receive — teslim almak / karşılamak.notes: To receive formally or greet guests; can also mean to pick up broadcast signals.

to climb (fig./lit.) — tırmanmak / aşmak.exde: Er erklomm den Berg, obwohl das Wetter gefährlich war.
to climb (fig./lit.) — tırmanmak / aşmak.exen: He climbed the mountain even though the weather was dangerous.
to climb (fig./lit.) — tırmanmak / aşmak.notes: To climb with effort, literal or figurative; emphasizes difficulty and achievement.

to create — yaratmak / meydana getirmek.exde: Gott hat laut der Bibel die Welt erschaffen.
to create — yaratmak / meydana getirmek.exen: According to the Bible, God created the world.
to create — yaratmak / meydana getirmek.notes: To create something entirely new; creative or divine act. New and original, create from scratch.

to expect — beklemek / ummak.exde: Ich erwarte, dass du pünktlich bist.
to expect — beklemek / ummak.exen: I expect you to be on time.
to expect — beklemek / ummak.notes: To expect or await; combines anticipation with assumption. Erwarten' da hafif bir authoritative, bir demand tonu da var, mesela ailem 10 da evde olmami bekliyor. Duz bekleme degil de sanki gelmezsem sikinti cikarmis gibi. Rechnen mit ise daha az demand, kafada probability hesaplamak gibi, onun 10 da eve gelmesini bekliyorum u rechnen mit ile dersem 10 da gelir herhalde, otobuse falan binicek o saatte gelecek gibi dusundugum anlamina gelir, ciddi beklenti degil de kafada hesap. bu kelimedeki ornek cumlede de mesela demand var.

to force / compel — zorlamak / mecbur bı.exde: Er versuchte, das Ergebnis zu erzwingen, aber es gelang ihm nicht.
to force / compel — zorlamak / mecbur bı.exen: He tried to force the result, but he didn’t succeed.
to force / compel — zorlamak / mecbur bı.notes: To force or compel an outcome; achieved against resistance. Bir sonucu, olayi zorlamak, elde etmek icin, bir sonucu zorla elde etmek. Zaferi, aski, itirafi zorla elde etmek, verilen karari zorla dayatmak gibi. Bir sonuc var hedef, onu zorla elde etmek. zwingen ise BIRINI zorlamak. birini bir sey yapmaya zorlamak.

to be missing / lack — eksik olmak / yok.exde: Du fehlst mir, seit du weg bist.
to be missing / lack — eksik olmak / yok.exen: I miss you since you’ve been gone.
to be missing / lack — eksik olmak / yok.notes: To be missing or absent; also emotional sense “I miss you.”

to demand — talep etmek / istemek (güçlü.exen: The employees demand better working conditions.
to demand — talep etmek / istemek (güçlü.notes: To demand assertively; expresses right or necessity rather than request (bitten).

to promote / support — desteklemek / teş.exde: Die Regierung fördert junge Künstler mit Stipendien.
to promote / support — desteklemek / teş.exen: The government supports young artists with scholarships.
to promote / support — desteklemek / teş.notes: To support or promote growth, development, or talent.

to function / work — çalışmak / işlemesi.exde: Der Computer funktioniert nicht, obwohl er neu ist.
to function / work — çalışmak / işlemesi.exen: The computer doesn’t work, even though it’s new.
to function / work — çalışmak / işlemesi.notes: To function or work properly; mechanical or procedural success.

to apply / be valid — geçerli olmak / yü.exde: Diese Regel gilt auch für dich, selbst wenn du neu bist.
to apply / be valid — geçerli olmak / yü.exen: This rule applies to you too, even if you’re new.
to apply / be valid — geçerli olmak / yü.notes: To be valid or in force; also “to count as” or “apply to.”

to be enough — yeterli olmak / yetmek.exde: Ein kurzer Anruf genügt, um das Problem zu lösen.
to be enough — yeterli olmak / yetmek.exen: A short call is enough to solve the problem.
to be enough — yeterli olmak / yetmek.notes: To be sufficient or adequate; often Dativ for what is satisfied.

to greet — selamlamak / selam vermek.exde: Ich grüße meinen Nachbarn jedes Mal, wenn ich ihn sehe.
to greet — selamlamak / selam vermek.exen: I greet my neighbor every time I see him.
to greet — selamlamak / selam vermek.notes: To greet formally or courteously; verbal or nonverbal acknowledgment.

to hate — nefret etmek.exde: Sie hasst, früh aufzustehen, aber sie tut es trotzdem.
to hate — nefret etmek.exen: She hates getting up early, but she does it anyway.
to hate — nefret etmek.notes: To hate; strong emotional dislike or aversion.

to heal — iyileştirmek / şifa bulmak.exde: Die Wunde heilt schneller, wenn man sie sauber hält.
to heal — iyileştirmek / şifa bulmak.exen: The wound heals faster if you keep it clean.
to heal — iyileştirmek / şifa bulmak.notes: To heal or cure; restoration of health or wholeness.

to inform — bilgi vermek / bilgilendirme.exde: Ich informiere dich, sobald ich neue Details kenne.
to inform — bilgi vermek / bilgilendirme.exen: I’ll inform you as soon as I know new details.
to inform — bilgi vermek / bilgilendirme.notes: To inform or notify; to provide knowledge systematically.

to fight — savaşmak / mücadele etmek / k.exde: Die Menschen kämpfen für ihre Freiheit und gegen Ungerechtigkeit.
to fight — savaşmak / mücadele etmek / k.exen: The people fight for their freedom and against injustice.
to fight — savaşmak / mücadele etmek / k.case: für + Akk. / gegen + Akk. / um + Akk.
to fight — savaşmak / mücadele etmek / k.notes: To fight or struggle for/against; can be literal battle or figurative effort.

to clarify — açığa kavuşturmak / netleşt.exde: Wir müssen das Missverständnis klären, bevor es schlimmer wird.
to clarify — açığa kavuşturmak / netleşt.exen: We need to clarify the misunderstanding before it gets worse.
to clarify — açığa kavuşturmak / netleşt.notes: To clarify or resolve; focuses on explanation or solution.

to control / check — kontrol etmek / den.exde: Die Polizei kontrolliert heute den Verkehr an der Kreuzung.
to control / check — kontrol etmek / den.exen: The police are checking traffic at the intersection today.
to control / check — kontrol etmek / den.notes: To check or supervise; ensure correctness or compliance.

to cancel / quit — iptal etmek / işten a.exde: Er hat gekündigt, weil er ein besseres Angebot bekommen hat.
to cancel / quit — iptal etmek / işten a.exen: He quit because he got a better offer.
to cancel / quit — iptal etmek / işten a.notes: To resign, dismiss, or cancel; formal termination of job or contract.

to smile — gülümsemek.exde: Sie lächelt, wenn sie an ihre Kindheit denkt.
to smile — gülümsemek.exen: She smiles when she thinks about her childhood.
to smile — gülümsemek.notes: To smile; gentle positive expression, emotional nuance lighter than lachen.

to love — sevmek / aşık olmak.exde: Ich liebe dich, weil du mich immer zum Lachen bringst.
to love — sevmek / aşık olmak.exen: I love you because you always make me laugh.
to love — sevmek / aşık olmak.notes: To love; deep affection or preference.

to rent — kiralamak.exde: Wir mieten eine Wohnung, bis unser Haus fertig ist.
to rent — kiralamak.exen: We’re renting an apartment until our house is finished.
to rent — kiralamak.notes: To rent temporarily; paying for use without ownership.

to clean — temizlemek.exde: Ich putze jeden Samstag die Küche, damit sie sauber bleibt.
to clean — temizlemek.exen: I clean the kitchen every Saturday so it stays clean.
to clean — temizlemek.notes: To clean thoroughly; everyday hygiene or domestic cleaning.

to save / rescue — kurtarmak.exde: Der Feuerwehrmann hat das Kind aus dem Auto gerettet.
to save / rescue — kurtarmak.exen: The firefighter rescued the child from the car.
to save / rescue — kurtarmak.notes: To save or rescue from danger; literal or metaphorical salvation.

to collect — toplamak / biriktirmek.exde: Sie sammelt alte Münzen, seit sie klein war.
to collect — toplamak / biriktirmek.exen: She’s been collecting old coins since she was little.
to collect — toplamak / biriktirmek.notes: To collect systematically; hobby or purposeful accumulation.

to estimate / appreciate — tahmin etmek.exde: Ich schätze, dass er ungefähr dreißig Jahre alt ist.
to estimate / appreciate — tahmin etmek.exen: I estimate that he’s about thirty years old.
to estimate / appreciate — tahmin etmek.notes: To estimate or value; either approximation or appreciation (Ich schätze dich). Ich schätze dich: i value you, sana deger veriyorum

to give (as gift) — hediye etmek / verme.exde: Mein Vater schenkt mir ein Buch zum Geburtstag.
to give (as gift) — hediye etmek / verme.exen: My father gives me a book for my birthday.
to give (as gift) — hediye etmek / verme.notes: To give as a gift; emphasizes generosity, not transaction.

to scold — azarlamak / kızmak.exde: Die Mutter schimpft, weil die Kinder das Zimmer nicht aufgeräumt haben.
to scold — azarlamak / kızmak.exen: The mother scolds because the kids didn’t clean their room.
to scold — azarlamak / kızmak.notes: To scold or complain loudly; emotional verbal reaction.

to cut — kesmek.exde: Vorsicht, das Messer schneidet sehr scharf!
to cut — kesmek.exen: Careful, the knife cuts very sharply!
to cut — kesmek.notes: To cut or slice; precise separation, literal or editing sense.

to save (money) — biriktirmek / tasarruf.exde: Ich spare Geld, damit ich im Sommer reisen kann.
to save (money) — biriktirmek / tasarruf.exen: I’m saving money so I can travel in the summer.
to save (money) — biriktirmek / tasarruf.notes: To save resources, especially money or time, by restraint.

to disturb — rahatsız etmek / engel olma.exde: Bitte stör mich nicht, während ich arbeite.
to disturb — rahatsız etmek / engel olma.exen: Please don’t disturb me while I’m working.
to disturb — rahatsız etmek / engel olma.notes: To disturb or interrupt peace or focus.

to exchange / swap — değiş tokuş yapmak.exde: Wir tauschen unsere Plätze, damit du besser sehen kannst.
to exchange / swap — değiş tokuş yapmak.exen: We swap seats so you can see better.
to exchange / swap — değiş tokuş yapmak.notes: To exchange mutually; both parties give and receive.

to train / practice — antrenman yapmak /.exde: Er trainiert jeden Tag, um stärker zu werden.
to train / practice — antrenman yapmak /.exen: He trains every day to get stronger.
to train / practice — antrenman yapmak /.notes: To train or practice regularly for improvement; athletic or skill context.

to separate — ayrılmak / ayırmak.exde: Sie haben sich getrennt, weil sie zu verschieden waren.
to separate — ayrılmak / ayırmak.exen: They broke up because they were too different.
to separate — ayrılmak / ayırmak.notes: To separate or part; reflexive for personal relationships.

to interrupt — sözünü kesmek / ara verme.exde: Bitte unterbrich mich nicht, wenn ich spreche.
to interrupt — sözünü kesmek / ara verme.exen: Please don’t interrupt me when I’m speaking.
to interrupt — sözünü kesmek / ara verme.notes: To interrupt temporarily; pause or disrupt a process or person.

to sign — imzalamak.exde: Ich habe den Vertrag unterschrieben, nachdem ich ihn gelesen habe.
to sign — imzalamak.exen: I signed the contract after I read it.
to sign — imzalamak.notes: To sign a document; formal confirmation.

to connect — bağlamak / birleştirmek.exde: Der Arzt verbindet die Wunde sorgfältig.
to connect — bağlamak / birleştirmek.exen: The doctor bandages the wound carefully.
to connect — bağlamak / birleştirmek.notes: To connect or link physically or conceptually.

to earn / make money/ deserve — kazanma.exde: Er verdient gut, weil er viel Erfahrung hat.
to earn / make money/ deserve — kazanma.exen: He earns well because he has a lot of experience.
to earn / make money/ deserve — kazanma.notes: To earn through effort or merit; monetary or moral reward.

to leave — terk etmek / ayrılmak.exde: Ich habe das Haus verlassen, bevor es angefangen hat zu regnen.
to leave — terk etmek / ayrılmak.exen: I left the house before it started raining.
to leave — terk etmek / ayrılmak.notes: To leave or abandon; stronger emotional tone than gehen.

to miss (bus, etc.) — kaçırmak.exde: Ich habe den Bus verpasst, weil ich zu spät aufgestanden bin.
to miss (bus, etc.) — kaçırmak.exen: I missed the bus because I got up too late.
to miss (bus, etc.) — kaçırmak.notes: To miss (bus, chance); emphasizes lost opportunity.

to betray / reveal — ihanet etmek / ifşa.exde: Er verrät nie die Geheimnisse seiner Freunde.
to betray / reveal — ihanet etmek / ifşa.exen: He never betrays his friends’ secrets.
to betray / reveal — ihanet etmek / ifşa.notes: To betray or reveal a secret; breach of trust.

to try / attempt — denemek / teşebbüs et.exde: Ich versuche, gesünder zu essen, obwohl ich Schokolade liebe.
to try / attempt — denemek / teşebbüs et.exen: I’m trying to eat healthier, even though I love chocolate.
to try / attempt — denemek / teşebbüs et.notes: To try or attempt deliberately; intention with uncertainty of success.

to plan / intend — niyet etmek / planlam.exde: Wir haben vor, am Wochenende einen Ausflug zu machen.
to plan / intend — niyet etmek / planlam.exen: We plan to take a trip on the weekend.
to plan / intend — niyet etmek / planlam.notes: To plan or intend to do; personal future intention.

to warn — uyarmak / ikaz etmek.exde: Der Lehrer warnt die Schüler vor den Gefahren im Internet.
to warn — uyarmak / ikaz etmek.exen: The teacher warns the students about dangers on the internet.
to warn — uyarmak / ikaz etmek.notes: To warn or alert; preventative advice, vor + Dat..

to grow — büyümek / artmak.exde: Das Kind wächst so schnell, dass seine Kleidung kaum passt.
to grow — büyümek / artmak.exen: The child is growing so fast that his clothes hardly fit.
to grow — büyümek / artmak.notes: To grow or increase naturally; biological or figurative.

to pay — ödemek.exde: Ich zahle heute, und du kannst beim nächsten Mal übernehmen.
to pay — ödemek.exen: I’ll pay today, and you can take care of it next time.
to pay — ödemek.notes: To pay; general term for settling financial obligations (bezahlen may specify object).

to destroy — yıkmak / mahvetmek.exde: Das Feuer hat das ganze Gebäude zerstört.
to destroy — yıkmak / mahvetmek.exen: The fire destroyed the entire building.
to destroy — yıkmak / mahvetmek.notes: To destroy completely; stronger than beschädigen.

to form / create / educate — oluşturmak.exde: Kinder bilden schnell neue Freundschaften in der Schule.
to form / create / educate — oluşturmak.exen: Children form new friendships quickly at school.
to form / create / educate — oluşturmak.notes: To form, shape, or educate; physical creation or mental cultivation.

to invite — davet etmek / çağırmak.exde: Ich lade dich zum Essen ein, weil du mir geholfen hast.
to invite — davet etmek / çağırmak.exen: I invite you to dinner because you helped me.
to invite — davet etmek / çağırmak.notes: To invite; social or formal request to attend. (ich lade dich ein, ismarliyorum anlamina da gelir, ucretsiz davet.)

to happen / occur — olmak / meydana gelm.exde: Es geschah, während alle geschlafen haben.
to happen / occur — olmak / meydana gelm.exen: It happened while everyone was asleep.
to happen / occur — olmak / meydana gelm.notes: To happen or occur (formal); neutral tone, often impersonal.

to heat — ısıtmak.exde: Wir heizen das Haus mit Holz, weil es günstiger ist.
to heat — ısıtmak.exen: We heat the house with wood because it’s cheaper.
to heat — ısıtmak.notes: To heat; provide warmth or operate heating system.

to advise / guess — tavsiye etmek / tahm.exde: Ich rate dir, diese Entscheidung noch einmal zu überdenken.
to advise / guess — tavsiye etmek / tahm.exen: I advise you to reconsider this decision.
to advise / guess — tavsiye etmek / tahm.notes: To advise or guess; context determines logical vs. speculative sense. Rate mal, .. : take a guess, tahmin et ..

to tear / rip — yırtmak / koparmak.exde: Das Seil ist gerissen, als wir es gezogen haben.
to tear / rip — yırtmak / koparmak.exen: The rope tore when we pulled it.
to tear / rip — yırtmak / koparmak.notes: To tear, rip, or break apart something by force; can also mean be torn (Das Seil ist gerissen). Figurative for abrupt change.

should / to be supposed to — meli / malı.exde: Ich soll mehr Wasser trinken, sagt der Arzt.
should / to be supposed to — meli / malı.exen: I should drink more water, says the doctor.
should / to be supposed to — meli / malı.notes: Indicates obligation, expectation, or reported speech; external necessity or moral duty, unlike müssen (inner necessity).

to want — istemek.exde: Ich will heute nichts tun, sondern einfach nur entspannen.
to want — istemek.exen: I want to do nothing today, just relax.
to want — istemek.notes: Expresses desire or intention; personal will or plan, contrasts with mögen (liking).

to push / bump — itmek / çarpmak / tosla.exde: Ich bin gestoßen, als ich rückwärts gelaufen bin.
to push / bump — itmek / çarpmak / tosla.exen: I bumped into something while walking backward.
to push / bump — itmek / çarpmak / tosla.notes: To push, bump, or knock; physical or figurative confrontation (auf Widerstand stoßen). ist gestoßen = carpti.

to step / kick — adım atmak / tekmelemek.exde: Er tritt leise in das Zimmer, damit niemand ihn bemerkt.
to step / kick — adım atmak / tekmelemek.exen: He steps quietly into the room so no one notices him.
to step / kick — adım atmak / tekmelemek.notes: To step or kick; movement involving the foot or entering (in einen Raum treten).

to enter — girmek / adım atmak (bir yere.exde: Niemand darf das Gebäude betreten, bevor die Polizei kommt.
to enter — girmek / adım atmak (bir yere.exen: No one may enter the building before the police arrive.
to enter — girmek / adım atmak (bir yere.notes: To enter or step into; formal and transitive—requires a place as object.

to dry — kurutmak / kurmak (kurumak).exde: Die Wäsche trocknet schneller draußen als drinnen.
to dry — kurutmak / kurmak (kurumak).exen: The laundry dries faster outside than inside.
to dry — kurutmak / kurmak (kurumak).notes: To dry or make dry; transitive for causing drying, intransitive for becoming dry.

to draw — çizmek.exde: Mein Sohn zeichnet gern Tiere, während er Musik hört.
to draw — çizmek.exen: My son draws animals while listening to music.
to draw — çizmek.notes: To draw or sketch; literal artistic creation or figurative marking (Grenzen zeichnen).

to offer — sunmak / teklif etmek [bieten.exde: Dieses Hotel bietet einen tollen Blick auf das Meer.
to offer — sunmak / teklif etmek [bieten.exen: This hotel offers a great view of the sea.
to offer — sunmak / teklif etmek [bieten.notes: To offer or provide; commercial or opportunity context. This is more of 'to provide', anbieten is more of a offer to a person.

to offer — sunmak / teklif etmek [anbiet.exde: Die Firma bietet gute Arbeitsbedingungen an.
to offer — sunmak / teklif etmek [anbiet.exen: The company offers good working conditions.
to offer — sunmak / teklif etmek [anbiet.notes: To offer or propose something; emphasizes voluntary act, commercial or polite.

to turn (direction) — dönmek / yön değiş.exde: Du musst an der nächsten Kreuzung rechts abbiegen.
to turn (direction) — dönmek / yön değiş.exen: You have to turn right at the next intersection.
to turn (direction) — dönmek / yön değiş.notes: To turn off a road or direction; change physical or figurative course. Abbiegen: turning when viewpoint is the street you are leaving, einbiegen is the street you are entering. Abbiegen mostly used when you are inside the car, einbiegen to describe when you are outside and describing another car, so abbiegen more common. Ein Wagen biegt von der Hauptstraße ab und (biegt) in die Seitenstraße ein.

to forbid / ban — yasaklamak / engelleme.exde: Der Lehrer verbietet, im Unterricht das Handy zu benutzen.
to forbid / ban — yasaklamak / engelleme.exen: The teacher forbids using the phone in class.
to forbid / ban — yasaklamak / engelleme.notes: To forbid or ban; expresses authority or rule preventing action.

to forgive — affetmek / bağışlamak.exde: Bitte verzeih mir, dass ich zu spät gekommen bin.
to forgive — affetmek / bağışlamak.exen: Please forgive me for coming late.
to forgive — affetmek / bağışlamak.notes: To forgive an offense or mistake; emotional reconciliation, Dative of person.

to scare / be startled — korkutmak / kor.exde: Ich erschrecke leicht, wenn jemand plötzlich laut spricht.
to scare / be startled — korkutmak / kor.exen: I get startled easily when someone suddenly speaks loudly.
to scare / be startled — korkutmak / kor.notes: To frighten or be startled; transitive = cause fear, intransitive = become scared.

to succeed — başarmak / başarılı olmak.exde: Es ist mir gelungen, das Problem zu lösen.
to succeed — başarmak / başarılı olmak.exen: I managed to solve the problem.
to succeed — başarmak / başarılı olmak.notes: To succeed; emphasizes outcome achieved well, used impersonally (Es ist mir gelungen).

to fail — başaramamak / başarısız olmak.exde: Der Plan ist misslungen, obwohl wir alles vorbereitet hatten.
to fail — başaramamak / başarısız olmak.exen: The plan failed, even though we had prepared everything.
to fail — başaramamak / başarısız olmak.notes: To fail or go wrong; opposite of gelingen, impersonal with Dative.

to grab / seize — yakalamak / tutmak / k.exde: Sie griff nach ihrer Tasche, als das Telefon klingelte.
to grab / seize — yakalamak / tutmak / k.exen: She reached for her bag when the phone rang.
to grab / seize — yakalamak / tutmak / k.notes: To grasp or seize; quick or decisive motion, often nach + Dat. for reaching. Hizli, kararli, bilincli yakalama, kavrama hareketi. Nach ile kullanilinca kumandaya, bardaga uzanmak gibi. Kendi basina topu yakaladi/kavradi, kolundan sikica tutuyor, hirsiz polisi yakaladi vs.

to lift — kaldırmak.exde: Er hob den schweren Koffer, obwohl er Rückenschmerzen hatte.
to lift — kaldırmak.exen: He lifted the heavy suitcase even though he had back pain.
to lift — kaldırmak.notes: To lift or raise something; physical effort or improvement (das Niveau heben).

to tie / bind — bağlamak / birleştirmek.exde: Ich binde meine Schuhe, bevor ich rausgehe.
to tie / bind — bağlamak / birleştirmek.exen: I tie my shoes before I go out.
to tie / bind — bağlamak / birleştirmek.notes: To tie, bind, or connect; literal fastening or figurative attachment (Bindung).

to blow — üflemek / esmek.exde: Der Wind bläst so stark, dass die Fenster wackeln.
to blow — üflemek / esmek.exen: The wind blows so strongly that the windows shake.
to blow — üflemek / esmek.notes: To blow air or wind; literal act or musical context.

to fry / roast — kızartmak / pişirmek (t.exde: Sie brät das Fleisch in einer heißen Pfanne mit Öl.
to fry / roast — kızartmak / pişirmek (t.exen: She fries the meat in a hot pan with oil.
to fry / roast — kızartmak / pişirmek (t.notes: To fry or roast in fat; cooking by dry heat.

to feel / sense — hissetmek / duymak (du.exde: Ich empfinde große Freude, wenn ich Musik höre.
to feel / sense — hissetmek / duymak (du.exen: I feel great joy when I listen to music.
to feel / sense — hissetmek / duymak (du.notes: To feel or sense emotionally or physically; more sensitive than fühlen.

to invent — icat etmek / uydurmak.exde: Thomas Edison hat die Glühbirne erfunden.
to invent — icat etmek / uydurmak.exen: Thomas Edison invented the light bulb.
to invent — icat etmek / uydurmak.notes: To invent or come up with something new; creativity or innovation.

to ride (horse) — binmek / ata binmek.exde: Sie reitet jedes Wochenende im Wald.
to ride (horse) — binmek / ata binmek.exen: She rides in the forest every weekend.
to ride (horse) — binmek / ata binmek.notes: To ride an animal, usually a horse; literal or metaphorical for persistence (auf etwas reiten).

to hit / beat — vurmak / dövmek / çarpma.exde: Der Boxer schlägt seinen Gegner in der dritten Runde.
to hit / beat — vurmak / dövmek / çarpma.exen: The boxer hits his opponent in the third round.
to hit / beat — vurmak / dövmek / çarpma.notes: To hit or beat; physical strike or figurative defeat (Herz schlägt, jemanden schlagen).

to push / shove — itmek / sürmek / ileri.exde: Er schiebt das Fahrrad, weil die Kette gerissen ist.
to push / shove — itmek / sürmek / ileri.exen: He pushes the bike because the chain broke.
to push / shove — itmek / sürmek / ileri.notes: To push or move by applying force; smoother than stoßen, continuous motion.

to shoot — ateş etmek / vurmak / gol atm.exde: Der Spieler schießt den Ball ins Tor.
to shoot — ateş etmek / vurmak / gol atm.exen: The player shoots the ball into the goal.
to shoot — ateş etmek / vurmak / gol atm.notes: To shoot or fire a projectile; literal or figurative (Foto schießen = take a photo).

to melt — erimek / eritmek.exde: Das Eis ist geschmolzen, weil es zu warm war.
to melt — erimek / eritmek.exen: The ice melted because it was too warm.
to melt — erimek / eritmek.notes: To melt or dissolve due to heat; literal or figurative for emotional softening.

to sink — batmak / düşmek.exde: Die Temperatur sinkt jede Nacht unter null Grad.
to sink — batmak / düşmek.exen: The temperature drops below zero every night.
to sink — batmak / düşmek.notes: To sink, drop, or decline; describes downward movement or decrease, literal or figurative (Preise sinken).

to die — ölmek.exde: Sein Großvater ist gestorben, als er noch ein Kind war.
to die — ölmek.exen: His grandfather died when he was still a child.
to die — ölmek.notes: To die or perish; can mean literal death or the end of something figuratively.

to do / drive (activity) — yapmak / uğra.exde: Er treibt jeden Tag Sport, um fit zu bleiben.
to do / drive (activity) — yapmak / uğra.exen: He does sports every day to stay fit.
to do / drive (activity) — yapmak / uğra.notes: To drive, propel, or engage in an activity (Sport treiben); also to drift.

to force — zorlamak / mecbur bırakmak.exde: Niemand kann dich zwingen, etwas zu tun, was du nicht willst.
to force — zorlamak / mecbur bırakmak.exen: No one can force you to do something you don’t want.
to force — zorlamak / mecbur bırakmak.notes: To force someone to do something against their will; strong coercion. BIRINI bir sey yapmaya zorlamak, bir olayi, durumu, karari zorla elde etmeye calismak degil! O erzwingen

to suffer — acı çekmek / ıstırap duymak.exde: Viele Menschen leiden unter Stress im Alltag.
to suffer — acı çekmek / ıstırap duymak.exen: Many people suffer from stress in daily life.
to suffer — acı çekmek / ıstırap duymak.notes: To suffer physically or emotionally; often an + Dat. for illness, unter + Dat. for external problems.

to keep — saklamak / tutmak / korumak.exde: Ich behalte meine Meinung, bis ich alle Fakten kenne.
to keep — saklamak / tutmak / korumak.exen: I’ll keep my opinion until I know all the facts.
to keep — saklamak / tutmak / korumak.notes: To keep, retain, or remember; stresses continued possession or memory. Means to keep or retain something—an object, opinion, information, or possession. Focus on continued ownership or memory. Different from bewahren (to preserve/protect from loss), aufbewahren (to store safely), erhalten (to maintain formally or receive), and schützen (to protect from harm). Behalten = keep/retain; the others express protection, storage, or preservation.

to pass / consist — başarmak / oluşmak /.exde: Ich habe die Prüfung bestanden, obwohl sie sehr schwer war.
to pass / consist — başarmak / oluşmak /.exen: I passed the exam even though it was very difficult.
to pass / consist — başarmak / oluşmak /.case: auf + Dat. / aus + Dat. / in + Dat.
to pass / consist — başarmak / oluşmak /.notes: To exist, pass, or consist of; bestehen aus = be composed of, Prüfung bestehen = pass an exam.

to clear away — toplamak / kaldırmak (ma.exde: Nach dem Essen räumt er den Tisch ab.
to clear away — toplamak / kaldırmak (ma.exen: After eating, he clears the table.
to clear away — toplamak / kaldırmak (ma.notes: To clear away, especially dishes or a table after use.

to wash up / do the dishes — bulaşıkları.exde: Ich wasche das Geschirr ab, während du den Müll rausbringst.
to wash up / do the dishes — bulaşıkları.exen: I’ll wash the dishes while you take out the trash.
to wash up / do the dishes — bulaşıkları.notes: To wash dishes or surfaces with water; household context.

to recognize / acknowledge — tanımak / k.exde: Die Firma erkennt seine Leistungen endlich an.
to recognize / acknowledge — tanımak / k.exen: The company finally acknowledges his achievements.
to recognize / acknowledge — tanımak / k.notes: To recognize, acknowledge, or approve officially or morally; expresses acceptance or validation.

to assume / accept — kabul etmek / varsa.exde: Ich nehme an, dass du heute keine Zeit hast.
to assume / accept — kabul etmek / varsa.exen: I assume that you have no time today.
to assume / accept — kabul etmek / varsa.notes: To accept, assume, or adopt; flexible verb meaning to take physically or agree to an idea. Accepting an offer, package, suggestion etc.  Means to assume something as likely (annehmen, dass…) or to accept/take something (a gift, offer, idea). As an assumption verb it is stronger and more reasoned than vermuten (guess/suspect), but less certain than glauben (believe). Different from ausgehen von (firm working assumption) and erwarten (expect/demand).

to stop (vehicle) — durmak / durdurmak (.exde: Der Bus hält an, damit die Passagiere aussteigen können.
to stop (vehicle) — durmak / durdurmak (.exen: The bus stops so passengers can get off.
to stop (vehicle) — durmak / durdurmak (.notes: To stop or make halt; transitive = stop something, intransitive = come to a stop.

to try on (clothes) — üzerinde denemek /.exde: Ich probiere das Kleid an, bevor ich es kaufe.
to try on (clothes) — üzerinde denemek /.exen: I’ll try on the dress before buying it.
to try on (clothes) — üzerinde denemek /.notes: To try on clothes or accessories to check fit or appearance.

to register / sign up — kaydolmak / kayı.exde: Ich habe mich angemeldet, damit ich am Kurs teilnehmen kann.
to register / sign up — kaydolmak / kayı.exen: I registered so I can attend the course.
to register / sign up — kaydolmak / kayı.notes: To register or sign up; reflexive for self-enrollment or login.

to store / keep — saklamak / muhafaza et.exde: Ich bewahre alte Fotos in einer Kiste auf.
to store / keep — saklamak / muhafaza et.exen: I keep old photos in a box.
to store / keep — saklamak / muhafaza et.notes: To keep or store safely for future use; implies preservation.

to build up / set up — kurmak / oluşturm.exde: Sie bauen eine neue Brücke über den Fluss auf.
to build up / set up — kurmak / oluşturm.exen: They’re building a new bridge over the river.
to build up / set up — kurmak / oluşturm.notes: To build up or construct; physical structure or abstract development. Build up career derken de mesela aufbauen.

to explain / enlighten — açıklamak / bil.exde: Der Lehrer klärt die Schüler über die Regeln auf. Lass mich das aufklären.
to explain / enlighten — açıklamak / bil.exen: The teacher informs the students about the rules. Hemen yanlis anlasilmayi gidereyim.
to explain / enlighten — açıklamak / bil.notes: AYDINLATMAK, aciga kavusturmak. A ve B kisisi var, C de bir konu, A C yi acikliyor, (erklären), A B,yi C hakkinda (über) aydinlatiyor (aufklären) aldigi objekt acikladigi konu degil de aciklamasiyla aydinlattigi kisi. erklären da objekt acikladigi sey. onu acikladi: erklären,/// ogrencileri su konuda aydinlatti: aufklären über etw. . Supheli, bilinmeyen, yanlis anlasilan bir seyi acikliga kavusturmak. Bilinclendirmek anlami da var.  Erklären daki aciklamak anlami ise, anlatmak, izah etmek, daha gunluk.

sinirlenmek (ayar olmak), sinir etmek /.exde: Ich rege mich schnell auf, wenn jemand unhöflich ist.
sinirlenmek (ayar olmak), sinir etmek /.exen: I get upset quickly when someone is rude.
sinirlenmek (ayar olmak), sinir etmek /.notes: ayar, kil olmak, tadi tuzu kacmak, gerilmek, öfkeden köpürecek kadar sinirlenmek degil ama ayar olmak. Sinavdan once gerilmek. Bunlarin hepsi reflexive, kisinin kendi hissi. X beni ayar etti derken, o zaman reflexive degil, das regt mich auf, akkusativ. gunluk konusmada %99 reflexive ayar oldum, gerildim seyi kullaniliyor.

to express — ifade etmek / dile getirmek.exde: Er kann seine Gefühle nicht gut ausdrücken.
to express — ifade etmek / dile getirmek.exen: He can’t express his feelings well.
to express — ifade etmek / dile getirmek.notes: To express thoughts or emotions verbally or symbolically; literal pressing out for mechanical contexts.

to fail / be cancelled — iptal olmak / g.exde: Der Unterricht fällt morgen aus, weil der Lehrer krank ist.
to fail / be cancelled — iptal olmak / g.exen: The class is cancelled tomorrow because the teacher is sick.
to fail / be cancelled — iptal olmak / g.notes: To fail, be canceled, or turn out differently; emphasizes event not taking place. Ders, kurs, randevu, etkinlik iptal. Bulusacaktik, bulusma iptal oldu. Parti vardi, iptal oldu. Kalorifer bozuldu, internet surekli kesiliyor.

to be enough / suffice — yeterli olmak /.exde: Ein kleiner Betrag reicht aus, um das Ticket zu kaufen.
to be enough / suffice — yeterli olmak /.exen: A small amount is enough to buy the ticket.
to be enough / suffice — yeterli olmak /.notes: To be enough or sufficient; used for adequacy of resources or time. Means “to be enough / to suffice,” often for time, resources, or money. Slightly more formal and clearer than reichen (casual “that’s enough”) and less formal than genügen (“to suffice,” formal/written). Different from hinreichen, which is very formal/legal. Ausreichen = be sufficient; reichen = be enough (casual); genügen = suffice (formal). genügen can also be thought as meeting bottom requirements, barely enough while reichen is good positive sense.

to turn off / switch off — kapamak / dev.exde: Bitte schalte das Licht aus, wenn du gehst.
to turn off / switch off — kapamak / dev.exen: Please turn off the light when you leave.
to turn off / switch off — kapamak / dev.notes: To switch off or deactivate a device; opposite of einschalten.

to pronounce / express — telaffuz etmek.exde: Er spricht das Wort falsch aus, aber jeder versteht ihn trotzdem.
to pronounce / express — telaffuz etmek.exen: He pronounces the word wrong, but everyone still understands him.
to pronounce / express — telaffuz etmek.notes: To pronounce or express clearly; both linguistic and emotional articulation.

to end / finish — bitirmek / sonlandırma.exde: Wir beenden die Sitzung um 16 Uhr, damit alle pünktlich gehen können.
to end / finish — bitirmek / sonlandırma.exen: We finish the meeting at 4 p.m. so everyone can leave on time.
to end / finish — bitirmek / sonlandırma.notes: To end or finish something deliberately; transitive, intentional closure.

to be located / feel — bulunmak / hisset.exde: Das Hotel befindet sich direkt am Strand.
to be located / feel — bulunmak / hisset.exen: The hotel is located right by the beach.
to be located / feel — bulunmak / hisset.notes: To be located or to feel in a state; reflexive distinguishes physical location vs. well-being.

to occupy / enroll — yer almak / derse k.exde: Ich belege drei Kurse an der Universität.
to occupy / enroll — yer almak / derse k.exen: I’m taking three courses at university.
to occupy / enroll — yer almak / derse k.notes: To occupy, enroll, or cover; literal (a seat) or figurative (a course, evidence).

to reward — ödüllendirmek / mükafat verm.exde: Eltern sollten ihre Kinder belohnen, wenn sie etwas Gutes tun.
to reward — ödüllendirmek / mükafat verm.exen: Parents should reward their children when they do something good.
to reward — ödüllendirmek / mükafat verm.notes: To reward for effort or achievement; positive reinforcement, moral or material.

to inform / notify — haber vermek / bild.exde: Ich benachrichtige dich, sobald ich angekommen bin.
to inform / notify — haber vermek / bild.exen: I’ll notify you as soon as I arrive.
to inform / notify — haber vermek / bild.notes: To inform or notify formally; ensures that someone becomes aware. Kısa, net bir bilgi verirsin — kişinin sadece haberdar olması gerekir. Kisa mesaj, basit uyari.

to calm (oneself) — sakinleşmek / yatışt.exde: Nach dem Streit hat sie sich schnell wieder beruhigt.
to calm (oneself) — sakinleşmek / yatışt.exen: After the argument, she calmed down quickly.
to calm (oneself) — sakinleşmek / yatışt.notes: To calm or soothe; reflexive means regain composure.

to limit / restrict — sınırlamak / kısıt.exde: Wir beschränken uns auf das Wichtigste, um Zeit zu sparen.
to limit / restrict — sınırlamak / kısıt.exen: We’ll limit ourselves to the most important things to save time.
to limit / restrict — sınırlamak / kısıt.notes: To limit or restrict scope; reflexive implies self-restraint or focusing.

to insist on — ısrar etmek / diretmek.exde: Ich bestehe auf meiner Meinung, auch wenn niemand zustimmt.
to insist on — ısrar etmek / diretmek.exen: I insist on my opinion even if no one agrees.
to insist on — ısrar etmek / diretmek.notes: To insist on or demand firmly; auf + Dat., expresses persistence in opinion or right.

to decide / determine — belirlemek / kar.exde: Das Gesetz bestimmt, dass jeder Bürger wählen darf.
to decide / determine — belirlemek / kar.exen: The law states that every citizen has the right to vote.
to decide / determine — belirlemek / kar.notes: To determine, define, or decide authoritatively; used for rules, identity, or fate. Means to determine, define, or decide something authoritatively. Used for laws, rules, authorities, identity, or fate. Stronger and more official than entscheiden (choose, decide between options, everyday verb), sich entschließen (make up one’s mind, deciding after hesitation), and beschließen (formal group decision). Bestimmen = set or define from above.

to admire — hayran kalmak / beğenmek.exde: Ich bewundere Menschen, die nie aufgeben.
to admire — hayran kalmak / beğenmek.exen: I admire people who never give up.
to admire — hayran kalmak / beğenmek.notes: To admire or look up to; expresses appreciation or amazement.

to doubt — bir şeyin doğruluğundan şüphe.exde: Viele bezweifeln, dass die Reform erfolgreich sein wird.
to doubt — bir şeyin doğruluğundan şüphe.exen: Many doubt that the reform will be successful.
to doubt — bir şeyin doğruluğundan şüphe.notes: To doubt truth or accuracy; intellectual skepticism, not emotional uncertainty (zweifeln an).

to represent / depict — tasvir etmek / g.exde: Der Film stellt das Leben im 19. Jahrhundert realistisch dar.
to represent / depict — tasvir etmek / g.exen: The film depicts life in the 19th century realistically.
to represent / depict — tasvir etmek / g.notes: To depict, portray, or represent visually or conceptually. Means depicting or representing something visually or conceptually—films, images, diagrams, texts, or actors portraying roles. Stronger and more formal than zeigen (show) or beschreiben (describe); emphasizes portrayal or making something visible/ understandable.

to serve — hizmet etmek / yaramak.exde: Dieses Gerät dient zur Messung der Temperatur.
to serve — hizmet etmek / yaramak.exen: This device serves to measure temperature.
to serve — hizmet etmek / yaramak.notes: To serve a person, purpose, or function; Dativ object, can express usefulness.

to carry out / conduct — gerçekleştirmek.exde: Die Firma führt regelmäßig Schulungen durch, damit die Mitarbeiter auf dem neuesten Stand bleiben.
to carry out / conduct — gerçekleştirmek.exen: The company conducts regular trainings so that employees stay up to date.
to carry out / conduct — gerçekleştirmek.notes: To carry out or implement; systematic execution of plans or operations. Means carrying out something structured or planned from start to finish—trainings, inspections, tests, projects, surveys, measures. Implies systematic, often official execution. Stronger and more organized than simple machen or tun.

to be outraged — öfke duymak / tepki gös.exde: Viele Bürger empören sich, weil die Preise ständig steigen.
to be outraged — öfke duymak / tepki gös.exen: Many citizens are outraged because prices keep rising.
to be outraged — öfke duymak / tepki gös.notes: To be outraged or indignant; emotional reaction to injustice (über + Akk.).

to escape — kaçmak / kurtulmak.exde: Der Dieb ist entkommen, bevor die Polizei angekommen ist.
to escape — kaçmak / kurtulmak.exen: The thief escaped before the police arrived.
to escape — kaçmak / kurtulmak.notes: To escape or get away successfully; intransitive with Dative source (jdm entkommen).

to relax — rahatlamak / gevşemek.exde: Ich entspanne mich am liebsten, wenn ich Musik höre.
to relax — rahatlamak / gevşemek.exen: I relax best when I listen to music.
to relax — rahatlamak / gevşemek.notes: To relax or loosen tension; physical or mental unwinding.

to disappoint — hayal kırıklığına uğratm.exde: Der Film hat mich enttäuscht, weil ich mehr erwartet habe.
to disappoint — hayal kırıklığına uğratm.exen: The movie disappointed me because I expected more.
to disappoint — hayal kırıklığına uğratm.notes: To disappoint expectations; emotional sense of unfulfilled hope.

to experience / find out — deneyimlemek.exde: Ich habe erfahren, dass sie nächste Woche heiraten wird.
to experience / find out — deneyimlemek.exen: I found out that she’s getting married next week.
to experience / find out — deneyimlemek.notes: To experience or learn through information; discovery via experience or report. Duydum ki, ogrendim ki, gibi kalip. Herausfinden aktif olarak arastirip ogrenmek.

to astonish — şaşırtmak / hayrete düşürm.exde: Es erstaunt mich, dass du so früh aufgestanden bist.
to astonish — şaşırtmak / hayrete düşürm.exen: It amazes me that you got up so early.
to astonish — şaşırtmak / hayrete düşürm.notes: To astonish or amaze someone; evokes strong surprise or admiration. Vay be dedirtici sasirma, hayranlik, takdir, etkilenmek. Sich wundern normal sasirma, hadi ya, aa? Gibi. Notr saskinlik.

to hold on / hold tight — tutmak / sıkı.exde: Bitte halt dich fest, während der Bus fährt.
to hold on / hold tight — tutmak / sıkı.exen: Please hold on while the bus is moving.
to hold on / hold tight — tutmak / sıkı.notes: To hold firmly or retain; literal gripping or maintaining a principle.

to set / define — belirlemek / kararlaşt.exde: Wir legen heute die Regeln fest, damit es später keine Verwirrung gibt.
to set / define — belirlemek / kararlaşt.exen: We’ll set the rules today so there’s no confusion later.
to set / define — belirlemek / kararlaşt.notes: To set, define, or establish fixed terms or rules; emphasizes determination and clarity. Bir kural, tarih, plani NET bir sekilde belirlemek. Hedef koymak da olabilir, bir hedefim var kafada onu net belirledim gibi. Feststellen: bir sey vardi, bilmiyordun, onu kesfettin, analiz ile. festlegen: bir seyi kendin kararlastirman, bir seyin kararlasitirlmasi.

to determine / find out — tespit etmek /.exde: Der Arzt hat festgestellt, dass ich eine Allergie habe.
to determine / find out — tespit etmek /.exen: The doctor found out that I have an allergy.
to determine / find out — tespit etmek /.notes: To determine, find out, or state officially; emphasizes confirmation after observation or checking. Kontrol, test, analiz sonrasi tespit etme, bilinmeyen bir seyi. Onceden bilinmeyen bir seyi ogrenmek.

to approve / permit — onaylamak / izin v.exde: Die Behörde hat den Bau des neuen Hauses genehmigt.
to approve / permit — onaylamak / izin v.exen: The authorities approved the construction of the new house.
to approve / permit — onaylamak / izin v.notes: To approve or authorize formally; used in official or bureaucratic contexts.

to shape / design — şekillendirmek / tas.exde: Er gestaltet seine Präsentation so, dass sie spannend bleibt.
to shape / design — şekillendirmek / tas.exen: He designs his presentation so that it remains engaging.
to shape / design — şekillendirmek / tas.notes: To shape, design, or organize; artistic or creative structuring of form or content. Bir şeyi tasarlamak, biçimlendirmek veya düzenlemek; hem estetik hem içerik hem de yapı üzerinde şekil verme anlamı taşır. Entwerfen taslak hazırlamak; designen modern/grafik tasarım; formen fiziksel şekil vermek; ausarbeiten detaylandırmak; erstellen üretmek/oluşturmak anlamındadır. Gestalten bunların hepsinden daha geniştir ve içerik + form + düzen bütününü kapsar.

to produce / manufacture — üretmek / ima.exde: Diese Firma stellt hochwertige Möbel her.
to produce / manufacture — üretmek / ima.notes: To manufacture or produce; large-scale or professional creation of products.

to prevent / stop — engel olmak / mani o.exde: Der Regen hindert uns daran, heute draußen zu grillen.
to prevent / stop — engel olmak / mani o.exen: The rain prevents us from grilling outside today.
to prevent / stop — engel olmak / mani o.notes: To hinder or prevent progress; focuses on obstruction, often an + Dat..

to knock — kapıyı çalmak / vurmak.exde: Jemand klopft an die Tür, aber niemand öffnet.
to knock — kapıyı çalmak / vurmak.exen: Someone knocks on the door, but no one opens it.
to knock — kapıyı çalmak / vurmak.notes: To knock or tap repeatedly; literal knocking on doors or beating rhythmically.

to cool — soğutmak / serinletmek.exde: Du solltest die Getränke kühlen, bevor die Gäste kommen.
to cool — soğutmak / serinletmek.exen: You should cool the drinks before the guests arrive.
to cool — soğutmak / serinletmek.notes: To cool or chill; lower temperature for preservation or comfort.

to deny — inkar etmek / reddetmek.exde: Er leugnet, dass er etwas mit dem Vorfall zu tun hat.
to deny — inkar etmek / reddetmek.exen: He denies having anything to do with the incident.
to deny — inkar etmek / reddetmek.notes: To deny facts or accusations; direct contradiction of truth.

to delete / extinguish — silmek / söndür.exde: Ich habe die falsche Datei gelöscht, obwohl ich sie behalten wollte.
to delete / extinguish — silmek / söndür.exen: I deleted the wrong file even though I wanted to keep it.
to delete / extinguish — silmek / söndür.notes: To delete, erase, or extinguish; removing data, fire, or traces completely.

to notice / remember — fark etmek / aklı.exde: Merk dir, was ich dir gesagt habe, es ist wichtig.
to notice / remember — fark etmek / aklı.exen: Remember what I told you, it’s important.
to notice / remember — fark etmek / aklı.notes: To notice or remember; reflexive form = memorize intentionally. Active memorization, active effort to remember . Merken akilda tutmak, unutmamak, gelecege donuk hafizada tutmak, erinnern hatirlamak, einprägen ise kafaya kaziyacak derecede ezberlemek. mesela telefon numarasini, adresi akilda tutmak merken, sinav icin konulari ezberlemek einprägen

to inquire / ask — soru sormak / bilgi a.exde: Ich frage noch einmal nach, um sicherzugehen, dass alles stimmt.
to inquire / ask — soru sormak / bilgi a.exen: I’ll ask again to make sure everything is correct.
to inquire / ask — soru sormak / bilgi a.notes: To inquire or ask again for confirmation; ensures understanding or detail.

to catch up on — telafi etmek / yetişmek.exde: Ich hole den verpassten Unterricht nächste Woche nach.
to catch up on — telafi etmek / yetişmek.exen: I’ll make up for the missed lesson next week.
to catch up on — telafi etmek / yetişmek.notes: To catch up or make up for missed activities; delayed completion.

to prove / show — kanıtlamak / göstermek.exde: Der Wissenschaftler hat nachgewiesen, dass die Theorie stimmt.
to prove / show — kanıtlamak / göstermek.exen: The scientist proved that the theory is correct.
to prove / show — kanıtlamak / göstermek.notes: To prove or demonstrate with evidence; scientific or factual verification.

to organize — düzenlemek / organize etme.exde: Wir organisieren eine Party, obwohl wir kaum Zeit haben.
to organize — düzenlemek / organize etme.exen: We’re organizing a party even though we hardly have time.
to organize — düzenlemek / organize etme.notes: To organize or arrange; methodical coordination of events or processes.

to present — sunmak / tanıtmak.exde: Der Manager präsentiert morgen das neue Konzept.
to present — sunmak / tanıtmak.exen: The manager will present the new concept tomorrow.
to present — sunmak / tanıtmak.notes: To present formally or visually; structured showing for audience or report.

to swallow — yutmak.exde: Das Kind schluckt die Medizin, obwohl sie bitter schmeckt.
to swallow — yutmak.exen: The child swallows the medicine even though it tastes bitter.
to swallow — yutmak.notes: To swallow physically; also figurative for enduring silently (Kritik schlucken).

to feel / sense — hissetmek / algılamak.exde: Ich spüre, dass etwas nicht stimmt.
to feel / sense — hissetmek / algılamak.notes: To feel or sense emotionally or physically; intuitive perception.

to be amazed — şaşırmak / hayran kalmak.exde: Ich staune, wie gut du Deutsch sprichst!
to be amazed — şaşırmak / hayran kalmak.exen: I am amazed at how well you speak German!
to be amazed — şaşırmak / hayran kalmak.notes: To be amazed or wonder in surprise; positive astonishment. Bu INTRANSITIV, kisi kendi sasirir, sasirdim, sasirdi gibi. Erstaunen'de biri/ bir sey beni sasirtiyor. (ya da birini sasirtiyor). Yani, fark sasirmak ve sasirTmak. Sasirtmak erstaunen, sasirmak staunen.

to sound (like) — ses çıkarmak / tınlama.exde: Seine Stimme tönt sehr freundlich, wenn er spricht.
to sound (like) — ses çıkarmak / tınlama.exen: His voice sounds very friendly when he speaks.
to sound (like) — ses çıkarmak / tınlama.notes: To sound or have a tone; quality of voice or acoustic impression.

to check / verify — kontrol etmek / doğr.exde: Bitte überprüfen Sie Ihre Angaben, bevor Sie das Formular abschicken.
to check / verify — kontrol etmek / doğr.exen: Please check your information before submitting the form.
to check / verify — kontrol etmek / doğr.notes: To check or verify for accuracy; re-examining correctness or truth.

to convince — ikna etmek / inandırmak.exde: Sie hat mich überzeugt, dass es die richtige Entscheidung ist.
to convince — ikna etmek / inandırmak.exen: She convinced me that it’s the right decision.
to convince — ikna etmek / inandırmak.notes: To convince or persuade; intellectual or emotional reasoning to cause belief.

to converse — sohbet etmek / eğlendirmek.exde: Wir haben uns gestern lange über alte Zeiten unterhalten.
to converse — sohbet etmek / eğlendirmek.exen: We talked for a long time yesterday about old times.
to converse — sohbet etmek / eğlendirmek.notes: To converse or entertain; reflexive for chatting, non-reflexive for providing amusement.

to say goodbye — veda etmek / ayrılmak.exde: Nach dem Essen haben wir uns verabschiedet und sind gegangen.
to say goodbye — veda etmek / ayrılmak.exen: After dinner, we said goodbye and left.
to say goodbye — veda etmek / ayrılmak.notes: To say goodbye or pass officially (law); reflexive = taking leave.

to change — değişmek / farklı hale gelme.exde: Die Stadt hat sich verändert, seit ich dort war.
to change — değişmek / farklı hale gelme.exen: The city has changed since I was there.
to change — değişmek / farklı hale gelme.notes: To change or transform; reflexive for undergoing alteration, broader than wechseln.

to agree / arrange — anlaşmak / kararlaş.exde: Wir haben vereinbart, uns morgen um zehn zu treffen.
to agree / arrange — anlaşmak / kararlaş.exen: We agreed to meet tomorrow at ten.
to agree / arrange — anlaşmak / kararlaş.notes: To agree upon or arrange a meeting; structured or contractual agreement. Abmachen da kullanilabilir, o daha gunluk arkadaslar arasi konusmaya daha uygun. Abmachen ve vereinbaren %99 ayni, vereinbaren daha resmi. Vereinbaren ayrica sadece ileriki zaman planlari degil, ayrica fiyatlar kararlastirildi, yeni madde kararlastirildi vs. de olabilir. yani turkcedeki kararlastirmak gibi, genelde resmi, nötr, bir fiil. abmachen daha samimi. ozet: verabreden: bulusalim mi? tarzi sosyal anlasma, abmachen: 'hadi boyle yapalim' gunluk anlasma, vereinbaren: 'soyle karar aldik, anlastik' tarzi notr/resmi anlasma

to prevent — önlemek / engel olmak.exde: Ein Sicherheitsgurt verhindert, dass man sich bei einem Unfall verletzt.
to prevent — önlemek / engel olmak.exen: A seatbelt prevents injury in an accident.
to prevent — önlemek / engel olmak.notes: To prevent or stop from happening; proactive avoidance. bi olayin, eventin gerceklesmesine engel olmak, kisiye engel olmak ise hindern

to publish — yayınlamak / yayımlamak.exde: Der Autor hat ein neues Buch veröffentlicht, das sehr erfolgreich wurde.
to publish — yayınlamak / yayımlamak.exen: The author published a new book that became very successful.
to publish — yayınlamak / yayımlamak.notes: To publish or make public; written, digital, or formal dissemination.

to cause — neden olmak / sebep olmak.exde: Das schlechte Wetter hat viele Verspätungen verursacht.
to cause — neden olmak / sebep olmak.exen: The bad weather caused many delays.
to cause — neden olmak / sebep olmak.notes: To cause or bring about; neutral cause–effect link, often negative context.

to refer — atıfta bulunmak / göndermek /.exde: Der Lehrer verweist auf die Regeln, wenn Schüler zu laut sind.
to refer — atıfta bulunmak / göndermek /.exen: The teacher refers to the rules when students are too loud.
