to refer — atıfta bulunmak / göndermek /.notes: To refer to, expel, or point toward; meaning shifts by context (academic, disciplinary, textual).

to prevent / avert — önlem almak / engel.notes: To prevent proactively; often Krankheiten vorbeugen, preventive action.

to be present / exist — mevcut olmak / b.exde: Wenn neue Informationen vorliegen, werden wir sie mitteilen.
to be present / exist — mevcut olmak / b.exen: If new information is available, we’ll share it.
to be present / exist — mevcut olmak / b.notes: To be available or present as a fact; often used officially (Dokument liegt vor).

to contradict — karşı çıkmak / itiraz et.exde: Ich widerspreche dir nicht gern, aber diesmal liegst du falsch.
to contradict — karşı çıkmak / itiraz et.exen: I don’t like to contradict you, but this time you’re wrong.
to contradict — karşı çıkmak / itiraz et.notes: To contradict or oppose verbally; Dative of person disagreed with.

to break (into pieces) — kırılmak / parç.exde: Das Glas ist zerbrochen, als es auf den Boden gefallen ist.
to break (into pieces) — kırılmak / parç.exen: The glass broke when it fell on the floor.
to break (into pieces) — kırılmak / parç.notes: To break into pieces; physically or emotionally shatter.

to prepare (food) — yemek hazırlamak / h.exde: Meine Mutter bereitet das Essen mit frischen Zutaten zu.
to prepare (food) — yemek hazırlamak / h.exen: My mother prepares the meal with fresh ingredients.
to prepare (food) — yemek hazırlamak / h.notes: To prepare food; culinary process distinct from general vorbereiten.

to increase / gain weight — artmak / kil.exde: Ich habe zugenommen, weil ich zu viel Schokolade gegessen habe.
to increase / gain weight — artmak / kil.exen: I gained weight because I ate too much chocolate.
to increase / gain weight — artmak / kil.notes: To increase or gain (weight, numbers, intensity); opposite of abnehmen.

to doubt — bir şeyden şüphe etmek / emin.exde: Ich zweifle, ob das wirklich eine gute Idee ist.
to doubt — bir şeyden şüphe etmek / emin.exen: I doubt whether that’s really a good idea.
to doubt — bir şeyden şüphe etmek / emin.notes: To doubt; emotional or spiritual uncertainty, an + Dat..

to feel — hissetmek / kendini ... hisset.exde: Ich fühle mich heute nicht so gut, deshalb bleibe ich zu Hause.
to feel — hissetmek / kendini ... hisset.exen: I don’t feel so well today, so I’ll stay home.
to feel — hissetmek / kendini ... hisset.notes: To feel physically or emotionally; reflexive = experience personal state.

to underline / emphasize — altını çizmek.exde: Er unterstreicht, wie wichtig Bildung für alle ist.
to underline / emphasize — altını çizmek.exen: He emphasizes how important education is for everyone.
to underline / emphasize — altını çizmek.notes: To underline literally or emphasize figuratively.

to correspond / match — uygun olmak / ka.exde: Das Ergebnis entspricht nicht unseren Erwartungen.
to correspond / match — uygun olmak / ka.exen: The result does not meet our expectations.
to correspond / match — uygun olmak / ka.notes: To correspond or comply with something; Dat., alignment with expectations.

to get to know / meet — tanımak / tanışm.exde: Ich habe sie kennengelernt, als ich in Berlin gearbeitet habe.
to get to know / meet — tanımak / tanışm.exen: I met her when I worked in Berlin.
to get to know / meet — tanımak / tanışm.notes: To get to know or meet for the first time; beginning of acquaintance.

to look at / watch — bakmak / izlemek /.exde: Wir sehen uns heute Abend die neue Serie an.
to look at / watch — bakmak / izlemek /.exen: We’re watching the new series tonight.
to look at / watch — bakmak / izlemek /.notes: To look at attentively or judge by appearance; active observation.

to look at / watch — bakmak / seyretmek.exde: Ich schaue mir gern alte Fotos an, wenn ich nostalgisch bin.
to look at / watch — bakmak / seyretmek.exen: I like looking at old photos when I feel nostalgic.
to look at / watch — bakmak / seyretmek.notes: To look at or watch carefully; nearly interchangeable with ansehen, more casual.

to visit / tour (a place) — gezmek / ziy.exde: Wir besichtigen morgen das Schloss Neuschwanstein.
to visit / tour (a place) — gezmek / ziy.notes: To visit or tour places of interest; sightseeing or inspection context.

to paint / varnish — boyamak / cilalamak.exde: Er lackiert sein Auto, weil der alte Lack beschädigt ist.
to paint / varnish — boyamak / cilalamak.exen: He paints his car because the old paint is damaged.
to paint / varnish — boyamak / cilalamak.notes: To paint or varnish with a protective or decorative layer. Anstreichen geniş yüzeyleri (duvar, çit, tavan) normal boya ile boyamak demektir. Lackieren ise vernikli, parlak veya dayanıklı kaplama uygulamak için kullanılır (mobilya, metal, araba, tırnak). Kullanılan boya türü ve amaç tamamen farklıdır.

to paint (art) — resim yapmak / boyamak.exde: Das Kind malt ein buntes Bild für seine Mutter.
to paint (art) — resim yapmak / boyamak.exen: The child paints a colorful picture for his mother.
to paint (art) — resim yapmak / boyamak.notes: To paint artistically using colors; creative expression on surfaces.

to turn on / switch on — açmak (ışık, ci.exde: Er macht das Licht an, weil es schon dunkel ist.
to turn on / switch on — açmak (ışık, ci.exen: He turns on the light because it’s already dark.
to turn on / switch on — açmak (ışık, ci.notes: To turn on devices or flirt casually; literal or slang depending on context. Also to dress the salad.

to close — kapamak / kapatmak.exde: Bitte mach das Fenster zu, sonst wird es kalt.
to close — kapamak / kapatmak.exen: Please close the window, otherwise it will get cold.
to close — kapamak / kapatmak.notes: To close or shut something; everyday use, informal for schließen.

to open — açmak [öffnen].exde: Er öffnet die Tür langsam, um niemanden zu wecken.
to open — açmak [öffnen].exen: He opens the door slowly to not wake anyone.
to open — açmak [öffnen].notes: To open physically or metaphorically (sein Herz öffnen).

to open — açmak [aufmachen].exde: Ich mache die Tür auf, damit frische Luft hereinkommt.
to open — açmak [aufmachen].exen: I open the door so that fresh air can come in.
to open — açmak [aufmachen].notes: To open up; opposite of zumachen, informal everyday use.

to plan / provide for — planlamak / öngö.exde: Das Programm sieht vor, dass alle Teilnehmer pünktlich erscheinen.
to plan / provide for — planlamak / öngö.exen: The program provides that all participants must arrive on time.
to plan / provide for — planlamak / öngö.notes: To plan or provide for in advance; anticipation or scheduling. Kurum, düzen, program, kararlar bunu ongoruyor, planliyor, oyle gerektiriyor. Planen gunluk hayattaki plan yapmak. Vorsehen resmi ve sistematik.

to switch on / turn on — açmak / çalıştı.exde: Ich schalte den Fernseher ein, nachdem ich gegessen habe.
to switch on / turn on — açmak / çalıştı.exen: I turn on the TV after I’ve eaten.
to switch on / turn on — açmak / çalıştı.notes: To switch on or activate; standard neutral term for devices or processes.

to smoke — sigara içmek / tütün kullanma.exde: Er raucht nur, wenn er gestresst ist, aber er möchte aufhören.
to smoke — sigara içmek / tütün kullanma.exen: He smokes only when he’s stressed, but he wants to quit.
to smoke — sigara içmek / tütün kullanma.notes: To smoke tobacco or emit smoke; habitual or physical action.

to occur / come to mind — akla gelmek /.exde: Mir ist eingefallen, dass ich meine Schlüssel zu Hause vergessen habe.
to occur / come to mind — akla gelmek /.exen: It occurred to me that I forgot my keys at home.
to occur / come to mind — akla gelmek /.notes: To occur or come to mind suddenly; spontaneous thought or idea (Mir fällt ein…). Bir anda aklina gelmek. Mir fallt ein kullanilmaz, mir ist eingefallen denir cunku aklima geldi kalibi kendiliginden gecmis zaman

to take part / participate — katılmak /.exde: Ich nehme an dem Kurs teil, weil ich mein Deutsch verbessern will.
to take part / participate — katılmak /.exen: I take part in the course because I want to improve my German.
to take part / participate — katılmak /.notes: To take part or participate; active involvement, usually an + Dat..

to appear / show up — görünmek / ortaya.exde: Sein neuer Roman erscheint nächste Woche im Handel.
to appear / show up — görünmek / ortaya.exen: His new novel will be published in stores next week.
to appear / show up — görünmek / ortaya.notes: To appear, show up, or be published; literal presence or media release.

to comb (one’s hair) — saçını taramak.exde: Sie kämmt sich die Haare, bevor sie zur Arbeit geht.
to comb (one’s hair) — saçını taramak.exen: She combs her hair before going to work.
to comb (one’s hair) — saçını taramak.notes: To comb hair; reflexive for personal grooming.

to teach / show — öğretmek / birine bir.exde: Mein Vater hat mir das Schwimmen beigebracht, als ich klein war.
to teach / show — öğretmek / birine bir.exen: My father taught me to swim when I was little.
to teach / show — öğretmek / birine bir.notes: To teach or show practically; informal, focuses on imparting a skill.

to cough — öksürmek.exde: Er hustet stark, deshalb bleibt er heute zu Hause.
to cough — öksürmek.exen: He is coughing badly, so he’s staying home today.
to cough — öksürmek.notes: To cough; physical reflex or symptom.

to hurry — acele etmek.exde: Beeil dich!, sonst verpassen wir den Zug.
to hurry — acele etmek.exen: Hurry up! Otherwise, we’ll miss the train.
to hurry — acele etmek.notes: To hurry or make haste; reflexive emphasizes self-directed speed.

to taste — tadına bakmak / lezzetli olma.exde: Das Essen schmeckt so gut, dass ich noch eine Portion möchte.
to taste — tadına bakmak / lezzetli olma.exen: The food tastes so good that I’d like another portion.
to taste — tadına bakmak / lezzetli olma.notes: To taste or have flavor; Dat. subject feels the taste (Es schmeckt mir).

to report / display / show — bildirmek /.exde: Ich zeige den Diebstahl bei der Polizei an.
to report / display / show — bildirmek /.exen: I report the theft to the police.
to report / display / show — bildirmek /.notes: To report or display; legal reporting or screen indication.

to log out / deregister — kaydını silmek.exde: Ich habe mich von dem Newsletter abgemeldet, weil ich zu viele E-Mails bekam.
to log out / deregister — kaydını silmek.exen: I unsubscribed from the newsletter because I got too many emails.
to log out / deregister — kaydını silmek.notes: To log off or deregister; reflexive = sign oneself out formally.

to wake up — uyanmak.exde: Ich bin aufgewacht, bevor der Wecker geklingelt hat.
to wake up — uyanmak.exen: I woke up before the alarm went off.
to wake up — uyanmak.notes: To wake up; intransitive moment of becoming awake.

to get off (vehicle) — inmek (araçtan).exde: Wir steigen an der nächsten Haltestelle aus.
to get off (vehicle) — inmek (araçtan).exen: We get off at the next stop.
to get off (vehicle) — inmek (araçtan).notes: To get out of a vehicle; literal exit, opposite of einsteigen.

to get in / board — binmek (araca).exde: Steig schnell ein, der Zug fährt gleich los!
to get in / board — binmek (araca).exen: Get in quickly, the train is leaving soon!
to get in / board — binmek (araca).notes: To get in or board a vehicle; begin journey or participation.

to change (trains, buses) — aktarma yapm.exde: In Frankfurt müssen wir umsteigen, um nach Berlin zu kommen.
to change (trains, buses) — aktarma yapm.exen: In Frankfurt we have to change trains to get to Berlin.
to change (trains, buses) — aktarma yapm.notes: To change trains/buses; transfer between transport modes.

to cooperate / work with — birlikte çalı.exde: Sie arbeitet an dem Projekt mit, obwohl sie eigentlich im Urlaub ist.
to cooperate / work with — birlikte çalı.exen: She is cooperating on the project even though she’s technically on vacation.
to cooperate / work with — birlikte çalı.notes: To cooperate or work jointly; contribute as part of a team.

to continue working — çalışmaya devam et.exde: Nach der Pause arbeite ich weiter, bis ich fertig bin.
to continue working — çalışmaya devam et.exen: After the break, I keep working until I’m done.
to continue working — çalışmaya devam et.notes: To continue working; resume after interruption.

to get along — iyi geçinmek / anlaşmak.exde: Wir verstehen uns gut, obwohl wir oft anderer Meinung sind.
to get along — iyi geçinmek / anlaşmak.exen: We get along well, even though we often have different opinions.
to get along — iyi geçinmek / anlaşmak.notes: To get along with; reflexive, mutual understanding or harmony.

to spend (money) — harcamak / para harca.exde: Ich habe zu viel Geld für Kleidung ausgegeben, deshalb spare ich jetzt.
to spend (money) — harcamak / para harca.exen: I spent too much money on clothes, so I’m saving now.
to spend (money) — harcamak / para harca.notes: To spend or hand out money; also sich ausgeben als = pretend to be.

to pick up / collect — almak / gidip alm.exde: Kannst du mich bitte vom Bahnhof abholen?
to pick up / collect — almak / gidip alm.exen: Can you pick me up from the train station?
to pick up / collect — almak / gidip alm.notes: To pick up or collect someone/something; implies prior arrangement. Holen is basically if there is something lying around that you know you have. Abholen is more like getting something that is out of reach currently or somewhere else especially waiting for you. E.g. you wouldnt go to the super market to "abholen" a bag of chips. That would be holen. But if you ordered something beforehand, and went to fetch that, it would be abholen indeed.

to pass by / go past — yanından geçmek.exde: Jeden Morgen gehe ich an der Bäckerei vorbei und rieche das frische Brot.
to pass by / go past — yanından geçmek.exen: Every morning I walk past the bakery and smell the fresh bread.
to pass by / go past — yanından geçmek.notes: To pass by or go past; motion without stopping.

to introduce / imagine — tanıtmak / haya.exde: Ich stelle mich dem neuen Kollegen vor und erkläre, was ich mache.
to introduce / imagine — tanıtmak / haya.exen: I introduce myself to the new colleague and explain what I do.
to introduce / imagine — tanıtmak / haya.notes: To introduce or imagine; reflexive = imagine, non-reflexive = introduce.

to remove — çıkarmak / uzaklaştırmak / s.exde: Bitte entfernen Sie die Verpackung, bevor Sie das Produkt benutzen.
to remove — çıkarmak / uzaklaştırmak / s.exen: Please remove the packaging before using the product.
to remove — çıkarmak / uzaklaştırmak / s.notes: To remove or eliminate; physical separation or deletion.

to extend / lengthen — uzatmak / süresin.exde: Wir müssen unseren Aufenthalt um zwei Tage verlängern.
to extend / lengthen — uzatmak / süresin.exen: We need to extend our stay by two days.
to extend / lengthen — uzatmak / süresin.notes: To extend or lengthen time or space; opposite of verkürzen.

to collect / gather — toplamak / bir ara.exde: Der Lehrer sammelt die Hausaufgaben ein, nachdem die Stunde endet.
to collect / gather — toplamak / bir ara.exen: The teacher collects the homework after class ends.
to collect / gather — toplamak / bir ara.notes: To collect or gather items from several sources.

to spend (time) — zaman geçirmek.exde: Ich verbringe das Wochenende bei meinen Eltern auf dem Land.
to spend (time) — zaman geçirmek.exen: I spend the weekend with my parents in the countryside.
to spend (time) — zaman geçirmek.notes: To spend time; connects time with activity or place.

to contain / include — içermek / kapsama.exde: Dieses Getränk enthält keinen Zucker, aber es schmeckt trotzdem gut.
to contain / include — içermek / kapsama.exen: This drink contains no sugar but still tastes good.
to contain / include — içermek / kapsama.notes: To contain or include; describes composition or ingredient.

to stop / cease — bırakmak / durmak / so.exde: Er hört mit dem Rauchen auf, weil er gesünder leben will.
to stop / cease — bırakmak / durmak / so.exen: He quits smoking because he wants to live healthier.
to stop / cease — bırakmak / durmak / so.notes: To stop or cease doing something; end an activity voluntarily. Ich sollte damit aufhören: i should stop doing that.

to depart / leave — yola çıkmak / hareke.exde: Wir fahren um acht Uhr los, damit wir rechtzeitig ankommen.
to depart / leave — yola çıkmak / hareke.exen: We set off at eight so we arrive on time.
to depart / leave — yola çıkmak / hareke.notes: To set off or depart by vehicle; start of a trip.

to drop by / come over — uğramak / kısa.exde: Komm doch morgen Abend vorbei, wenn du Zeit hast!
to drop by / come over — uğramak / kısa.exen: Come by tomorrow evening if you have time!
to drop by / come over — uğramak / kısa.notes: To drop by or pass a place casually; brief visit.

to lock / finish — kilitlemek / tamamlam.exde: Ich schließe die Tür ab, bevor ich ins Bett gehe.
to lock / finish — kilitlemek / tamamlam.exen: I lock the door before going to bed.
to lock / finish — kilitlemek / tamamlam.notes: To lock or finish; secure physically or conclude formally (Vertrag abschließen).

to give back / return — geri vermek / ia.exde: Sie gibt das Buch morgen in der Bibliothek zurück.
to give back / return — geri vermek / ia.exen: She will return the book to the library tomorrow.
to give back / return — geri vermek / ia.notes: To give back or return; return something borrowed or due.

to look / appear — görünmek / görünüşe s.exde: Du siehst müde aus, hast du genug geschlafen?
to look / appear — görünmek / görünüşe s.exen: You look tired — did you sleep enough?
to look / appear — görünmek / görünüşe s.notes: To look or appear visually; external impression (gut aussehen).

to throw away — atmak / çöpe atmak.exde: Wir sollten keine Lebensmittel wegwerfen, solange sie noch gut sind.
to throw away — atmak / çöpe atmak.exen: We shouldn’t throw away food as long as it’s still good.
to throw away — atmak / çöpe atmak.notes: To throw away or discard; disposal of unwanted items.

to repeat — tekrarlamak.exde: Der Lehrer wiederholt die Grammatik, damit alle sie verstehen.
to repeat — tekrarlamak.exen: The teacher repeats the grammar so everyone understands it.
to repeat — tekrarlamak.notes: To repeat or review; academic repetition or clarification.

to light (candle, fire) — yakmak / tutuş.exde: Sie zündet die Kerzen an, bevor die Gäste kommen.
to light (candle, fire) — yakmak / tutuş.exen: She lights the candles before the guests arrive.
to light (candle, fire) — yakmak / tutuş.notes: To light or ignite; start a flame (candles, fire).

to toast / clink glasses — kadeh tokuştu.exde: Sie stoßen auf den Erfolg ihres Projekts an.
to toast / clink glasses — kadeh tokuştu.exen: They toast to the success of their project.
to toast / clink glasses — kadeh tokuştu.notes: To toast or bump gently; celebrate or initiate motion.

to check / look up — kontrol etmek / bak.exde: Ich schaue schnell im Kalender nach, ob ich Zeit habe.
to check / look up — kontrol etmek / bak.exen: I’ll check my calendar quickly to see if I’m free.
to check / look up — kontrol etmek / bak.notes: To check or look up; verify information or look at something again.

to print out — yazdırmak / çıktı almak.exde: Bitte druck das Dokument aus und bring es mit.
to print out — yazdırmak / çıktı almak.exen: Please print out the document and bring it with you.
to print out — yazdırmak / çıktı almak.notes: To print out digitally created material on paper.

to inform / communicate — bildirmek / ha.exde: Er teilt uns mit, dass das Meeting verschoben wurde.
to inform / communicate — bildirmek / ha.exen: He informs us that the meeting has been postponed.
to inform / communicate — bildirmek / ha.notes: To inform or communicate; sharing specific information. Birine açık ve net bir bilgi iletmek, belirli bir mesajı bildirmek. Benachrichtigen’e göre biraz daha içerikli ve açık bir iletişimdir. Karari bildirmek, mesaj iletmek, bilgi aktarmak, duyuru yapmak. informieren ise bilgilendirmek, konu hakkinda bilgi sahibi yapmak

to call (phone) — telefon etmek / aramak.exde: Ich rufe dich morgen an, sobald ich Zeit habe.
to call (phone) — telefon etmek / aramak.exen: I’ll call you tomorrow as soon as I have time.
to call (phone) — telefon etmek / aramak.notes: To call by phone; intentional voice contact remotely.

to call back — geri aramak.exde: Sie hat mich zurückgerufen, nachdem sie meine Nachricht gehört hat.
to call back — geri aramak.exen: She called me back after hearing my message.
to call back — geri aramak.notes: To call back; returning a previous phone call.

to apply for — başvuruda bulunmak / tale.exde: Ich habe ein neues Visum beantragt, weil das alte abgelaufen ist.
to apply for — başvuruda bulunmak / tale.exen: I applied for a new visa because the old one expired.
to apply for — başvuruda bulunmak / tale.notes: To apply formally (visa, permit); official written request.

to pay attention to — dikkat etmek / öne.exde: Du musst die Regeln beachten, sonst bekommst du eine Strafe.
to pay attention to — dikkat etmek / öne.exen: You must follow the rules, otherwise you’ll get a penalty.
to pay attention to — dikkat etmek / öne.notes: To pay attention to or obey; stresses awareness and compliance.

to rest — dinlenmek / istirahat etmek.exde: Nach der Arbeit ruhe ich mich auf dem Sofa aus.
to rest — dinlenmek / istirahat etmek.exen: After work, I rest on the sofa.
to rest — dinlenmek / istirahat etmek.notes: To rest or relax; reflexive recovery from exertion.

to complain — şikayet etmek / yakınmak.exde: Viele Kunden beschweren sich, weil die Lieferung zu spät kam.
to complain — şikayet etmek / yakınmak.exen: Many customers complain because the delivery arrived late.
to complain — şikayet etmek / yakınmak.notes: To complain or object; reflexive with über + Akk. for reason.

to recover / relax — dinlenmek / iyileşm.exde: Ich erhole mich, indem ich ein Buch lese und Tee trinke.
to recover / relax — dinlenmek / iyileşm.exen: I relax by reading a book and drinking tea.
to recover / relax — dinlenmek / iyileşm.notes: To recover or rest after stress or illness; reflexive for regaining energy.

to get used to — alışmak / adapte olmak.exde: Ich habe mich schnell an das Leben in Deutschland gewöhnt.
to get used to — alışmak / adapte olmak.exen: I got used to life in Germany quickly.
to get used to — alışmak / adapte olmak.notes: To get used to new conditions; reflexive an + Akk..

to make an appointment — randevulaşmak /.exde: Wir haben uns für morgen Abend verabredet, um ins Kino zu gehen.
to make an appointment — randevulaşmak /.exen: We arranged to meet tomorrow evening to go to the cinema.
to make an appointment — randevulaşmak /.notes: To make an appointment or date; reflexive social arrangement. Arkadaslar, aile vs, arasinda sosyal bulusma icin sozlesmek. Abmachen sadece bulusma degil, herhangi bisey icin kararlastirmak, anlasmak. Deal. Demek gibi. Onemli: verabreden sosyal arkadas bulusmasi. benim almanca kursuna gitmem vereinbaren olur cunku ortaklasa saat belirleyip kurs aliyorum. hatta o kursta abmachen da dogru cunku arkadasimdan kurs aliyorum, samimi sohbet.

to postpone / move — ertelemek / başka z.exde: Das Meeting wurde auf nächste Woche verschoben, weil der Chef krank ist.
to postpone / move — ertelemek / başka z.exen: The meeting was postponed to next week because the boss is sick.
to postpone / move — ertelemek / başka z.notes: To postpone or move an event; change to a later time.

to touch / grab — dokunmak / ellemek.exde: Bitte fass das Gemälde nicht an, es ist sehr empfindlich.
to touch / grab — dokunmak / ellemek.exen: Please don’t touch the painting — it’s very delicate.
to touch / grab — dokunmak / ellemek.notes: To touch or handle physically; deliberate contact with an object or person. INTENTIONAL TOUCH WITH HAND.

to download — indirmek (dosya, veri).exde: Ich lade die Datei herunter, sobald das WLAN wieder funktioniert.
to download — indirmek (dosya, veri).exen: I’ll download the file as soon as the Wi-Fi works again.
to download — indirmek (dosya, veri).notes: To download digital data from the internet or a network.

to upload — yüklemek (internete).exde: Du kannst die Fotos später auf die Website hochladen.
to upload — yüklemek (internete).exen: You can upload the photos to the website later.
to upload — yüklemek (internete).notes: To upload files or data to a server or online platform.

to tear down — yıkmak / koparmak.exde: Das alte Gebäude wurde abgerissen, damit ein neuer Park entstehen kann.
to tear down — yıkmak / koparmak.exen: The old building was torn down so that a new park can be built.
to tear down — yıkmak / koparmak.notes: To tear down or demolish; literal destruction or figurative abrupt break-off.

to fall asleep — uykuya dalmak.exde: Ich bin eingeschlafen, während ich das Buch gelesen habe.
to fall asleep — uykuya dalmak.exen: I fell asleep while reading the book.
to fall asleep — uykuya dalmak.notes: To fall asleep; transition from wakefulness to sleep.

to set up / furnish — kurmak / döşemek /.exde: Sie haben ihre Wohnung sehr modern eingerichtet, obwohl sie klein ist.
to set up / furnish — kurmak / döşemek /.exen: They furnished their apartment very modernly, even though it’s small.
to set up / furnish — kurmak / döşemek /.notes: To furnish or set up a room or system; create functional or aesthetic order.

to greet / welcome — selamlamak / karşıl.exde: Der Direktor begrüßte die neuen Mitarbeiter herzlich.
to greet / welcome — selamlamak / karşıl.exen: The director welcomed the new employees warmly.
to greet / welcome — selamlamak / karşıl.notes: To greet or welcome someone warmly or formally.

to look at / consider — incelemek / bakm.exde: Wir betrachten die Situation aus verschiedenen Perspektiven.
to look at / consider — incelemek / bakm.exen: We consider the situation from different perspectives.
to look at / consider — incelemek / bakm.notes: To look at or examine thoughtfully; focus on perception or reflection. Iyice inceleyerek bakmak, uzunca, dikkatlice. Ansehen mesela gozle gormek izlemek ama analiz etmek yok. Betrachten inceleyerek bakmak, uzunca, ve zihinsel degerlendirme.

to achieve / accomplish / afford — başar.exde: Ich kann mir im Moment kein neues Auto leisten.
to achieve / accomplish / afford — başar.exen: I can’t afford a new car at the moment.
to achieve / accomplish / afford — başar.notes: To achieve, perform, or afford; implies effort or capability (sich etwas leisten = afford).

to vote / tune / be correct — oy vermek.exde: Das Ergebnis stimmt, obwohl wir zuerst unsicher waren.
to vote / tune / be correct — oy vermek.exen: The result is correct, even though we were unsure at first.
to vote / tune / be correct — oy vermek.notes: To be correct, tune, or vote; correctness, musical adjustment, or political choice. Richtig sein yerine daha cok kullaniliyor gunluk hayatta, bu dogru, bu uyusuyor, hesap tutuyor vs. Stimme für / gegen, ona / onun karsisi icin oy vermek, diger anlami.

to suppose / assume — varsaymak / tahmin.exde: Ich vermute, dass er schon gegangen ist, weil das Licht aus ist.
to suppose / assume — varsaymak / tahmin.exen: I assume that he’s already left because the light is off.
to suppose / assume — varsaymak / tahmin.notes: To assume or suspect; reasoned guess without certainty. Annehmen ile ayni anlamda ama bu daha az reasoned

to require / demand — gerektirmek / tale.exde: Diese Aufgabe erfordert viel Geduld und Konzentration.
to require / demand — gerektirmek / tale.exen: This task requires a lot of patience and concentration.
to require / demand — gerektirmek / tale.notes: To require or demand as a necessity; formal obligation. Bir durumun, eylemin, objektif bir zorunluluk, gereksinim yaratmasi. Something INHERENTLY requires something. Hard work requires discipline, inherent. Sirketler staj  basvurularinda MS requirement var, ama bu sirketlerin talebi, verlangen. external and imposed, not inherent. discipline is required by the NATURE of the goals, MS degree is required BY COMPANIES.

to justify / explain — gerekçelendirmek.exde: Sie begründet ihre Entscheidung sehr logisch und überzeugend.
to justify / explain — gerekçelendirmek.exen: She justifies her decision very logically and convincingly.
to justify / explain — gerekçelendirmek.notes: To justify or give reasons; establish logical or factual basis.

to influence — etkilemek / tesir etmek.exde: Das Wetter beeinflusst meine Stimmung stark.
to influence — etkilemek / tesir etmek.exen: The weather affects my mood strongly.
to influence — etkilemek / tesir etmek.notes: To influence or affect; exert mental, emotional, or social impact.

to negotiate — müzakere etmek / pazarlık.exde: Die Parteien verhandeln, um eine gemeinsame Lösung zu finden.
to negotiate — müzakere etmek / pazarlık.exen: The parties are negotiating to find a common solution.
to negotiate — müzakere etmek / pazarlık.notes: To negotiate; exchange arguments to reach agreement.

to contribute (to) — katkıda bulunmak.exde: Eine gesunde Ernährung trägt zu einem besseren Leben bei.
to contribute (to) — katkıda bulunmak.exen: A healthy diet contributes to a better life.
to contribute (to) — katkıda bulunmak.notes: To contribute to something; partial participation toward a shared result.

to follow / pursue — takip etmek / izlem.exde: Die Polizei verfolgt den Verdächtigen seit mehreren Tagen.
to follow / pursue — takip etmek / izlem.exen: The police have been following the suspect for several days.
to follow / pursue — takip etmek / izlem.notes: To follow or pursue continuously; literal chasing or figurative tracking (goals, trends).

to emphasize — vurgulamak / altını çizme.exde: Der Lehrer betont, wie wichtig regelmäßiges Üben ist.
to emphasize — vurgulamak / altını çizme.exen: The teacher emphasizes how important regular practice is.
to emphasize — vurgulamak / altını çizme.notes: To emphasize or stress importance; verbal or conceptual highlighting.

to begin / start — başlamak / girişmek.exde: Wir fangen mit der Arbeit an, sobald alle da sind.
to begin / start — başlamak / girişmek.exen: We’ll start the work as soon as everyone is here.
to begin / start — başlamak / girişmek.notes: To begin or start an action; everyday term, less formal than beginnen.

to adapt / adjust (oneself) — uyum sağla.exde: Man muss sich anpassen, wenn man in einem neuen Land lebt.
to adapt / adjust (oneself) — uyum sağla.exen: You have to adapt when living in a new country.
to adapt / adjust (oneself) — uyum sağla.notes: To adapt or adjust oneself; reflexive for accommodation to environment or rules.

to distinguish — ayırt etmek / farkı gör.exde: Es ist schwer, gute und schlechte Qualität zu unterscheiden.
to distinguish — ayırt etmek / farkı gör.exen: It’s hard to distinguish between good and bad quality.
to distinguish — ayırt etmek / farkı gör.notes: To differentiate or tell apart; perceive distinctions between things.

to wipe (mop) — silmek / silip temizleme.exde: Sie wischt den Boden, weil etwas Saft verschüttet wurde.
to wipe (mop) — silmek / silip temizleme.exen: She wipes the floor because some juice was spilled.
to wipe (mop) — silmek / silip temizleme.notes: To wipe or mop a surface; cleaning with a cloth or movement.

to wipe off (table) / clean off — silmek.exde: Er wischt den Tisch ab, nachdem sie gegessen haben.
to wipe off (table) / clean off — silmek.exen: He wipes off the table after they’ve eaten.
to wipe off (table) / clean off — silmek.notes: To wipe off or clean away; removal of dirt or liquid from a surface.

to misunderstand — yanlış anlamak.notes: To misunderstand; incorrect interpretation of meaning or intention.

to hand in / drop off — teslim etmek / v.exde: Ich gebe das Paket morgen bei der Post ab.
to hand in / drop off — teslim etmek / v.exen: I’ll drop off the package at the post office tomorrow.
to hand in / drop off — teslim etmek / v.notes: To hand in, deliver, or submit; formal transfer of control or object. Einreichen ile benzer anlamlar. Einreichen da belge verince bir process basliyor, banka hesap acimi, odev submiti (grading) gibi, einreichen 'isleme vermek, isleme alinmasi icin vermek' olarak dusunulebilir. abgeben direkt belgeyi veriyosun. Fiziksel teslim.

to fetch / get — gidip almak / getirmek.exde: Kannst du mir bitte ein Glas Wasser holen?
to fetch / get — gidip almak / getirmek.exen: Can you get me a glass of water, please?
to fetch / get — gidip almak / getirmek.notes: To fetch or get something and bring it back. Holen is basically if there is something lying around that you know you have. Abholen is more like getting something that is out of reach currently or somewhere else especially waiting for you. E.g. you wouldnt go to the super market to "abholen" a bag of chips. That would be holen. But if you ordered something beforehand, and went to fetch that, it would be abholen indeed.

to touch — dokunmak / temas etmek.exde: Bitte berühr das Kunstwerk nicht – es ist sehr empfindlich.
to touch — dokunmak / temas etmek.exen: Please don’t touch the artwork — it’s very delicate.
to touch — dokunmak / temas etmek.notes: To touch gently; physical contact or emotional impression. Come in contact with any body part. Can also be metaphorical, your speech touched me.

to be of use / benefit — yararlı olmak /.exde: Das neue Gesetz nützt vor allem den kleinen Unternehmen.
to be of use / benefit — yararlı olmak /.exen: The new law benefits mainly small businesses.
to be of use / benefit — yararlı olmak /.notes: To be of use or benefit; effectiveness or advantage, often Dat..

to insert / schedule / put in — yerleşti.exde: Ich lege eine Pause ein, weil ich müde bin.
to insert / schedule / put in — yerleşti.exen: I’m taking a break because I’m tired.
to insert / schedule / put in — yerleşti.notes: To insert or schedule something; also preserve food in liquid.

to adjust / adapt — ayarlamak / uydurmak.exde: Wir passen das Design an, damit es moderner wirkt.
to adjust / adapt — ayarlamak / uydurmak.exen: We adjust the design so it looks more modern.
to adjust / adapt — ayarlamak / uydurmak.notes: To adjust something intentionally; modify to make suitable.

to give up / quit — vazgeçmek / bırakmak.exde: Er hat das Rauchen aufgegeben, weil es ungesund ist.
to give up / quit — vazgeçmek / bırakmak.exen: He gave up smoking because it’s unhealthy.
to give up / quit — vazgeçmek / bırakmak.notes: To give up, quit, or mail; surrender effort or send off.

to trust — güvenmek / inanmak.exde: Ich vertraue dir, weil du immer ehrlich bist.
to trust — güvenmek / inanmak.exen: I trust you because you’re always honest.
to trust — güvenmek / inanmak.notes: To trust; rely confidently on a person or situation (Dat.). Genel guven duymak, guvenmek, trauen tek basina bi olay icin guvenmek, genel o kisiye guven duymak degil.

to turn on / switch on — açmak / çalıştı.exde: Bitte schalte das Licht an, es ist schon dunkel.
to turn on / switch on — açmak / çalıştı.exen: Please turn on the light, it’s already dark.
to turn on / switch on — açmak / çalıştı.notes: To turn on or activate; colloquial equivalent of einschalten.

to turn off / disconnect / relax — kapam.exde: Nach der Arbeit schalte ich einfach ab und höre Musik.
to turn off / disconnect / relax — kapam.exen: After work I just switch off and listen to music.
to turn off / disconnect / relax — kapam.notes: To turn off or shut down; also figurative for relaxing one’s mind.

to be late / delayed — gecikmek / geç ka.exde: Der Zug hat sich um 20 Minuten verspätet.
to be late / delayed — gecikmek / geç ka.exen: The train was delayed by 20 minutes.
to be late / delayed — gecikmek / geç ka.notes: To be late or delayed; reflexive for arriving later than planned.

to notice / realize — fark etmek / anlam.exde: Ich habe nicht bemerkt, dass du schon da bist.
to notice / realize — fark etmek / anlam.exen: I didn’t notice that you’re already here.
to notice / realize — fark etmek / anlam.notes: To notice, perceive, or comment on something; conscious recognition. Sich merken memorize, bemerken notice. Yine de fark etmek icin gunluk hayatta merken kullanmak daha iyi, bemerken biraz daha resmi, ciddi, kitabi hissettiriyor.

to submit / hand in — sunmak / teslim et.exde: Sie hat ihre Bewerbung gestern eingereicht.
to submit / hand in — sunmak / teslim et.notes: To submit or hand in formally (documents, applications). You start a process by giving those documents. İŞLEME VERMEK, isleme alinmasi icin sunmak. online da olur, ama abgeben fiziksel. For example, if giving a copy of your documents when your bank wanted, and it is just for them to store those, that is abgeben. But when you want to open a bank account so you hand in those documents that is einreichen. or at a art competition and you hand in your art, that is einreichen, process is judges rankings.

to select / choose — seçmek / tercih etm.exde: Du kannst einen Film auswählen, den wir sehen.
to select / choose — seçmek / tercih etm.exen: You can choose a movie for us to watch.
to select / choose — seçmek / tercih etm.notes: To select or choose carefully among options.

to prefer — tercih etmek / yeğlemek.exde: Ich bevorzuge Tee statt Kaffee am Morgen.
to prefer — tercih etmek / yeğlemek.exen: I prefer tea to coffee in the morning.
to prefer — tercih etmek / yeğlemek.notes: To prefer one option over another; express inclination. Ich ziehe es vor, … zu … . Kalibi daha dogal gunluk hayatta, bevorzugen daha resmi.

to freeze / feel cold — üşümek / donmak.exde: Im Winter friert er immer an den Händen.
to freeze / feel cold — üşümek / donmak.exen: In winter his hands are always cold.
to freeze / feel cold — üşümek / donmak.notes: To freeze or feel cold; physical sensation or weather effect.

to burn — yanmak / yakmak.exde: Das Feuer hat die alte Scheune komplett gebrannt.
to burn — yanmak / yakmak.exen: The fire completely burned down the old barn.
to burn — yanmak / yakmak.notes: To burn or be on fire; literal combustion or figurative passion. Be on fire, alevli halde olmak, intransitiv, mum yaniyor, ev yaniyor, su yaniyor bu yaniyor etc. verbrennen ise bir seyi yakmak, intransitiv versiyonu ise bir seyin yanip kul olmasi.

to hang (be / put up) — asmak / asılı ol.exde: Das Bild hat jahrelang an dieser Wand gehangen.
to hang (be / put up) — asmak / asılı ol.exen: The picture hung on that wall for years.
to hang (be / put up) — asmak / asılı ol.notes: To hang or be suspended; static position or emotional attachment.

to divide / split up — bölmek / paylaşma.exde: Wir teilen die Aufgaben auf, damit jeder etwas zu tun hat.
to divide / split up — bölmek / paylaşma.exen: We divide the tasks so that everyone has something to do.
to divide / split up — bölmek / paylaşma.notes: To divide or share into parts; distribute fairly among people.

to wait for / await — beklemek / sonucun.exde: Wir müssen noch ein paar Tage abwarten, bevor wir eine Entscheidung treffen.
to wait for / await — beklemek / sonucun.exen: We have to wait a few more days before making a decision.
to wait for / await — beklemek / sonucun.notes: To wait for a result patiently before acting; deliberate delay.

to show / present — göstermek / ibraz et.exde: Bitte zeigen Sie beim Eingang Ihre Eintrittskarte vor.
to show / present — göstermek / ibraz et.exen: Please show your ticket at the entrance.
to show / present — göstermek / ibraz et.notes: To show or present something for inspection or proof.

to agree on / arrange — kararlaştırmak /.exde: Wir haben abgemacht, uns morgen zum Mittagessen zu treffen.
to agree on / arrange — kararlaştırmak /.exen: We agreed to meet for lunch tomorrow.
to agree on / arrange — kararlaştırmak /.notes: To agree on or arrange something; informal verbal arrangement. Oral treaty, onunla anlastik, benim yatagi tasimama yardim edecek, bu anlasmak abmachen, agree derken fikre katilmak gibi degil. Zustimmen ise fikre katilmak, agree. Tamamdir, anlastik. derken, okay, abgemacht denebilir mesela.

to exaggerate — abartmak.exde: Du übertreibst immer ein bisschen, wenn du Geschichten erzählst.
to exaggerate — abartmak.exen: You always exaggerate a little when you tell stories.
to exaggerate — abartmak.notes: To exaggerate; overstate facts or emotions beyond reality.

to think about / reflect — düşünmek / ka.exde: Ich denke oft über meine Zukunft nach, wenn ich allein bin.
to think about / reflect — düşünmek / ka.exen: I often think about my future when I’m alone.
to think about / reflect — düşünmek / ka.notes: To reflect or think deeply before deciding; deliberate consideration of ideas.

to create / compile — oluşturmak / hazır.exde: Die Firma hat einen neuen Sicherheitsplan erstellt.
to create / compile — oluşturmak / hazır.exen: The company created a new safety plan.
to create / compile — oluşturmak / hazır.notes: To create, compile, or prepare a document, plan, or project; structured production. Bir seyin kullanima hazir son halini olusturmak. belge, plan, rapor, taslak, proje vs. Pdf, word dokumani, alisveris listesi vs vs. Hazir hale getirmek. Bir sunum hazirlayabilir misin? diye sunulunca sunum yap, bitir getir anlaminda, erstellen mesela. pcde klasor olusturmak. gestalten icerik, estetik, duzenlemek vs de dahil, erstellen final product a odakli. entwerfen de taslak olusturmak.

to shine / glow — parlamak / ışık saçmak.exde: Der Mond leuchtet hell am klaren Nachthimmel.
to shine / glow — parlamak / ışık saçmak.exen: The moon shines brightly in the clear night sky.
to shine / glow — parlamak / ışık saçmak.notes: To shine or emit light; literal brightness or figurative radiance (Ihre Augen leuchten). Leuchten direkt isik kaynaginin isik sacmasi, ay, gunes, lamba, ampul, kendi isigini yaymak. Scheinen ise aydinlatmak gibi, gunes odayi aydinlatiyor, lamba masayi aydinlatiyor vs. direkt isik kaynaginin isik sacmasi degil. mesela gunes, ay icin leuchten kullanilirsa onlarin isik sacmasi/ sactigi isik a vurgu yapilir, scheinen da ise parliyor, ya burayi aydinlatiyor ya da daha genel mesela her yer gunesli gun icinde her yer parlak guzel gunes vuruyor o scheinen

to smell (emit a smell) — kokmak, bir se.exde: Der Müll riecht seit gestern extrem unangenehm.
to smell (emit a smell) — kokmak, bir se.exen: The trash has smelled extremely unpleasant since yesterday.
to smell (emit a smell) — kokmak, bir se.notes: Used when something itself smells; no object.

to smell something (perceive odor) — bir.exde: Ich rieche den Kaffee schon von weitem.
to smell something (perceive odor) — bir.exen: I can already smell the coffee from far away.
to smell something (perceive odor) — bir.notes: Unintentional smelling; sensory perception of an odor.

to smell like something — bir şey gibi k.exde: Die Jacke riecht nach Zigaretten, weil jemand daneben geraucht hat.
to smell like something — bir şey gibi k.exen: The jacket smells like cigarettes because someone smoked next to it.

to sniff / smell something intentionally.exde: Sie riecht an der Milch, um zu prüfen, ob sie noch gut ist.
to sniff / smell something intentionally.exen: She sniffs the milk to check if it’s still good.

to feel / touch something — bir şeye dok.exde: Sie tastet den Stoff, um zu prüfen, ob er weich genug ist.
to feel / touch something — bir şeye dok.exen: She feels the fabric to check if it is soft enough.
to feel / touch something — bir şeye dok.notes: Used when someone intentionally touches/feels an object to examine it.

to feel for something — bir şeyi karanlı.exde: Er tastet im Dunkeln nach dem Lichtschalter.
to feel for something — bir şeyi karanlı.exen: He feels for the light switch in the dark.
to feel for something — bir şeyi karanlı.notes: Indicates searching by touch without seeing; very common expression.

to be ashamed — utanmak.exde: Er schämt sich, weil er einen Fehler gemacht hat.
to be ashamed — utanmak.exen: He is ashamed because he made a mistake.
to be ashamed — utanmak.notes: To be ashamed or feel guilt; reflexive emotion of embarrassment (für + Akk.).

to regret — pişman olmak / üzülmek.exde: Ich bedauere, dass ich gestern so spät gekommen bin.
to regret — pişman olmak / üzülmek.exen: I regret that I came so late yesterday.
to regret — pişman olmak / üzülmek.notes: To regret or feel sorry about something; expresses remorse or sympathy.

to worry / care — endişelenmek / merak e.exde: Sie sorgt sich um ihre kranke Mutter.
to worry / care — endişelenmek / merak e.exen: She worries about her sick mother.
to worry / care — endişelenmek / merak e.notes: To worry or care; sich sorgen um + Akk. = emotional concern, für + Akk. = provide for.

to put away — bir kenara koymak / kaldır.exde: Ich stelle das Glas weg, nachdem ich es gespült habe, damit niemand es umstößt.
to put away — bir kenara koymak / kaldır.exen: I put the glass away after washing it so that no one knocks it over.
to put away — bir kenara koymak / kaldır.notes: Describes removing or placing something out of use or sight; often with nachdem, damit.

to hand / be enough — birine almasi icin.exde: Kannst du mir bitte das Salz reichen, bevor das Essen kalt wird?
to hand / be enough — birine almasi icin.exen: Could you pass me the salt before the food gets cold?
to hand / be enough — birine almasi icin.notes: Used both for “handing” and “sufficing”; common in polite requests.

to cancel — iptal etmek / reddetmek.exde: Sie hat dem Freund das Treffen abgesagt, weil sie krank geworden ist.
to cancel — iptal etmek / reddetmek.exen: She canceled the meeting with her friend because she got sick.
to cancel — iptal etmek / reddetmek.notes: Used for appointments or invitations; Dativ shows who receives the cancellation.

to lead / guide — yönetmek / rehberlik e.exde: Der Lehrer führt die Klasse durch das Museum, während er interessante Fakten erklärt.
to lead / guide — yönetmek / rehberlik e.exen: The teacher leads the class through the museum while explaining interesting facts.
to lead / guide — yönetmek / rehberlik e.notes: Combines physical guidance and intellectual leadership.

to design / draft — tasarlamak / plan çi.exde: Die Architektin entwirft ein neues Gebäude, das sowohl modern als auch um weltfreundlich ist.
to design / draft — tasarlamak / plan çi.exen: The architect designs a new building that is both modern and eco-friendly.
to design / draft — tasarlamak / plan çi.notes: Creative and technical planning, often architectural or artistic.

to endure / tolerate — katlanmak / dayan.exde: Ich kann diese Hitze kaum ertragen, obwohl ich eigentlich Sommer mag.
to endure / tolerate — katlanmak / dayan.exen: I can hardly endure this heat, although I actually like summer.
to endure / tolerate — katlanmak / dayan.notes: Expresses strong discomfort or emotional strain.

to question / interview — sorgulamak / r.exde: Die Polizei befragt den Zeugen, umherauszufinden, was wirklich passiert ist.
to question / interview — sorgulamak / r.exen: The police interview the witness to find out what really happened.
to question / interview — sorgulamak / r.notes: Used for formal questioning, investigation, or interviews.

to tie / connect / build (relationship).exde: In der neuen Stadt knüpft er viele Kontakte, damit er beruflich schneller Fuß fassen kann.
to tie / connect / build (relationship).exen: In the new city, he builds connections so that he can settle into his career faster.
to tie / connect / build (relationship).notes: Figurative sense of forming relationships; literal “tie knots.”

to get into / end up — düşmek / maruz ka.exde: Er gerät oft in Schwierigkeiten, wenn er zu spontan handelt.
to get into / end up — düşmek / maruz ka.exen: He often gets into trouble when he acts too spontaneously.
to get into / end up — düşmek / maruz ka.notes: Indicates unintentional involvement in a situation.

to receive / move into / refer — taşınma.exde: Wir beziehen morgen die Wohnung, in die wir lange investieren mussten.
to receive / move into / refer — taşınma.exen: We’re moving into the apartment that we had to invest in for a long time.
to receive / move into / refer — taşınma.notes: Versatile verb: living, receiving income, or referring to something. Note: in .. ziehen: tasinmak, … beziehen: yerlesmek, tasinmanin bitmesi gibi. Umziehen da ise direkt objekt yok, sadece tasinmak.

to save / store (data) — kaydetmek / dep.exde: Ich habe alle Fotos gespeichert, bevor ich das Handy zurückgesetzt habe.
to save / store (data) — kaydetmek / dep.exen: I saved all the photos before I reset the phone.
to save / store (data) — kaydetmek / dep.notes: Common in digital contexts; can also mean mental storage.

to memorize — akılda tutmak / ezberlemek.exde: Diese Regel hat sich mir gut eingeprägt, weil ich sie oft wiederholt habe.
to memorize — akılda tutmak / ezberlemek.exen: This rule stuck in my head, because I repeated it often.
to memorize — akılda tutmak / ezberlemek.notes: Reflexive Dativ form expresses deep internal memory imprint.

to pay attention to — dikkat etmek / öze.exde: Achte bitte auf den Verkehr, wenn du über die Straße gehst!
to pay attention to — dikkat etmek / öze.exen: Please watch out for traffic when you cross the street!
to pay attention to — dikkat etmek / öze.notes: Cautionary use emphasizing awareness or careful behavior.

to look at / watch — bakmak / izlemek.exde: Ich gucke mir die Dokumentation an, damit ich das Thema besser verstehe.
to look at / watch — bakmak / izlemek.exen: I’m watching the documentary so that I understand the topic better.
to look at / watch — bakmak / izlemek.notes: Colloquial synonym for ansehen, implying personal interest.

to occupy / fill / reserve — doldurmak /.exde: Der Platz war schon besetzt, als wir im Theater ankamen.
to occupy / fill / reserve — doldurmak /.exen: The seat was already taken when we arrived at the theater.
to occupy / fill / reserve — doldurmak /.notes: Used for seats, roles, or positions being filled or taken.

to spell — harf harf söylemek / heceleme.exde: Können Sie bitte Ihren Namen buchstabieren, damit ich ihn richtig notiere?
to spell — harf harf söylemek / heceleme.exen: Could you please spell your name so that I write it correctly?
to spell — harf harf söylemek / heceleme.notes: Clarifies spoken words; common in formal situations.

to be born — doğmak.exde: Sie ist in Berlin geboren, wo sie später auch studiert hat.
to be born — doğmak.exen: She was born in Berlin, where she later also studied.
to be born — doğmak.notes: Passive construction describing birth or origin.

to congratulate — tebrik etmek.exde: Ich gratulierte ihr herzlich, als sie die Prüfung bestanden hatte.
to congratulate — tebrik etmek.exen: I congratulated her warmly when she had passed the exam.
to congratulate — tebrik etmek.notes: Always Dativ + “zu”; expresses congratulations or good wishes.

to bring along — beraber getirmek.exde: Ich bringe morgen Kuchen mit, damit wir zusammen feiern können.
to bring along — beraber getirmek.exen: I’ll bring cake tomorrow so that we can celebrate together.
to bring along — beraber getirmek.notes: Adding mit-emphasizes “bringing something along with oneself.”

to come along — beraber gelmek.exde: Er kam gestern nicht mit, weil er bis spät arbeiten musste.
to come along — beraber gelmek.exen: He didn’t come along yesterday, because he had to work late.
to come along — beraber gelmek.notes: Motion verb indicating accompaniment or participation.

must / have to — zorunda olmak / -meli.exde: Ich muss heute länger arbeiten, obwohl ich eigentlich früh nach Hause wollte.
must / have to — zorunda olmak / -meli.exen: I have to work longer today, although I actually wanted to go home early.
must / have to — zorunda olmak / -meli.notes: Expresses necessity or obligation; combines with infinitive verbs.

to rain — yağmur yağmak.exde: Es regnete, während wir im Park spazieren gingen.
to rain — yağmur yağmak.exen: It rained while we were walking in the park.
to rain — yağmur yağmak.notes: Impersonal weather verb; used only with “es”.

to stay overnight — gecelemek / konaklam.exde: Wir übernachteten in einem Hotel, weil es zu spät war, um zurückzufahren.
to stay overnight — gecelemek / konaklam.exen: We stayed overnight in a hotel because it was too late to drive back.
to stay overnight — gecelemek / konaklam.notes: Describes spending a night away from home.

to transfer (money) — para havale etmek.exde: Ich überweise das Geld morgen, sobald mein Gehalt eingeht.
to transfer (money) — para havale etmek.exen: I’ll transfer the money tomorrow, as soon as my salary comes in.
to transfer (money) — para havale etmek.notes: Common financial verb for electronic payments or money transfers.

to pay attention / look after — dikkat e.exde: Pass auf die Kinder auf, während ich das Essen vorbereite!
to pay attention / look after — dikkat e.exen: Watch the kids while I prepare the food!
to pay attention / look after — dikkat e.notes: Reflexive in sense; means both “pay attention” and “look after.” sich kümmern: take care, ilgilenmek, yemek vermek, arabayla goturmek, uyutmak uyandirmak vs. Aufpassen auf: basinda durmak, izlemek, ilgilenmek, ya da göz kulak olmak. Hasta arkadasina sich kümmern, arkadasinin kopegine aufpassen auf.

to unpack — paketten çıkarmak / açmak.exde: Ich packte meinen Koffer aus, nachdem ich endlich zu Hause angekommen war.
to unpack — paketten çıkarmak / açmak.exen: I unpacked my suitcase after I finally got home.
to unpack — paketten çıkarmak / açmak.notes: Opposite of einpacken; used for luggage or deliveries.

to order — sipariş vermek / ısmarlamak.exde: Wir bestellen Pizza, weil keiner Lust hat zu kochen.
to order — sipariş vermek / ısmarlamak.exen: We’re ordering pizza because nobody feels like cooking.
to order — sipariş vermek / ısmarlamak.notes: Common in restaurants or online shopping; can also mean “arrange.”

to confirm — onaylamak / teyit etmek.exde: Die Firma hat bestätigt, dass meine Bewerbung eingegangen ist.
to confirm — onaylamak / teyit etmek.exen: The company confirmed that my application was received.
to confirm — onaylamak / teyit etmek.notes: Used for formal or official confirmations.

to pack / grab — toplamak / yakalamak.exde: Ich packte meine Sachen, bevor der Bus kam.
to pack / grab — toplamak / yakalamak.exen: I packed my things before the bus arrived.
to pack / grab — toplamak / yakalamak.notes: Means to pack or to grab; can also be emotional (“Die Angst packte mich”).

to pack up / wrap — paketlemek / sarmak.exde: Sie packte die Geschenke ein, damit niemand sie vorher sieht.
to pack up / wrap — paketlemek / sarmak.exen: She wrapped the presents so that no one sees them before.
to pack up / wrap — paketlemek / sarmak.notes: Indicates wrapping or preparing items for travel or gifting.

to move in — taşınmak / yerleşmek.exde: Wir sind eingezogen, nachdem die Renovierung endlich fertig war.
to move in — taşınmak / yerleşmek.exen: We moved in after the renovation was finally done.
to move in — taşınmak / yerleşmek.notes: Used with sein; expresses entering a new living space.

to marry — evlenmek.exde: Sie haben geheiratet, obwohl ihre Familien dagegen waren.
to marry — evlenmek.exen: They got married, although their families were against it.
to marry — evlenmek.notes: Takes no preposition; focus on the act of marriage, not the ceremony.

to park — park etmek.exde: Ich habe weit weg geparkt, weil hier kein Platz mehr war.
to park — park etmek.exen: I parked far away because there was no space left here.
to park — park etmek.notes: Can be used with or without an object depending on context.

to grill / barbecue — ızgara yapmak / ma.exde: Wir grillten am See, bis es dunkel wurde.
to grill / barbecue — ızgara yapmak / ma.exen: We barbecued by the lake until it got dark.
to grill / barbecue — ızgara yapmak / ma.notes: Common leisure activity; used both literally and figuratively (“jemanden grillen” = to grill someone with questions).

to snow — kar yağmak.exde: Es hat geschneit, sodass die Straßen völlig weiß waren.
to snow — kar yağmak.exen: It snowed, so that the streets were completely white.
to snow — kar yağmak.notes: Impersonal weather verb used only with “es.”

to photograph / take pictures — fotoğraf.exde: Ich fotografiere gern Orte, die ich zum ersten Mal sehe.
to photograph / take pictures — fotoğraf.exen: I like photographing places that I see for the first time.
to photograph / take pictures — fotoğraf.notes: Neutral or artistic use; transitive verb.

to thank — teşekkür etmek [danken].exde: Ich danke dir herzlich für deine Hilfe.
to thank — teşekkür etmek [danken].exen: I thank you sincerely for your help.
to thank — teşekkür etmek [danken].notes: To thank; expresses gratitude, always with Dative person.

to thank — teşekkür etmek [(sich) bedank.exde: Ich bedankte mich bei meiner Lehrerin, weil sie mir so viel geholfen hat.
to thank — teşekkür etmek [(sich) bedank.exen: I thanked my teacher because she helped me so much.
to thank — teşekkür etmek [(sich) bedank.notes: Reflexive politeness verb; always used with bei(person) + für(thing).

to hurt / injure (oneself) — yaralanmak.exde: Er verletzte sich, als er vom Fahrrad fiel.
to hurt / injure (oneself) — yaralanmak.exen: He injured himself when he fell off the bike.
to hurt / injure (oneself) — yaralanmak.notes: Reflexive when the subject and object are the same; non-reflexive for others.

to take place — gerçekleşmek / olmak.exde: Das Konzert findet auch dann statt, wenn es regnet.
to take place — gerçekleşmek / olmak.exen: The concert takes place even if it rains.
to take place — gerçekleşmek / olmak.notes: Common for events, meetings, or occasions.

to dream (of) — rüya görmek / hayal kurm.exde: Ich träume oft davon, ins Ausland zu ziehen, weil ich andere Kulturen erleben möchte.
to dream (of) — rüya görmek / hayal kurm.exen: I often dream of moving abroad, because I want to experience other cultures.
to dream (of) — rüya görmek / hayal kurm.notes: Used for both sleeping dreams and ambitions; von + Dat. introduces the topic.

to take away / dispose — götürmek / uzak.exde: Ich bringe den Müll weg, bevor er anfängt zu stinken.
to take away / dispose — götürmek / uzak.exen: I’m taking out the trash before it starts to smell.
to take away / dispose — götürmek / uzak.notes: Focuses on carrying something away from a place.

to remove / clean off — temizlemek / ort.exde: Kannst du bitte die Flecken wegmachen, damit das Hemd wieder sauber ist?
to remove / clean off — temizlemek / ort.exen: Could you please remove the stains so that the shirt is clean again?
to remove / clean off — temizlemek / ort.notes: Casual synonym of entfernen in spoken German.

to take away — almak / elinden almak.exde: Die Mutter nahm dem Kind das Handy weg, weil es zu lange gespielt hatte.
to take away — almak / elinden almak.exen: The mother took away the child’s phone because it had played too long.
to take away — almak / elinden almak.notes: Means to remove something from someone’s possession.

to continue — devam etmek / sürdürmek.exde: Mach bitte weiter, auch wenn es schwierig wird.
to continue — devam etmek / sürdürmek.exen: Please keep going, even if it gets difficult.
to continue — devam etmek / sürdürmek.notes: Used for continuing actions or work; separable verb.

to lose weight / remove / take from some.exde: Sie hat abgenommen, seitdem sie regelmäßig joggt. Sie nimmt den Hörer ab, als das Telefon klingelt.
to lose weight / remove / take from some.exen: She has lost weight, since he’s been jogging regularly. She picks up the phone when it rings.
to lose weight / remove / take from some.notes: Meanings: (1) lose weight (intrans.); (2) remove an object (Akk.); (3) take something off someone (jdm etw. abnehmen); (4) pick up the phone den Hörer abnehmen. Birinden bir seyi almak izinsiz veya zorla degil, mesela birinden cantasini almak, yardimci olmak icin, senin cantani alabilirim demek gibi. remove ise bir seyi bagli oldugu yerden remove gibi, tencerenin kapagini, tisortunu, bandaji, telefonu (ahizesinden) mesela. fiilin tarihcesi de o, eskiden ahizeli telefondan telefonu almak, ayirmak tan gunumuze gelmis, su an cep telefonu olsa da.

to subscribe — abone olmak.exde: Ich abonniere den Podcast, damit ich keine Folge verpasse.
to subscribe — abone olmak.exen: I’m subscribing to the podcast so that I don’t miss any episodes.
to subscribe — abone olmak.notes: Common for magazines, newsletters, and digital content.

to pour / water — dökmek / sulamak.exde: Er gießt die Blumen jeden Morgen, damit sie frisch bleiben.
to pour / water — dökmek / sulamak.exen: He waters the flowers every morning so that they stay fresh.
to pour / water — dökmek / sulamak.notes: Describes controlled pouring of liquids; used literally or metaphorically.

to kiss — öpüşmek / öpmek.exde: Sie küssten sich, obwohl alle zusahen.
to kiss — öpüşmek / öpmek.exen: They kissed, although everyone was watching.
to kiss — öpüşmek / öpmek.notes: Literal physical affection; reflexive possible in mutual sense.

to land — inmek / karaya çıkmak.exde: Das Flugzeug landete, nachdem es zwei Stunden verspätet gestartet war.
to land — inmek / karaya çıkmak.exen: The plane landed after it had taken off two hours late.
to land — inmek / karaya çıkmak.notes: Used for planes or metaphorically (“Er ist gut gelandet” = he succeeded).

to pick up / keep / cancel — yerden alma.exde: Heb das Dokument bitte auf, falls wir es später noch brauchen.
to pick up / keep / cancel — yerden alma.exen: Please keep the document, in case we need it later.
to pick up / keep / cancel — yerden alma.notes: Has multiple meanings: “pick up,” “preserve,” or “abolish.” normally cancelling is kündigen, and if this is used to keep instead of behalten, this means to keep for a certain use later on. Behalten is just keeping without anything on mind. Use it for picking stuff from ground for now

to apply / use — uygulamak / kullanmak.exde: Man muss das Gelernte regelmäßig anwenden, um es nicht zu vergessen.
to apply / use — uygulamak / kullanmak.exen: You must apply what you’ve learned so as not to forget it.
to apply / use — uygulamak / kullanmak.notes: Refers to practical application of knowledge or methods.

to organize / arrange — düzenlemek / sır.exde: Ich ordnete die Unterlagen, damit sie leichter zu finden sind.
to organize / arrange — düzenlemek / sır.exen: I organized the documents so that they’re easier to find.
to organize / arrange — düzenlemek / sır.notes: To bring order or structure to things; common with documents or thoughts.

to look / watch — bakmak / izlemek.exde: Schau zuerst nach links, bevor du die Straße überquerst.
to look / watch — bakmak / izlemek.exen: Look to the left first before you cross the street.
to look / watch — bakmak / izlemek.notes: General verb for looking or watching; regional alternative to sehen. Just looking is schauen, to look at, like attentively, is anschauen, like watching tv. Schauen tv is like just looking at tv blindly.

to continue one’s education — kendini ge.exde: Er bildet sich weiter, weil er beruflich aufsteigen möchte.
to continue one’s education — kendini ge.exen: He’s continuing his education, because he wants to advance professionally.
to continue one’s education — kendini ge.notes: Common for self-improvement or additional training.

to get lost (on foot) — yolu kaybetmek /.exde: Wir haben uns verlaufen, obwohl wir die Karte dabei hatten.
to get lost (on foot) — yolu kaybetmek /.exen: We got lost, although we had the map with us.
to get lost (on foot) — yolu kaybetmek /.notes: Always reflexive; used for losing one’s way when walking.

to make an effort / strain oneself — çab.exde: Sie strengte sich so sehr an, dass sie danach völlig erschöpft war.
to make an effort / strain oneself — çab.exen: She exerted herself so much that she was completely exhausted afterward.
to make an effort / strain oneself — çab.notes: Used for both mental and physical effort; reflexive form common. Active strong effort to achieve sth, phyiscal or mental, often tiring. Sich bemühen is also making an effort, but not as exhausting as anstrengen. Mühe geben is trying your best.

to lend / award — ödünç vermek / ödül ve.exde: Die Akademie verlieh ihm den Preis, weil er Außergewöhnliches geleistet hatte.
to lend / award — ödünç vermek / ödül ve.exen: The academy awarded him the prize because he had achieved something extraordinary.
to lend / award — ödünç vermek / ödül ve.notes: Means both to lend (books) and to grant honors or awards. Always lend, not borrow, leihen/ausleihen can mean borrow.

to miss — özlemek / eksikliğini hissetme.exde: Ich vermisse meine Freunde, seitdemich ins Ausland gezogen bin.
to miss — özlemek / eksikliğini hissetme.exen: I miss my friends since I moved abroad.

to occur / to seem — olmak / meydana gel.notes: Üç anlamı vardır: (1) küçük, dramatik olmayan olayların “olması / gerçekleşmesi”; (2) “birine öyle gelmek” (bana tuhaf geliyor, garip geliyor): es kommt mir … vor; (3) bir şeyin bir yerde “bulunması / geçmesi” bu bitkiler afrikada bulunur, bu kelime metinde geciyor, bulunur vs. Ciddi olaylar için passieren kullanılır.

to read aloud — yüksek sesle okumak.exde: Der Vater liest den Kindern jeden Abend eine Geschichte vor, bevor sie schlafen gehen.
to read aloud — yüksek sesle okumak.exen: The father reads a story to the children every evening before they go to sleep.
to read aloud — yüksek sesle okumak.notes: Combines lesen with prefix vor-meaning aloud and to others.

to agree / confirm — kabul etmek / onayl.exde: Er hat mir sofort zugesagt, als ich ihn um Hilfe bat.
to agree / confirm — kabul etmek / onayl.exen: He agreed immediately when I asked him for help.
to agree / confirm — kabul etmek / onayl.notes: Often used for accepting invitations or promises.

to watch / observe — seyretmek / izlemek.exde: Die Kinder schauten fasziniert zu, während der Zauberer auftrat.
to watch / observe — seyretmek / izlemek.exen: The children watched fascinated while the magician performed.
to watch / observe — seyretmek / izlemek.notes: Involves active observation of an event or person; Dativ structure.

to break — kırmak / kırılmak.exde: Er hat sich den Arm gebrochen, als er vom Fahrrad fiel.
to break — kırmak / kırılmak.exen: He broke his arm when he fell off the bike.
to break — kırmak / kırılmak.notes: Transitive = to break something; intransitive = to break by itself.

to stare (at) — dik dik bakmak / gözünü.exde: Er starrte minuten lang auf den Bildschirm, ohne dass er etwas sah.
to stare (at) — dik dik bakmak / gözünü.exen: He stared at the screen for minutes without actually seeing anything.

to report / get in touch — bildirmek / h.exde: Ich melde mich, sobald ich angekommen bin.
to report / get in touch — bildirmek / h.exen: I’ll get in touch as soon as I arrive.
to report / get in touch — bildirmek / h.notes: Reflexive for communication; non-reflexive for official reporting or registration.

to address / speak to — birine hitap etm.exde: Er sprach sie schüchtern an, weil er sie schon lange kannte.
to address / speak to — birine hitap etm.exen: He spoke to her shyly because he had known her for a long time.
to address / speak to — birine hitap etm.notes: Used for addressing someone directly or starting a conversation; can also mean “to appeal to” (etwas spricht mich an).

to benefit (from) — bir şeyden faydalanm.exde: Wir haben von diesem Kurs sehr profitiert, obwohl er nur zwei Wochen dauerte.
to benefit (from) — bir şeyden faydalanm.exen: We benefited from this course even though it lasted only two weeks.
to benefit (from) — bir şeyden faydalanm.notes: Indicates gaining advantage or benefit from something; often used with von.

to reduce (jobs, stress) / dismantle — a.exde: Das Unternehmen baut Stellen ab, damit es Kosten sparen kann.
to reduce (jobs, stress) / dismantle — a.exen: The company is cutting jobs so that it can save costs.
to reduce (jobs, stress) / dismantle — a.notes: Literally means “to dismantle,” but commonly used for reducing stress, jobs, or structures.

to praise / compliment — övmek / takdir.exde: Der Lehrer lobte die Schülerin, weil sie sich viel Mühe gegeben hatte.
to praise / compliment — övmek / takdir.exen: The teacher praised the student because she had made a great effort.
to praise / compliment — övmek / takdir.notes: Used to express approval or admiration for someone’s actions or qualities.

to inquire / ask about — bilgi almak / s.exde: Ich erkundigte mich bei der Sekretärin nach dem neuen Termin.
to inquire / ask about — bilgi almak / s.exen: I inquired with the secretary about the new appointment.
to inquire / ask about — bilgi almak / s.notes: Always reflexive; used for asking or finding out information in a polite or formal way.

to fall in love (with) — âşık olmak.exde: Sie hat sich in ihren besten Freund verliebt, obwohl sie ihn jahrelang nur kannte.
to fall in love (with) — âşık olmak.exen: She fell in love withher best friend, although she had known him for years.
to fall in love (with) — âşık olmak.notes: Always reflexive; used with in + Akk. to express romantic feelings.

to behave — davranmak.exde: Das Kind verhielt sich so ruhig, als ob es nichts gehört hätte.
to behave — davranmak.exen: The child behaved so quietly as if it hadn’t heard anything.
to behave — davranmak.notes: Always reflexive; describes one’s behavior or attitude in a situation. Often used with comparisons (wie, als ob).

to be mistaken / wrong (about sb/sth) —.exde: Ich habe mich geirrt, weil ich die falsche Uhrzeit notiert hatte.
to be mistaken / wrong (about sb/sth) —.exen: I was mistaken because I had written down the wrong time.
to be mistaken / wrong (about sb/sth) —.notes: Always reflexive; used for realizing that one was wrong about something.

to mishear — yanlış duymak.exde: Sie hat sich verhört, da die Musik im Hintergrund zu laut war.
to mishear — yanlış duymak.exen: She misheard, since the music in the background was too loud.
to mishear — yanlış duymak.notes: Used when one hears something incorrectly; reflexive in this sense (non-reflexive means to interrogate).

to misread — yanlış okumak.exde: Ich habe mich verlesen, als ich die E-Mail zu schnell überflogen habe.
to misread — yanlış okumak.exen: I misread it when I skimmed the email too quickly.
to misread — yanlış okumak.notes: Always reflexive when meaning “to misread”; non-reflexive verlesen means “to read aloud officially.”

to misspeak / make a slip of the tongue.exde: Der Politiker hat sich versprochen, obwohl er seine Rede gut vorbereitet hatte.
to misspeak / make a slip of the tongue.exen: The politician misspoke, although he had prepared his speech well.
to misspeak / make a slip of the tongue.notes: Reflexive means to make a speaking mistake; non-reflexive versprechenmeans “to promise.”

to make a writing error — yanlış yazmak.exde: Der Arzt hat sich verschrieben, als er das Rezept schnell ausstellte.
to make a writing error — yanlış yazmak.exen: The doctor made a writing mistake when he issued the prescription quickly.
to make a writing error — yanlış yazmak.notes: Reflexive = to make a spelling/writing error; non-reflexive = to prescribe (medicine).

to miscalculate — yanlış hesap yapmak.exde: Der Kassierer hat sich verrechnet, weil der Kunde zu viele Münzen gab.
to miscalculate — yanlış hesap yapmak.exen: The cashier miscalculated because the customer gave too many coins.
to miscalculate — yanlış hesap yapmak.notes: Used for numerical mistakes; always reflexive in this sense.

to occur / happen — meydana gelmek / olm.exde: Ein Unfall ereignete sich, während es stark regnete.
to occur / happen — meydana gelmek / olm.exen: An accident occurred while it was raining heavily.
to occur / happen — meydana gelmek / olm.notes: Formal/literary synonym of passieren or geschehen; always reflexive.

to decide / make up one’s mind — karar v.exde: Sie hat sich entschlossen, nach Berlin zu ziehen, weil sie dort Arbeit gefunden hat.
to decide / make up one’s mind — karar v.exen: She decided to move to Berlin because she found a job there.
to decide / make up one’s mind — karar v.notes: Always reflexive; more deliberate than sich entscheiden(implies firm resolution). Beschließen is when a group decides on sth, often official, entschließen is personal, sich entschließen (make up one’s mind, deciding after hesitation),. Entscheiden can be used for all decide sentences, but will be less specific.

to afford / allow oneself — maddi gücü y.exde: Ich leiste mir selten etwas Teures, damit ich Geld sparen kann.
to afford / allow oneself — maddi gücü y.exen: I rarely allow myself something expensive so that I can save money.
to afford / allow oneself — maddi gücü y.notes: Always reflexive when meaning “to afford for oneself.” Can also mean “to achieve.”

to add — eklemek / ilave etmek.exde: Er fügte hinzu, dass er bald zurückkehren werde.
to add — eklemek / ilave etmek.exen: He added that he would return soon.
to add — eklemek / ilave etmek.notes: Used for adding information, objects, or remarks; often followed by dass-clause.

may / to be allowed to — izinli olmak.exde: Du darfst hier nicht parken, obwohl der Platz leer aussieht.
may / to be allowed to — izinli olmak.exen: You may not park here, although the spot looks empty.
may / to be allowed to — izinli olmak.notes: Modal verb indicating permission; conjugation irregular; Perfekt rarely used in speech.

can / to be able to — yapabilmek.exde: Ich kann heute nicht kommen, weil ich arbeiten muss.
can / to be able to — yapabilmek.exen: I can’t come today becauseI have to work.
can / to be able to — yapabilmek.notes: Expresses ability or possibility; irregular conjugation; Perfekt form (hat gekonnt) is rare.

to depart / leave — yola çıkmak / ayrılm.exde: Wir sind früh abgereist, damit wir den Zug nicht verpassen.
to depart / leave — yola çıkmak / ayrılm.exen: We left early so that we wouldn’t miss the train.
to depart / leave — yola çıkmak / ayrılm.notes: Used for travel departures; takes sein in Perfekt; formal/literary tone.

to weigh — tartmak / ağırlığında olmak.exde: Das Paket wiegt mehr, als ich erwartet hatte.
to weigh — tartmak / ağırlığında olmak.exen: The package weighs more than I expected.
to weigh — tartmak / ağırlığında olmak.notes: Used both transitively (to weigh sth) and intransitively (to have a weight).

to pump — pompalamak.exde: Er pumpt Luft in den Reifen, weiler morgen Fahrrad fahren will.
to pump — pompalamak.exen: He is pumping air into the tire because he wants to ride tomorrow.
to pump — pompalamak.notes: Everyday use for inflating, also used metaphorically (e.g. Geld pumpen = lend money).

to weigh out / measure — tartmak (ölçere.exde: Die Verkäuferin wog das Obst ab, bevor sie es in die Tüte legte.
to weigh out / measure — tartmak (ölçere.exen: The saleswoman weighed out the fruit before putting it into the bag.
to weigh out / measure — tartmak (ölçere.notes: Used for precisely weighing portions, food, or materials.

to drip — damlamak.exde: Der Wasserhahn tropft, obwohl er gestern repariert wurde.
to drip — damlamak.exen: The faucet is dripping, although it was repaired yesterday.
to drip — damlamak.notes: Describes liquid dripping or leaking slowly; intransitive only.

to be valid — geçerli olmak.exde: Der Ausweis ist nur gültig, wenn er unterschrieben wurde.
to be valid — geçerli olmak.exen: The ID is only valid if it has been signed.
to be valid — geçerli olmak.notes: Used for official validity of documents, tickets, etc.

to be fit / in shape — formda olmak.exde: Ich bin wieder fit, seitdem ich regelmäßig Sport treibe.
to be fit / in shape — formda olmak.exen: I’ve been fit again since I started exercising regularly.
to be fit / in shape — formda olmak.notes: Used for health and fitness; often colloquial.

to miss a chance — bir fırsatı kaçırmak.exde: Er hat die Chance verpasst, weil er zu lange gezögert hat.
to miss a chance — bir fırsatı kaçırmak.exen: He missed the chance because he hesitated too long.
to miss a chance — bir fırsatı kaçırmak.notes: Fixed expression with verpassen; always takes Akkusativ.

to make an effort — çaba göstermek / uğr.exde: Sie gab sich große Mühe, damit ihre Präsentation perfekt wurde.
to make an effort — çaba göstermek / uğr.exen: She made a great effort so that her presentation would be perfect.
to make an effort — çaba göstermek / uğr.notes: Reflexive idiom meaning “to try hard”; always with sich + Dativ + Mühe geben.

to depend on — bağlı olmak.exde: Es hängt vom Wetter ab, ob wir morgen wandern gehen.
to depend on — bağlı olmak.exen: It depends on the weather whether we go hiking tomorrow.
to depend on — bağlı olmak.notes: Common idiom; always with von + Dativ; “es hängt davon ab, …” is frequent clause form.

to start with — ile başlamak.exde: Wir fangen mit dem Unterricht an, sobald alle da sind.
to start with — ile başlamak.exen: We start with the lesson as soon as everyone is there.
to start with — ile başlamak.notes: Separable verb; Perfekt with haben; mit + Dat. marks starting point.

to call at — bir yeri aramak.exde: Ich rufe bei der Bank an, weil meine Karte gesperrt ist.
to call at — bir yeri aramak.exen: I’m calling the bank because my card is blocked.
to call at — bir yeri aramak.notes: Always bei + Dat.for institutions or persons; separable prefix verb.

to answer to — cevap vermek.exde: Er antwortet auf meine E-Mail, nachdem er sie gelesen hat.
to answer to — cevap vermek.exen: He answers my email after reading it.
to answer to — cevap vermek.notes: auf + Akk. marks what is being answered; Dativ for person if direct.

to work on — üzerinde çalışmak.exde: Ich arbeite an einem neuen Projekt, das nächste Woche fertig sein soll.
to work on — üzerinde çalışmak.exen: I’m working on a new project that should be finished next week.
to work on — üzerinde çalışmak.notes: Used for projects, goals, or improvement; an + Dat..

to get annoyed about — bir şeye sinirlen.exde: Ich ärgere mich über den Lärm, obwohl die Fenster geschlossen sind.
to get annoyed about — bir şeye sinirlen.exen: I’m annoyed about the noise although the windows are closed.
to get annoyed about — bir şeye sinirlen.notes: Reflexive; expresses irritation; always über + Akk..

to stop with — bırakmak.exde: Er hört mit dem Rauchen auf, damit er gesünder lebt.
to stop with — bırakmak.exen: He’s quitting smoking so that he lives healthier.
to stop with — bırakmak.notes: Separable verb; mit + Dat. marks what is stopped.

to thank for — bir şey için teşekkür etm.exde: Ich bedanke mich für deine Hilfe, weil ich es ohne dich nicht geschafft hätte.
to thank for — bir şey için teşekkür etm.exen: I thank you for your help because I couldn’t have done it without you.
to thank for — bir şey için teşekkür etm.notes: Reflexive; always für + Akk. for the thing, bei + Dat. for person.

to begin with — ile başlamak.exde: Wir beginnen mit dem Essen, sobald alle am Tisch sitzen.
to begin with — ile başlamak.exen: We begin eating as soon as everyone is seated.
to begin with — ile başlamak.notes: More formal than anfangen; Perfekt with haben.

to strive for — çabalamak / uğraşmak.exde: Er bemüht sich um eine neue Stelle, weil er umziehen will.
to strive for — çabalamak / uğraşmak.exen: He’s striving for a new job because he wants to move.
to strive for — çabalamak / uğraşmak.notes: Always um + Akk.; implies effort toward obtaining something.

to report about — hakkında haber vermek.exde: Die Zeitung berichtet über den Unfall, der gestern passiert ist.
to report about — hakkında haber vermek.exen: The newspaper reports about the accident that happened yesterday.
to report about — hakkında haber vermek.notes: Non-reflexive; über + Akk. for topic, von + Dat. for source.

to consist of — oluşmak.exde: Das Team besteht aus fünf Leuten, die gut zusammenarbeiten.
to consist of — oluşmak.exen: The team consists of five people who work well together.

to apply for — başvurmak.exde: Ich bewerbe mich um die Stelle, obwohl ich wenig Erfahrung habe.
to apply for — başvurmak.exen: I’m applying for the job although I have little experience.
to apply for — başvurmak.notes: Reflexive; um + Akk.marks what you apply for; bei + Dat.for place.
