to ask for — istemek / rica etmek.exde: Ich bitte dich um Geduld, bis alles geklärt ist.
to ask for — istemek / rica etmek.exen: I ask you for patience until everything is resolved.

to think of — düşünmek.exde: Ich denke oft an dich, wenn ich dieses Lied höre.
to think of — düşünmek.exen: I often think of you when I hear this song.
to think of — düşünmek.notes: Common with people or things; an + Akk.. Target of thought.

to discuss about — tartışmak.exde: Wir diskutieren über Politik, obwohl wir selten einer Meinung sind.
to discuss about — tartışmak.exen: We discuss politics although we rarely agree.

to invite to — davet etmek.exde: Ich lade dich zum Abendessen ein, wenn du Zeit hast.
to invite to — davet etmek.exen: I invite you to dinner if you have time.
to invite to — davet etmek.notes: Separable; zu + Dat.; Perfekt with haben.

to decide for — bir şeyi seçmek.exde: Sie hat sich für das rote Kleid entschieden, weil es ihr besser steht.
to decide for — bir şeyi seçmek.exen: She chose the red dress because it suits her better.

to remember — hatırlamak.exde: Ich erinnere mich an den Sommer, als wir jeden Tag am Meer waren.
to remember — hatırlamak.exen: I remember the summer when we were at the sea every day.
to remember — hatırlamak.notes: Reflexive; an + Akk.; “sich erinnern” = recall (not memorize).

to ask about — sormak.exde: Der Tourist fragt nach dem Weg, obwohl er eine Karte hat.
to ask about — sormak.exen: The tourist asks for directions even though he has a map.
to ask about — sormak.notes: nach + Dat. indicates what is being asked about.

to look forward to — dört gözle beklemek.exde: Ich freue mich auf das Wochenende, weil ich ausschlafen kann.
to look forward to — dört gözle beklemek.exen: I’m looking forward to the weekend because I can sleep in.

to be glad about — sevinmek.exde: Er freut sich über das Geschenk, das du ihm gegeben hast.
to be glad about — sevinmek.exen: He’s happy about the gift you gave him.

to belong to — ait olmak.exde: Berlin gehört zu den größten Städten Europas.
to belong to — ait olmak.exen: Berlin belongs to the largest cities in Europe.
to belong to — ait olmak.notes: zu + Dat. indicates membership or part of a group.

to believe in — inanmak.exde: Ich glaube an dich, auch wenn du zweifelst.
to believe in — inanmak.exen: I believe in you even when you doubt yourself.
to believe in — inanmak.notes: an + Akk. for trust or faith.

to congratulate on — tebrik etmek.exde: Ich gratuliere dir zum Erfolg, weil du hart gearbeitet hast.
to congratulate on — tebrik etmek.exen: I congratulate you on your success because you worked hard.

to hope for — ummak / ümit etmek.exde: Wir hoffen auf gutes Wetter, damit wir grillen können.
to hope for — ummak / ümit etmek.exen: We hope for good weather so we can grill.
to hope for — ummak / ümit etmek.notes: auf + Akk.; “to look forward with desire”.

to be interested in — ilgilenmek.exde: Ich interessiere mich für Geschichte, seit ich ein Kind war.
to be interested in — ilgilenmek.exen: I’ve been interested in history since I was a child.
to be interested in — ilgilenmek.notes: für + Akk. always; an + Dat. is incorrect in this sense.

to take care of — ilgilenmek / bakmak [(.exde: Sie kümmert sich um die Pflanzen, damit sie nicht vertrocknen.
to take care of — ilgilenmek / bakmak [(.exen: She takes care of the plants so that they don’t dry out.
to take care of — ilgilenmek / bakmak [(.notes: Reflexive verb indicating care or responsibility; “um + Akk.” marks what is cared for.  sich kümmern: take care, ilgilenmek, yemek vermek, arabayla goturmek, uyutmak uyandirmak vs. Aufpassen auf: basinda durmak, izlemek, ilgilenmek, ya da göz kulak olmak. Hasta arkadasina sich kümmern, arkadasinin kopegine aufpassen auf.

to take care of — ilgilenmek / bakmak [s.exde: Sie kümmert sich um ihre Großeltern, weil sie allein leben.
to take care of — ilgilenmek / bakmak [s.exen: She takes care of her grandparents because they live alone.

to laugh about — bir şeye gülmek.exde: Wir lachen über den Witz, obwohl er alt ist.
to laugh about — bir şeye gülmek.exen: We laugh at the joke although it’s old.
to laugh about — bir şeye gülmek.notes: über + Akk. for the cause of laughter.

to suffer from (illness) — bir hastalıkt.exde: Er leidet an Asthma, weshalb er nicht rauchen darf.
to suffer from (illness) — bir hastalıkt.exen: He suffers from asthma, which is why he must not smoke.
to suffer from (illness) — bir hastalıkt.notes: Used for medical/physical conditions; always an + Dativ.

to suffer from (situation) — bir durumda.exde: Sie leidet unter dem Lärm, obwohl die Fenster geschlossen sind.
to suffer from (situation) — bir durumda.exen: She suffers from the noise, although the windows are closed.
to suffer from (situation) — bir durumda.notes: Used for stress, noise, people, circumstances; unter + Dativ.

to reflect on — bir şeyi düşünmek / kafa.exde: Ich denke über deine Idee nach, bevor ich eine Entscheidung treffe.
to reflect on — bir şeyi düşünmek / kafa.exen: I’m thinking about your idea before I make a decision.
to reflect on — bir şeyi düşünmek / kafa.notes: Separable verb (nachdenken); über + Akk. for topic.

to match / suit — uymak / yakışmak.exde: Das Hemd passt gut zu deiner Hose, obwohl die Farben verschieden sind.
to match / suit — uymak / yakışmak.exen: The shirt goes well with your pants, although the colors are different.

to speak with — biriyle konuşmak.exde: Ich spreche mit meinem Chef, sobald er wieder im Büro ist.
to speak with — biriyle konuşmak.exen: I’ll talk with my boss as soon as he’s back in the office.

to talk about — hakkında konuşmak.exde: Wir sprechen über die Zukunft, damit wir besser planen können.
to talk about — hakkında konuşmak.exen: We talk about the future so that we can plan better.
to talk about — hakkında konuşmak.notes: über + Akk. for topic; very frequent verb.

to take part in — katılmak.exde: Ich nehme an einem Deutschkurs teil, weil ich fließend sprechen möchte.
to take part in — katılmak.exen: I’m taking part in a German course because I want to speak fluently.
to take part in — katılmak.notes: Separable verb; an + Dat. marks the event.

to fall in love with — birine aşık olmak.exde: Er hat sich in seine Nachbarin verliebt, obwohl sie viel älter ist.
to fall in love with — birine aşık olmak.exen: He fell in love with his neighbor, although she is much older.
to fall in love with — birine aşık olmak.notes: Reflexive; always in + Akk. for the person.

to rely on — güvenmek.exde: Du kannst dich auf mich verlassen, wenn du Hilfe brauchst.
to rely on — güvenmek.exen: You can rely on me when you need help.
to rely on — güvenmek.notes: Reflexive; strong sense of trust; auf + Akk..

to wait for — beklemek.exde: Wir warten auf den Zug, der wegen des Wetters Verspätung hat.
to wait for — beklemek.exen: We’re waiting for the train that is delayed because of the weather.
to wait for — beklemek.notes: auf + Akk.; used for people, vehicles, results etc.

to doubt — şüphe etmek.exde: Ich zweifle an seiner Geschichte, obwohl sie glaubwürdig klingt.
to doubt — şüphe etmek.exen: I doubt his story, although it sounds believable.

to make a decision — karar vermek.exde: Wir haben die Entscheidung getroffen, umzuziehen, weil die Wohnung zu klein ist.
to make a decision — karar vermek.exen: We made the decision to move because the flat is too small.
to make a decision — karar vermek.notes: Very common fixed collocation with treffen.

to ask a question — soru sormak.exde: Der Schüler stellt eine Frage, weil er den Text nicht versteht.
to ask a question — soru sormak.exen: The student asks a question because he doesn’t understand the text.
to ask a question — soru sormak.notes: Neutral/formal way to say “to ask a question”.

to give an answer — cevap vermek.exde: Der Lehrer gab eine klare Antwort, damit alle Schüler es verstehen.
to give an answer — cevap vermek.exen: The teacher gave a clear answer so that all students understand it.
to give an answer — cevap vermek.notes: Often paired with eine Frage stellen; Dat. for person: jemandem eine Antwort geben.

to pass an exam — sınavı geçmek.exde: Sie hat die Prüfung bestanden, obwohl sie sehr nervös war.
to pass an exam — sınavı geçmek.exen: She passed the exam, although she was very nervous.

to play a role — rol oynamak / önemli ol.exde: Geld spielt in dieser Entscheidung eine große Rolle.
to play a role — rol oynamak / önemli ol.exen: Money plays a big role in this decision.
to play a role — rol oynamak / önemli ol.notes: Figurative importance; keine Rolle spielen = “to not matter”.

to find a solution — çözüm bulmak.exde: Wir müssen schnell eine Lösung finden, bevor das Problem größer wird.
to find a solution — çözüm bulmak.exen: We must quickly find a solution before the problem gets bigger.

to make an appointment — randevu almak /.exde: Ich möchte einen Termin beim Arzt vereinbaren, weil ich seit Tagen Husten habe.
to make an appointment — randevu almak /.exen: I’d like to make a doctor’s appointment because I’ve had a cough for days.

to express an opinion — görüş belirtmek.exde: Jeder darf seine Meinung äußern, solange er respektvoll bleibt.
to express an opinion — görüş belirtmek.exen: Everyone may express their opinion as long as they remain respectful.
to express an opinion — görüş belirtmek.notes: Formal collocation with äußern = voice, state.

to make a suggestion — öneride bulunmak.exde: Er machte einen Vorschlag, der allen helfen könnte.
to make a suggestion — öneride bulunmak.exen: He made a suggestion that could help everyone.
to make a suggestion — öneride bulunmak.notes: Very frequent fixed phrase; often with Konjunktiv II for politeness.

to get in touch with — iletişime geçmek.exde: Wir haben Kontakt mit der Firma aufgenommen, um weitere Informationen zu bekommen.
to get in touch with — iletişime geçmek.exen: We got in touch with the company to get more information.
to get in touch with — iletişime geçmek.notes: Separable verb phrase; mit + Dat.for the person/organization.

to leave a message — mesaj bırakmak.exde: Ich habe dir eine Nachricht hinterlassen, weil du nicht zu Hause warst.
to leave a message — mesaj bırakmak.exen: I left you a message because you weren’t at home.

to get into a panic — panik yapmak / pan.exde: Einige Leute gerieten in Panik, als das Licht plötzlich ausging.
to get into a panic — panik yapmak / pan.exen: Some people panicked when the light suddenly went out.
to get into a panic — panik yapmak / pan.notes: Uses sein in Perfekt; emotional state change.

to get into trouble — başı belaya girmek.exde: Er ist in Schwierigkeiten geraten, weil er die Miete nicht bezahlt hat.
to get into trouble — başı belaya girmek.exen: He got into trouble because he didn’t pay the rent.
to get into trouble — başı belaya girmek.notes: Idiomatic; again with sein in Perfekt.

to be in a hurry — acele etmek / telaşta.exde: Sie war so in Eile, dass sie ihr Handy zu Hause vergessen hat.
to be in a hurry — acele etmek / telaşta.exen: She was in such a hurry that she forgot her phone at home.
to be in a hurry — acele etmek / telaşta.notes: Fixed phrase with sein; describes hurried state.

to be under pressure — baskı altında olm.exde: Er steht im Moment unter großem Druck, weil die Prüfung bald ist.
to be under pressure — baskı altında olm.exen: He is currently under a lot of pressure because the exam is soon.
to be under pressure — baskı altında olm.notes: Very common idiom for stress and expectations.

to come up with an idea — aklına gelmek.exde: Sie kam auf die Idee, einen Blog zu starten, als sie im Urlaub war.
to come up with an idea — aklına gelmek.exen: She came up with the idea of starting a blog when she was on vacation.
to come up with an idea — aklına gelmek.notes: Fixed collocation; often used with erst/überhaupt: Wie bist du darauf gekommen?.

to be trendy — moda olmak / trendde olma.exde: Nachhaltige Mode liegt im Trend, weil immer mehr Menschen auf die Umwelt achten.
to be trendy — moda olmak / trendde olma.exen: Sustainable fashion is trendy because more and more people care about the environment.
to be trendy — moda olmak / trendde olma.notes: Used for fashion, products, ideas; literally “to lie in the trend”.

to take a break — ara vermek / dinlenmek.exde: Wir machen eine kurze Pause, damit wir wieder Energie haben.
to take a break — ara vermek / dinlenmek.exen: We’re taking a short break so that we have energy again.
to take a break — ara vermek / dinlenmek.notes: Everyday phrase; similar to Pause machen.

to be stuck in traffic — trafikte kalmak.exde: Ich stand eine Stunde im Stau, obwohl ich früh losgefahren bin.
to be stuck in traffic — trafikte kalmak.exen: I was stuck in traffic for an hour although I left early.
to be stuck in traffic — trafikte kalmak.notes: Literally “to stand in a traffic jam”.

to have fun — eğlenmek.exde: Wir hatten viel Spaß, obwohl das Wetter schlecht war.
to have fun — eğlenmek.exen: We had a lot of fun, although the weather was bad.
to have fun — eğlenmek.notes: Often used with an + Dat. (Spaß an etwas haben).

to make plans — plan yapmak.exde: Wir machen Pläne für den Sommer, wenn wir wissen, wann wir Urlaub haben.
to make plans — plan yapmak.exen: We’re making plans for the summer when we know when we have vacation.

to make mistakes — hata yapmak.exde: Jeder macht Fehler, solange er daraus lernt.
to make mistakes — hata yapmak.exen: Everyone makes mistakes as long as they learn from them.
to make mistakes — hata yapmak.notes: Very frequent phrase; plural Fehler unchanged.

to take notes — not almak.exde: Ich mache Notizen, während der Lehrer spricht.
to take notes — not almak.exen: I take notes while the teacher is speaking.
to take notes — not almak.notes: Often reflexive variant: sich Notizen machen.

to break up / end something — bitirmek /.exde: Sie hat mit ihm Schluss gemacht, weil sie nicht mehr glücklich war.
to break up / end something — bitirmek /.exen: She broke up with him because she wasn’t happy anymore.
to break up / end something — bitirmek /.notes: Informal; can be used for relationships or activities (mit dem Rauchen Schluss machen).

to take time for — bir şeye zaman ayırma.exde: Er nimmt sich Zeit für seine Familie, obwohl er viel arbeitet.
to take time for — bir şeye zaman ayırma.exen: He takes time for his family, although he works a lot.
to take time for — bir şeye zaman ayırma.notes: Reflexive; often with extra / genug Zeit.

to not feel like (doing sth) — canı iste.exde: Ich habe keine Lust auf Kino, weil ich müde bin.
to not feel like (doing sth) — canı iste.exen: I don’t feel like going to the movies because I’m tired.
to not feel like (doing sth) — canı iste.notes: Everyday expression; auf + Akk. for activity.

to feel like / be up for — canı istemek.exde: Ich habe Bock auf Pizza, obwohl ich gestern schon eine gegessen habe.
to feel like / be up for — canı istemek.exen: I feel like having pizza even though I ate one yesterday.
to feel like / be up for — canı istemek.notes: Very colloquial; similar to Lust haben.

to be in a hurry — acele etmek.exde: Ich habe es eilig, weil mein Zug gleich fährt.
to be in a hurry — acele etmek.exen: I’m in a hurry because my train leaves soon.
to be in a hurry — acele etmek.notes: Fixed expression; literally “to have it hurried.”

to mean well (with someone) — iyi niyetl.exde: Er meint es gut mit dir, auch wenn du es nicht merkst.
to mean well (with someone) — iyi niyetl.exen: He means well with you, even if you don’t notice.

to have no idea — hiçbir fikri olmamak.exde: Ich habe keinen Plan von Mathe, obwohl ich viel lerne.
to have no idea — hiçbir fikri olmamak.exen: I have no idea about math although I study a lot.
to have no idea — hiçbir fikri olmamak.notes: Very colloquial; von + Dat. for topic.

to let someone know — birine haber verme.exde: Sag mir bitte Bescheid, wenn du zu Hause bist.
to let someone know — birine haber verme.exen: Please let me know when you get home.
to let someone know — birine haber verme.notes: Fixed phrase with Bescheid as a frozen noun.

to know about something — haberi olmak /.exde: Ich weiß über das Treffen Bescheid.
to know about something — haberi olmak /.notes: Means “be informed/aware”; über + Akk. for topic.

to leave someone alone — birini rahat bı.exde: Lass mich bitte in Ruhe, ich will nachdenken.
to leave someone alone — birini rahat bı.exen: Please leave me alone, I want to think.
to leave someone alone — birini rahat bı.notes: Strong phrase; used when wanting space.

to get in touch — haber vermek / iletişi.exde: Melde dich, sobald du angekommen bist.
to get in touch — haber vermek / iletişi.exen: Get in touch as soon as you arrive.

to call someone — birini aramak.exde: Ich rufe dich an, wenn ich frei bin.
to call someone — birini aramak.exen: I’ll call you when I’m free.

to get to know someone — biriyle tanışma.exde: Ich habe viele Leute kennengelernt, als ich umgezogen bin.
to get to know someone — biriyle tanışma.exen: I met many people when I moved.
to get to know someone — biriyle tanışma.notes: Separable verb; used for “to meet for the first time.”

to try something out — denemek.exde: Ich probiere ein neues Rezept aus, weil ich Gäste erwarte.
to try something out — denemek.exen: I’m trying a new recipe because I expect guests.

to pick someone up — birini almak.exde: Ich hole dich vom Bahnhof ab, sobald dein Zug ankommt.
to pick someone up — birini almak.exen: I’ll pick you up at the station as soon as your train arrives.

to rest — dinlenmek.exde: Ich ruhe mich aus, nachdem ich den ganzen Tag gearbeitet habe.
to rest — dinlenmek.exen: I rest after working all day.

to write a message — mesaj yazmak.exde: Schreib mir bitte eine Nachricht, wenn du losgehst.
to write a message — mesaj yazmak.exen: Please write me a message when you leave.

there is / there are — var.exde: Es gibt viele Gründe, warum ich umziehen möchte.
there is / there are — var.exen: There are many reasons why I want to move.
there is / there are — var.notes: Means “exist / be present”; extremely common structure.

to stay calm — sakin kalmak.exde: Er bleibt in Ruhe, obwohl alles schiefgeht.
to stay calm — sakin kalmak.exen: He stays calm although everything goes wrong.

to be fed up — bıkmak.exde: Ich habe die Nase voll von diesem Lärm.
to be fed up — bıkmak.exen: I’m fed up with this noise.

to manage / succeed — başarmak.exde: Ich hoffe, dass ich es rechtzeitig schaffe.
to manage / succeed — başarmak.exen: I hope I manage it on time.
to manage / succeed — başarmak.notes: Object is always es when meaning “to succeed”.

to be done/exhausted — bitmiş olmak.exde: Ich bin endlich fertig, obwohl es lange gedauert hat.
to be done/exhausted — bitmiş olmak.exen: I’m finally done although it took a long time.

to be broken / exhausted — bozuk / bitki.exde: Mein Handy ist kaputt, deshalb kann ich dich nicht anrufen.
to be broken / exhausted — bozuk / bitki.exen: My phone is broken, so I can’t call you.

to be good at something — bir şeyde iyi.exde: Er hat es drauf, schwierige Probleme zu lösen.
to be good at something — bir şeyde iyi.exen: He’s good at solving difficult problems.
to be good at something — bir şeyde iyi.notes: Colloquial; takes es as dummy object.

to be in a good mood — keyfi yerinde olm.exde: Ich bin heute gut drauf, weil die Sonne scheint.
to be in a good mood — keyfi yerinde olm.exen: I’m in a good mood today because the sun is shining.

to be in a bad mood — morali bozuk olmak.exde: Sie ist heute schlecht drauf, weil sie kaum geschlafen hat.
to be in a bad mood — morali bozuk olmak.exen: She’s in a bad mood today because she barely slept.

to be at work — işte olmak.exde: Ich bin gerade auf der Arbeit, deshalb kann ich nicht sprechen.
to be at work — işte olmak.exen: I’m at work right now, so I can’t talk.

to annoy someone — sinirlendirmek.exde: Du nervst mich, wenn du ständig unterbrichst.
to annoy someone — sinirlendirmek.exen: You annoy me when you interrupt all the time.
to annoy someone — sinirlendirmek.notes: Used for people or situations; informal.

to not want anymore — artık istememek.exde: Ich habe keinen Bock mehr auf dieses Projekt.

to manage / pull off — halletmek.exde: Er kriegt alles hin, auch wenn es schwierig ist.
to manage / pull off — halletmek.exen: He manages everything, even when it’s difficult.

to manage / make it — başarmak.exde: Wir schaffen das, wenn wir zusammenarbeiten.
to manage / make it — başarmak.exen: We can do it if we work together.

to go far — ilerlemek.exde: Wenn du weiter so arbeitest, wirst du es weit bringen.
to go far — ilerlemek.exen: If you keep working like this, you’ll go far.

to have a crush on — birinden hoşlanmak.exde: Ich glaube, sie steht auf ihn.
to have a crush on — birinden hoşlanmak.exen: I think she has a crush on him.

to have a bad feeling — içine kurt düşme.exde: Ich habe Bauchweh wegen des Treffens morgen.
to have a bad feeling — içine kurt düşme.exen: I have a bad feeling about tomorrow’s meeting.

to put pressure on — baskı yapmak.exde: Der Chef setzt alle unter Druck, damit sie schneller arbeiten.
to put pressure on — baskı yapmak.exen: The boss puts everyone under pressure so they work faster.

to change one’s opinion — fikrini değişt.exde: Ich habe meine Meinung geändert, nachdem ich mehr erfahren habe.
to change one’s opinion — fikrini değişt.exen: I changed my opinion after learning more.

to stay in touch — irtibatta kalmak.exde: Wir bleiben in Kontakt, auch wenn wir weit weg wohnen.
to stay in touch — irtibatta kalmak.exen: We stay in touch even if we live far apart.
to stay in touch — irtibatta kalmak.notes: Often used after courses, jobs, travel.

to be on the way — yolda olmak.exde: Ich bin schon auf dem Weg, also warte nicht zu lange.
to be on the way — yolda olmak.exen: I’m already on the way, so don’t wait too long.

to live in the moment — anı yaşamak.exde: Ich versuche, mehr im Moment zu leben.
to live in the moment — anı yaşamak.exen: I’m trying to live more in the moment.

to concentrate on — odaklanmak.exde: Ich kann mich auf die Arbeit nicht konzentrieren, wenn es laut ist.
to concentrate on — odaklanmak.exen: I can’t concentrate on work when it’s noisy.

to prepare for — hazırlanmak.exde: Ich bereite mich auf die Prüfung vor, damit ich bestehe.
to prepare for — hazırlanmak.exen: I’m preparing for the exam so I can pass.

to talk/chat about — hakkında sohbet etm.exde: Wir unterhalten uns über Filme, während wir essen.
to talk/chat about — hakkında sohbet etm.exen: We chat about movies while we’re eating.

to apply to (company) — bir yere başvurm.exde: Ich bewerbe mich bei einer internationalen Firma.
to apply to (company) — bir yere başvurm.exen: I’m applying at an international company.

to be responsible for — bir şeyden sorum.exde: Ich bin für das Projekt verantwortlich, deshalb prüfe ich alles zweimal.
to be responsible for — bir şeyden sorum.exen: I’m responsible for the project, so I check everything twice.

to choose between — iki şey arasında kar.exde: Ich kann mich nicht zwischen Kaffee und Tee entscheiden.
to choose between — iki şey arasında kar.exen: I can’t decide between coffee and tea.
to choose between — iki şey arasında kar.notes: Used for binary choices; zwischen + Dat..

to thank someone — birine teşekkür etmek.exde: Ich bedanke mich bei dir für deine Geduld.
to thank someone — birine teşekkür etmek.exen: I thank you for your patience.
to thank someone — birine teşekkür etmek.notes: Person = bei + Dat., reason = für + Akk..

to have interest in — bir şeye ilgi duym.exde: Er hat großes Interesse an Sprachen.
to have interest in — bir şeye ilgi duym.exen: He has great interest in languages.
to have interest in — bir şeye ilgi duym.notes: More formal than sich interessieren für.

to worry about — endişelenmek [sich sorg.exde: Ich sorge mich um dich, wenn du so spät nach Hause kommst.
to worry about — endişelenmek [sich sorg.exen: I worry about you when you come home so late.

to worry about — endişelenmek [sich Sorg.exde: Sie macht sich Sorgen um ihre Zukunft.

to be proud of — gurur duymak.exde: Ich bin stolz auf dich, weil du nie aufgibst.
to be proud of — gurur duymak.exen: I’m proud of you because you never give up.
to be proud of — gurur duymak.notes: Used for people/ achievements; auf + Akk..

to apologize to — birinden özür dilemek.exde: Ich entschuldige mich bei ihm, weil ich zu spät war.
to apologize to — birinden özür dilemek.exen: I apologize to him because I was late.

to apologize for — bir şey için özür dil.exde: Sie entschuldigt sich für den Fehler, den sie gemacht hat.
to apologize for — bir şey için özür dil.exen: She apologizes for the mistake she made.

to recover from — iyileşmek / toparlanma.exde: Ich erhole mich von der Grippe, damit ich wieder arbeiten kann.
to recover from — iyileşmek / toparlanma.exen: I’m recovering from the flu so I can work again.

to decide against — aleyhine karar verme.exde: Ich entschied mich gegen das Angebot, weil es zu teuer war.
to decide against — aleyhine karar verme.exen: I decided against the offer because it was too expensive.

to complain to — birine şikayet etmek.exde: Sie beschwert sich bei der Polizei über den Lärm.
to complain to — birine şikayet etmek.exen: She complains to the police about the noise.

to long for — özlemek / hasret duymak.exde: Er sehnt sich nach Ruhe, weil die Woche stressig war.
to long for — özlemek / hasret duymak.exen: He longs for peace because the week was stressful.

to be ashamed of — utanmak.exde: Ich schäme mich für mein Verhalten von gestern.
to be ashamed of — utanmak.exen: I’m ashamed of my behavior yesterday.

to get informed about — bilgi edinmek.exde: Ich informiere mich über die Regeln, bevor ich spiele.
to get informed about — bilgi edinmek.exen: I’m informing myself about the rules before I play.

to adhere to / follow — uymak.exde: Bitte halte dich an die Regeln, damit nichts passiert.
to adhere to / follow — uymak.exen: Please stick to the rules so nothing happens.

to be afraid of — korkmak.exde: Ich fürchte mich vor großen Hunden.

to argue with — biriyle tartışmak.exde: Ich streite mich oft mit meinem Bruder.
to argue with — biriyle tartışmak.exen: I often argue with my brother.

to argue about — bir şey hakkında tartış.exde: Wir streiten uns über Geld, weil er zu viel ausgibt.
to argue about — bir şey hakkında tartış.exen: We argue about money because he spends too much.

to give up / do without — vazgeçmek.exde: Ich verzichte auf Zucker, damit ich abnehme.
to give up / do without — vazgeçmek.exen: I’m giving up sugar so I can lose weight.

it’s about — konu ....exde: In diesem Film geht es um Freundschaft und Vertrauen.
it’s about — konu ....exen: This movie is about friendship and trust.

it depends on — buna bağlı.exde: Es kommt darauf an, wie viel Zeit wir haben.
it depends on — buna bağlı.exen: It depends on how much time we have.
it depends on — buna bağlı.notes: Always used with clause or was/wie/ob.

to refer to — bir şeye atıfta bulunmak.exde: Ich beziehe mich auf Ihre E-Mail vom 12. Mai.
to refer to — bir şeye atıfta bulunmak.exen: I refer to your email from May 12th.

to be about — konu olmak.exde: Es handelt sich um ein Missverständnis.

to deal with / be busy with — uğraşmak.exde: Ich beschäftige mich viel mit Musik, seit ich Gitarre spiele.
to deal with / be busy with — uğraşmak.exen: I spend a lot of time with music since I started playing guitar.
to deal with / be busy with — uğraşmak.notes: Often means to engage with something mentally.

to be surprised about — şaşırmak.exde: Ich wundere mich über seine Entscheidung.

to inquire about — bilgi almak.exde: Er erkundigte sich nach den Öffnungszeiten.
to inquire about — bilgi almak.exen: He asked about the opening hours.

to react to — tepki vermek.exde: Er reagierte nicht auf die Frage, weil er abgelenkt war.
to react to — tepki vermek.exen: He didn’t react to the question because he was distracted.

to deal with / engage in — bir işle uğra.exde: Wir befassen uns mit dem neuen Projekt im nächsten Meeting.
to deal with / engage in — bir işle uğra.exen: We will deal with the new project in the next meeting.

to differ from — farklı olmak.exde: Dieses Modell unterscheidet sich deutlich von dem alten.
to differ from — farklı olmak.exen: This model differs clearly from the old one.

to expect / count on — beklemek / hesap.exde: Wir rechnen damit, dass das Event gut besucht wird.
to expect / count on — beklemek / hesap.exen: We expect that the event will be well attended.

to assume — varsaymak.exde: Wir gehen davon aus, dass er heute nicht kommt.
to assume — varsaymak.exen: We assume that he is not coming today.

to result from — … kaynaklanmak.exde: Das Problem ergibt sich aus einem Missverständnis.
to result from — … kaynaklanmak.exen: The problem results from a misunderstanding.

to complain about — şikayet etmek.exde: Er beschwert sich über den Lärm.

to get used to — alışmak.exde: Ich habe mich schnell an das neue Klima gewöhnt.
to get used to — alışmak.exen: I quickly got used to the new climate.

to revolve around — etrafında dönmek.exde: Der Film dreht sich um eine Familie.
to revolve around — etrafında dönmek.exen: The movie is about a family.

to relieve / make easier — rahatlatmak /.notes: Can also mean “to facilitate” (eine Aufgabe erleichtern).

to go inside — içeri girmek.exde: Wir gehen hinein, weil es draußen kalt ist.
to go inside — içeri girmek.exen: We go inside because it’s cold outside.
to go inside — içeri girmek.notes: Separable verb; movement into an enclosed space.

to search through — aramak / didik didik.exde: Die Polizei durchsucht das Haus nach Beweisen.
to search through — aramak / didik didik.exen: The police search the house for evidence.

to sit down — oturmak.exde: Bitte setz dich hin, damit wir anfangen können.
to sit down — oturmak.exen: Please sit down so we can start.
to sit down — oturmak.notes: Motion into sitting position (not the state “sitzen”).

to call out / to summon — çağırmak / ses.exde: Der Arzt ruft den nächsten Patienten auf.
to call out / to summon — çağırmak / ses.exen: The doctor calls the next patient in.
to call out / to summon — çağırmak / ses.notes: Common in waiting rooms, meetings, events.

to board / climb — binmek / tırmanmak.exde: Wir besteigen den Zug, bevor er abfährt.
to board / climb — binmek / tırmanmak.exen: We board the train before it departs.
to board / climb — binmek / tırmanmak.notes: Used for vehicles or mountains (den Berg besteigen).

to line up / position oneself — dizilmek.exde: Die Schüler stellen sich auf dem Schulhof auf.
to line up / position oneself — dizilmek.exen: The students line up in the schoolyard.
to line up / position oneself — dizilmek.notes: Can also be non-reflexive: “to set something up.”

to undertake / to do — yapmak / girişimd.exde: Wir unternehmen am Wochenende einen Ausflug.
to undertake / to do — yapmak / girişimd.exen: We take a trip on the weekend.
to undertake / to do — yapmak / girişimd.notes: Often used for activities (Ausflug, Aktion, Plan).

to take down — aşağı indirmek.exde: Kannst du bitte das Buch herunternehmen?
to take down — aşağı indirmek.exen: Can you take down the book?

to come out / emerge — dışarı çıkmak.exde: Sie kommt heraus, um frische Luft zu holen.
to come out / emerge — dışarı çıkmak.exen: She comes out to get some fresh air.
to come out / emerge — dışarı çıkmak.notes: Also “to be revealed”: Es kam heraus, dass ….

to use / to apply — kullanmak.exde: Wir verwenden dieses Programm für unsere Präsentationen, weil es sehr einfach zu bedienen ist.
to use / to apply — kullanmak.exen: We use this program for our presentations because it is very easy to use.
to use / to apply — kullanmak.notes: Very common alternative to benutzen. für + Akk. marks the purpose: etw. für etw. verwenden. Use sth for a purpose. Benutzen is regualar wear-tear. Nutzen is for benefiting from sth.

to address someone with “du” — birine “s.exde: Ich duze meine Kollegen, weil wir in der Firma eine lockere Atmosphäre haben.
to address someone with “du” — birine “s.exen: I address my colleagues with “du” because we have a relaxed atmosphere at the company.
to address someone with “du” — birine “s.notes: Only for switching from “Sie” → “du”. Also spelled duzen / duzen; Perfekt: hat geduzt.

to plan / resolve to do something — bir.exde: Ich nehme mir vor, dieses Jahr mehr Sport zu machen.
to plan / resolve to do something — bir.exen: I plan to do more sports this year.
to plan / resolve to do something — bir.notes: sich (D) etw. vornehmen expresses a strong intention or resolution.

to catch a cold — üşütmek / soğuk almak.exde: Er hat sich erkältet, weil er ohne Jacke im Regen war.
to catch a cold — üşütmek / soğuk almak.exen: He caught a cold because he was outside in the rain without a jacket.
to catch a cold — üşütmek / soğuk almak.notes: Common everyday reflexive verb for getting sick (mild cold).

to break someone’s habit — birinin bir a.exde: Die Eltern versuchen, ihrem Kind das Daumenlutschen abzugewöhnen.
to break someone’s habit — birinin bir a.exen: The parents are trying to break their child’s habit of thumb-sucking.
to break someone’s habit — birinin bir a.notes: Used both for habits (eine Gewohnheit abgewöhnen) and people being trained.

to wish for something — bir şeyi dilemek.exde: Ich wünsche mir ein ruhiges Wochenende, weil ich sehr müde bin.
to wish for something — bir şeyi dilemek.exen: I wish for a quiet weekend because I’m very tired.
to wish for something — bir şeyi dilemek.notes: Extremely common; Dativ always marks the “wisher”: Ich wünsche mir ….

to monitor — gözetlemek.exde: Die Polizei überwacht das Gebäude rund um die Uhr.
to monitor — gözetlemek.exen: The police monitor the building around the clock.
to monitor — gözetlemek.notes: Used when keeping constant watch or checking something carefully (security, cameras, systems).

to rise — yükselmek.exde: Der Ballon steigt in den Himmel auf.
to rise — yükselmek.exen: The balloon rises into the sky.
to rise — yükselmek.notes: Movement upward; also used for promotions or moving to a higher level.

to borrow/lend — ödünç almak.exde: Ich leihe mir das Buch aus.
to borrow/lend — ödünç almak.notes: Can be “borrow” (sich etw.) or “lend” (jdm etw. ausleihen). Everyday use.

to undress — soyunmak.exde: Er zieht sich aus, bevor er duscht.

to take off clothes — çıkarmak.notes: Removing clothing from another person or object.

to inherit — miras almak.exde: Sie erbt das Haus ihrer Großeltern.
to inherit — miras almak.notes: Receiving property, money, traits after someone dies.

to drive past — yanından geçmek.exde: Wir fahren an der Kirche vorbei.
to drive past — yanından geçmek.notes: Moving past something without stopping; separable verb.

to bite — ısırmak.exde: Der Hund beißt den Ball kaputt.
to bite — ısırmak.exen: The dog bites the ball apart.
to bite — ısırmak.notes: Can refer to people, animals, or “biting through” objects.

to be suitable — uygun olmak.exde: Dieses Buch eignet sich für Anfänger.
to be suitable — uygun olmak.exen: This book is suitable for beginners.
to be suitable — uygun olmak.notes: Used to say something is appropriate or fits a certain purpose.

to turn (vehicle) — bir yola dönmek.notes: Turning into a street or direction. Abbiegen: turning when viewpoint is the street you are leaving, einbiegen is the street you are entering. Abbiegen mostly used when you are inside the car, einbiegen to describe when you are outside and describing another car, so abbiegen more common. Ein Wagen biegt von der Hauptstraße ab und (biegt) in die Seitenstraße ein.

to break in — zorla girmek.exde: Der Dieb drang in das Haus ein.
to break in — zorla girmek.exen: The thief broke into the house.
to break in — zorla girmek.notes: Forceful entry, or penetrating into something (literal/figurative).

to use/apply — kullanmak.notes: Means applying, using, or deploying something. Implies actively deploying or bringing something into operation—often tools, methods, resources, technology, or people (Personal einsetzen). Stronger and more purposeful than benutzen and verwenden, which simply mean “use.” Compared to anwenden, it is less technical; anwenden focuses on applying rules or techniques, while einsetzen emphasizes putting something into action for a specific purpose.

to scream — bağırmak.exde: Das Baby schreit die ganze Nacht.

to tear — yırtmak.notes: Tearing something into pieces; strong physical action.

to honk — korna çalmak.notes: Honking a car horn; simple everyday verb.

to sting / stab — sokmak.notes: Used for insects, needles, sharp objects.

to be silent — susmak.exde: Er schweigt, obwohl er etwas weiß.
to be silent — susmak.exen: He stays silent even though he knows something.

to spoil / go bad — bozmak / çürümek.notes: Used for food going bad or ruining something. Ist verdorben = bozuldu.

to flip / turn over — çevirmek.exde: Bitte wenden Sie das Fleisch in der Pfanne.
to flip / turn over — çevirmek.exen: Please turn the meat in the pan.
to flip / turn over — çevirmek.notes: Physical turning; not used for vehicles (that is umdrehen or wenden (Auto) regionally).

to advertise — reklam yapmak.exde: Die Firma wirbt für ihr Produkt.

to stumble — tökezlemek.notes: Losing balance because of an obstacle.

to roll — yuvarlanmak.exde: Der Ball rollt den Hügel hinunter.
to roll — yuvarlanmak.exen: The ball rolls down the hill.

to pour — dökmek.exen: She pours water into the glass.

to overdraft / put on top — aşmak / üzer.notes: Inseparable = finance; separable = pull clothing over.

to hire / turn on — işe almak.exde: Die Firma stellt neue Mitarbeiter an.
to hire / turn on — işe almak.notes: Also “to turn on a device” (Heizung anstellen).

to forecast — öngörmek.notes: Very similar to vorhersagen; often interchangeable.

to operate (surgically) — ameliyat etmek.exde: Der Arzt operiert den Patienten morgen früh.
to operate (surgically) — ameliyat etmek.exen: The doctor operates on the patient tomorrow morning.
to operate (surgically) — ameliyat etmek.notes: Used for medical/surgical procedures; often with jdn operieren.

to keep free — boş bırakmak / ayırmak.exde: Kannst du mir den Platz freihalten?
to keep free — boş bırakmak / ayırmak.exen: Can you keep the seat free for me?
to keep free — boş bırakmak / ayırmak.notes: Often means reserving or keeping something unoccupied.

to brush — fırçalamak.exde: Sie bürstet dem Hund das Fell.
to brush — fırçalamak.notes: Used for brushing hair, fur, clothes, surfaces.

to cheer — sevinçle bağırmak.exde: Die Fans jubeln, als das Team ein Tor schießt.
to cheer — sevinçle bağırmak.exen: The fans cheer when the team scores a goal.
to cheer — sevinçle bağırmak.notes: Loud, happy cheering; often in sports or celebrations.

to growl / grumble — hırlamak / homurdan.exde: Der Hund knurrt, weil er Angst hat.
to growl / grumble — hırlamak / homurdan.exen: The dog growls because it is afraid.
to growl / grumble — hırlamak / homurdan.notes: Also used figuratively: Der Magen knurrt(stomach growls).

to treat / handle — tedavi etmek / davra.exde: Der Arzt behandelt seinen Patienten sehr sorgfältig.
to treat / handle — tedavi etmek / davra.exen: The doctor treats his patient very carefully.
to treat / handle — tedavi etmek / davra.notes: Used for medical treatment or handling a topic/person.

to stand out / be noticeable — dikkat çe.exde: Der Fehler fällt mir sofort auf.
to stand out / be noticeable — dikkat çe.exen: The mistake stands out to me immediately.
to stand out / be noticeable — dikkat çe.notes: Something becomes noticeable to someone (Dativ person). Dikkatimi cekti, hep soyle yapiyorsun, su bu dikkatimi cekti vs. Kalibi turkcedeki. Merken fark ettim, auffallen dikkatimi cekti. Mir ist aufgefallen, dass….

to yell / roar — bağırmak.exde: Er brüllt, weil er wütend ist.
to yell / roar — bağırmak.exen: He yells because he is angry.

to load — yüklemek.exde: Wir beladen den Wagen mit Koffern.
to load — yüklemek.exen: We load the car with suitcases.

to insulate / muffle — yalıtmak.exde: Sie dämmen das Haus für den Winter.
to insulate / muffle — yalıtmak.exen: They insulate the house for the winter.

to blink — göz kırpmak.exde: Er blinzelt, weil die Sonne so hell ist.
to blink — göz kırpmak.exen: He blinks because the sun is bright.

to take a deep breath — derin nefes alma.exde: Nach dem Lauf musste sie erst einmal durchatmen.
to take a deep breath — derin nefes alma.exen: After the run she had to take a deep breath.
to take a deep breath — derin nefes alma.notes: Breathing deeply to calm down or rest.

to stretch — esnetmek.exde: Er dehnt seine Muskeln vor dem Training.
to stretch — esnetmek.exen: He stretches his muscles before training.

to inhale — nefes almak.exde: Atme tief ein, bevor du sprichst.

to wrap — sarmak.notes:
Einwickeln means wrapping by fully covering something with a material (paper, foil, cloth) through a wrapping motion. Einpacken can also mean “to wrap,” but its focus is preparing an item for transport/storage, often by putting it into a container, bag, box — and sometimes wrapping as part of that process. Packen is the broadest: simply “to pack” (suitcase, items), without implying wrapping or covering.
Einwickeln is the one used when the main action is the wrapping itself, especially for gifts or food.

to guess correctly — doğru tahmin etmek.notes: “Guess correctly” (not random guessing). Means to guess or figure something out correctly, often by intuition. Stronger than raten, which is only “to guess/attempt.” Erraten focuses on the successful result, not the guessing process.

to tie up / captivate — bağlamak / büyül.exen: The police tie up the suspect.

to flicker — titremek / yanıp sönmek.exen: The candle flickers in the wind.

to whisper — fısıldamak.exde: Sie flüstern, damit niemand sie hört.
to whisper — fısıldamak.exen: They whisper so no one hears them.

to feed — beslemek.exen: She feeds the cat every morning.

to yawn — esnemek.exde: Er gähnt, weil er müde ist.

to hammer — çekiçlemek.exde: Sie hämmert einen Nagel in die Wand.
to hammer — çekiçlemek.exen: She hammers a nail into the wall.

to nibble — kemirmek.exde: Die Maus knabbert an dem Käse.
to nibble — kemirmek.exen: The mouse nibbles on the cheese.
to nibble — kemirmek.notes: Small bites; also figurative for snacks.

to smear / grease — sürmek / yağlamak.exen: He spreads butter on the bread.

to snort — homurdanmak / burnunu çekmek.notes: Also used jokingly for angry humans.

to manage — yönetmek.exde: Sie verwaltet das Geld der Firma.
to manage — yönetmek.notes: Administrative control over finances or systems. Means to administer or manage resources such as money, property, data, accounts, or systems. Focuses on ongoing administrative control, record-keeping, regulation, and maintenance. Different from managen (general management, coordinating tasks or projects), leiten (leading a team, department, or organization), führen (guiding or directing people), and bewältigen (managing/overcoming a difficult situation or workload). Verwalten is about administrative oversight, not leadership or problem-solving.

to come out — dışarı çıkmak.exde: Sie kommt aus dem Zimmer raus, um frische Luft zu holen.
to come out — dışarı çıkmak.exen: She comes out of the room to get some fresh air.
to come out — dışarı çıkmak.notes: Spoken form of herauskommen; neutral everyday use.

to come in — içeri gelmek.exde: Komm bitte rein, die Tür ist offen.
to come in — içeri gelmek.exen: Please come in, the door is open.

to go in — içeri gitmek.exde: Wir gehen rein, weil es draußen kalt ist.
to go in — içeri gitmek.exen: We go inside because it’s cold outside.

to come over — buraya gelmek.exen: Can you come over for a moment?

to go over — karşı tarafa gitmek.exde: Ich gehe rüber, um ihm zu helfen.
to go over — karşı tarafa gitmek.exen: I go over to help him.
to go over — karşı tarafa gitmek.notes: Moving to the other side or another place.

to come down — aşağı gelmek.exde: Komm bitte runter, das Essen ist fertig!
to come down — aşağı gelmek.exen: Come down, the food is ready!

to go up — yukarı çıkmak [hochgehen].exde: Er geht hoch in sein Zimmer.

to come up — yukarı gelmek [raufkommen].exen: Can you come upstairs for a moment?

to come up — yukarı gelmek [hochkommen].exde: Sie kommt hoch, um uns zu begrüßen.
to come up — yukarı gelmek [hochkommen].exen: She comes up to greet us.

to bring down — aşağı indirmek.exde: Holst du bitte die Kiste runter?
to bring down — aşağı indirmek.exen: Can you bring the box down?

to bring in — içeri almak.exde: Er holt die Pflanzen rein, weil es friert.
to bring in — içeri almak.exen: He brings the plants inside because it’s freezing.

to take out — dışarı çıkarmak [rausholen.exde: Ich hole das Fleisch aus dem Kühlschrank raus.
to take out — dışarı çıkarmak [rausholen.exen: I take out the meat from the fridge.
to take out — dışarı çıkarmak [rausholen.notes: Remove something from inside. rausholen: take something out FROM somewhere (retrieval). Kitabi cantadan cikarmak, aus der tasche rausholen, kitabi cikarip ben kullancam mesela. Rausbringen ise kitabi disariya, evin disina vs goturmek gibi, cop icin, kutular icin vs kullanilabilir

to take out — dışarı çıkarmak [rausbring.exde: Kannst du bitte den Müll rausbringen?
to take out — dışarı çıkarmak [rausbring.exen: Can you take out the trash?
to take out — dışarı çıkarmak [rausbring.notes: Very common expression. movement carrying the item out, often to finish a task (trash, recycling, items to another area). to bring something outside (to a different location outside the room/house).

to bring up — yukarı çıkarmak.exen: Can you bring the box up?

to grant — birine bir şey vermek.exde: Die Firma gewährt ihm einen Bonus, weil er das Projekt früher als geplant abgeschlossen hat.
to grant — birine bir şey vermek.exen: The company grants him a bonus because he finished the project earlier than expected.
to grant — birine bir şey vermek.notes: Used when officially giving rights, money, privileges.

to deepen / to immerse — derinleştirmek.de: etw. vertiefen / sich vertiefen in + A
to deepen / to immerse — derinleştirmek.exde: Sie vertieft ihre Kenntnisse in Physik, damit sie die Prüfung ohne Probleme bestehen kann.
to deepen / to immerse — derinleştirmek.exen: She deepens her knowledge of physics so that she can pass the exam easily.

to go out — dışarı çıkmak [rausgehen].exde: Er geht kurz raus, um zu telefonieren.
to go out — dışarı çıkmak [rausgehen].exen: He goes outfor a moment to make a call.
to go out — dışarı çıkmak [rausgehen].notes: Leaving an indoor space; spoken form of hinaus/herausgehen.

to go out — dışarı çıkmak [ausgehen].exde: Wir gehen heute Abend aus, obwohl wir morgen früh aufstehen müssen.
to go out — dışarı çıkmak [ausgehen].exen: We’re going out tonight, although we have to get up early tomorrow.

to protest — protesto etmek.exde: Die Studenten protestieren gegen die neuen Gebühren, die nächste Woche eingeführt werden sollen.
to protest — protesto etmek.exen: The students protest against the new fees that are supposed to be introduced next week.

to confuse — karıştırmak.exde: Ich habe ihn mit seinem Bruder verwechselt, weil sie sich fast identisch kleiden.
to confuse — karıştırmak.exen: I confused him with his brother because they dress almost identically.

to collide — çarpışmak.exde: Das Auto ist mit einem Lieferwagen zusammengestoßen, als der Fahrer abgelenkt war.
to collide — çarpışmak.exen: The car collided with a delivery van when the driver was distracted.

to announce in writing — duyurmak.exde: Die Universität hat mehrere Stipendien ausgeschrieben, diesich an internationale Studierende richten.
to announce in writing — duyurmak.exen: The university has announced several scholarships that target international students.
to announce in writing — duyurmak.notes: Means to publicly announce or advertise something in writing, typically positions, scholarships, grants, or tenders, inviting applications. Formal, institutional use. Also means “to write out fully” in other contexts.

to reshape — yeniden biçimlendirmek.exde: Die Lehrerin formt den Satz um, damit die Schüler ihn besser verstehen können.
to reshape — yeniden biçimlendirmek.exen: The teacher rephrases the sentence so that the students can understand it better.

to install — monte etmek.exde: Der Techniker baut die neue Heizung ein, nachdem er das alte System entfernt hat.
to install — monte etmek.exen: The technician installs the new heater after removing the old system.

to fill out — doldurmak.exde: Bitte füllen Sie das Formular aus, bevor Sie zum Schalter gehen.
to fill out — doldurmak.exen: Please fill out the form before you go to the counter.

to fill — doldurmak.exde: Sie füllt die Flasche mit Wasser, während das Kind neben ihr wartet.
to fill — doldurmak.exen: She fills the bottle with water while the child waits beside her.

to cross out / paint / spread — üstünü ç.exde: Sie streicht Butter auf das Brot.
to cross out / paint / spread — üstünü ç.exen: She spreads butter on the bread.
to cross out / paint / spread — üstünü ç.notes: Üç temel anlamı vardır: (1) üstünü çizmek(bir kelimeyi, satırı iptal etmek), (2) bir yüzeyi boyamak (duvar, çit vb.), (3) bir şeyi yüzeye sürmek/yaymak (tereyağı, krem, macun). Durchstreichen özellikle “tamamen üstünü çizmek” anlamında daha güçlüdür; anstreichen ise yüzeyi boyamak için özel olarak kullanılır.

to struggle — boğuşmak.exde: Er ringt mit einer schweren Entscheidung, obwohl er alle Informationen hat.
to struggle — boğuşmak.exen: He struggles with a difficult decision, although he has all the information.

to cheat — aldatmak.exde: Er hat seine Partnerin betrogen, nachdem sie jahrelang zusammen waren.
to cheat — aldatmak.exen: He cheated on his partner after they had been together for years.
to cheat — aldatmak.notes: Includes cheating in relationships or money.

to bend — bükmek.exde: Er biegt den Draht, damit er in die Öffnung passt.
to bend — bükmek.exen: He bends the wire so that it fits into the opening.
to bend — bükmek.notes: Also for directions (“Er biegt links ab”).

to flow — akmak.exde: Das Wasser fließt, weil das Ventil defekt ist.
to flow — akmak.exen: The water flows because the valve is broken.

to stick / put — sokmak.exde: Sie steckt den Schlüssel ins Schloss, bevor sie das Licht einschaltet.
to stick / put — sokmak.exen: She puts the key into the lock before turning on the light.
to stick / put — sokmak.notes: Also “be stuck” (intr.)., etwas in etwas stecken:put sth in sth, mesela camasiri makineye koymak gibi.

to be attached — sabitlenmiş olmak.exde: Das Schild ist fest an der Wand befestigt, damit es nicht herunterfällt.
to be attached — sabitlenmiş olmak.exen: The sign is attached firmly to the wall so that it doesn’t fall down.

to reach — ulaşmak.exde: Sie gelangt zu einer neuen Erkenntnis, nachdem sie lange darüber nachgedacht hat.
to reach — ulaşmak.exen: She arrives at a new insight after thinking about it for a long time.

to be difficult for someone — birine zor.exde: Es fällt mir schwer, mich zu konzentrieren, wenn es laut ist.
to be difficult for someone — birine zor.exen: It's hard for me to concentrate when it’s loud.

to harm — zarar vermek.exde: Zu viel Zucker schadet der Gesundheit, obwohl viele das ignorieren.
to harm — zarar vermek.exen: Too much sugar harms your health, although many ignore that.
to harm — zarar vermek.notes: No Akkusativ object allowed. Intransitive; means that something is harmful or has a damaging effect. Focus on the impact, not an active action. Anrichten is something harming, not harmful by itself, active harming.

to approach — yaklaşmak.exde: Das Schiff nähert sich der Küste, während die Passagiere an Deck warten.
to approach — yaklaşmak.exen: The ship approaches the coast while the passengers wait on deck.

to feel sorry — acımak.exde: Es tut mir leid, dass ich gestern nicht kommen konnte.
to feel sorry — acımak.exen: I’m sorry that I couldn’t come yesterday.

to cause (damage) — zarar vermek.exde: Der Sturm richtete große Schäden an, obwohl er nur wenige Minuten dauerte.
to cause (damage) — zarar vermek.exen: The storm caused major damage although it lasted only a few minutes.
to cause (damage) — zarar vermek.notes: Used mainly for negative effects or damage. Schaden is Intransitive; means that something is harmful or has a damaging effect. Focus on the impact, not an active action. Anrichten is something harming, not harmful by itself, active harming.

to get along / manage — geçinmek.exde: Er kommt mit seinen Kollegen gut aus, weil sie ähnliche Interessen haben.
to get along / manage — geçinmek.exen: He gets along with his coworkers because they share similar interests.
to get along / manage — geçinmek.notes: Also: manage with little money. Means getting along in a practical, conflict-free way, without implying closeness. More neutral than sich verstehen (mit), which expresses harmony or good personal relation. Also used for “managing with little” (mit wenig Geld auskommen).

to resign / step back — istifa etmek.exde: Der Minister tritt zurück, nachdem neue Vorwürfe bekannt wurden.
to resign / step back — istifa etmek.exen: The minister resigns after new accusations became public.

to sketch — taslak çizmek.exde: Sie skizziert den Plan, damit alle ihn besser verstehen.
to sketch — taslak çizmek.exen: She sketches the plan so that everyone can understand it better.

to inject / spray — enjekte etmek.exde: Der Arzt spritzt dem Patienten ein Medikament, weil er starke Schmerzen hat.
to inject / spray — enjekte etmek.exen: The doctor injects the patient with medicine because he is in pain.

to work out — yolunda gitmek.exde: Der Plan klappt, obwohl wir wenig Zeit hatten.
to work out — yolunda gitmek.exen: The plan works out although we had little time.

to double — ikiye katlamak.exde: Die Firma verdoppelt das Budget, damit das Projekt schneller fertig wird.
to double — ikiye katlamak.exen: The company doubles the budget so that the project finishes sooner.

to interpret — yorumlamak.exde: Die Schüler interpretieren den Text, den sie gestern gelesen haben.
to interpret — yorumlamak.exen: The students interpret the text that they read yesterday.
to interpret — yorumlamak.notes: Often used for texts, art, data.

to stop — durdurmak.exde: Die Polizei stoppt das Auto, weil es zu schnell fährt.
to stop — durdurmak.exen: The police stop the car because it is speeding.

to invest — yatırım yapmak.exde: Die Firma investiert in neue Technologien, um wettbewerbsfähig zu bleiben.
to invest — yatırım yapmak.exen: The company invests in new technologies in order to stay competitive.
to invest — yatırım yapmak.notes: Can refer to money, time, resources.

to include / comprise — kapsamak.exde: Das Projekt umfasst mehrere Schritte, die sorgfältig geplant werden müssen.
to include / comprise — kapsamak.exen: The project includes several steps that must be planned carefully.

to investigate / determine — soruşturmak.exde: Die Polizei ermittelt, weil ein Verdacht besteht.
to investigate / determine — soruşturmak.exen: The police investigate because there is a suspicion.

to have at one’s disposal — sahip olmak.exde: Das Hotel verfügt über einen großen Pool, der neu renoviert wurde.
to have at one’s disposal — sahip olmak.exen: The hotel has a large pool that was recently renovated.

to limit — sınırlamak.exde: Wir begrenzen die Teilnehmerzahl, damit es nicht zu voll wird.
to limit — sınırlamak.exen: We limit the number of participants so that it doesn’t get too crowded.
to limit — sınırlamak.notes: Often used for quotas or restrictions. Set a maximum, kisi, butce, alan.. Beschränken: kurallar ve sartlarla kisitlamak. Einschränken, özgürlügü ve secenekleri kisitlamak. Bu cumlede kisi sayisi numara olarak soylenmese de imply ediliyor, belli bi sayiya limitlendi anlamina geliyor. tr anlami da iyi anlatiyor, bu sinirlamak, bir sinir var. einschränken kisitlamak.

to name / label — adlandırmak.exde: Der Lehrer benennt die Fehler, damit die Schüler daraus lernen.
to name / label — adlandırmak.exen: The teacher names the mistakes so that the students learn from them.

to accuse / reproach — suçlamak.exde: Er wirft ihr vor, dass sie gelogen hat.
to accuse / reproach — suçlamak.exen: He accuses her of having lied.

to finance — finanse etmek.exde: Die Bank finanziert das Projekt, obwohl es riskant ist.
to finance — finanse etmek.exen: The bank finances the project although it is risky.

to pretend / claim — numara yapmak.exde: Er gibt vor, krank zu sein, damit er nicht arbeiten muss.
to pretend / claim — numara yapmak.exen: He pretends to be sick so that he doesn’t have to work.

to assign / match — ilişkilendirmek.exde: Die Schüler ordnen die Wörter den Bildern zu, nachdem sie den Text gelesen haben.
to assign / match — ilişkilendirmek.exen: The students assign the words to the pictures after reading the text.

to suspect — sezmek.exde: Ich ahnte, dass etwas nicht stimmt.
to suspect — sezmek.exen: I suspected that something was wrong.

to restrict — kısıtlamak.exde: Wir schränken den Verbrauch ein, damit wir Energie sparen.
to restrict — kısıtlamak.exen: We restrict consumption so that we save energy.
to restrict — kısıtlamak.notes: Reducing quantity or freedom. Bu cumlede kullanimi azaltiyoruz anlami var, begrenzen kullanilsaydi tam bi limit bicilmis ve o tam limit imply ediliyor olurdu, burada sadece genel azaltmak/limitlemekten bahsediliyor.

to master — hakim olmak.exde: Sie beherrscht drei Sprachen, die sie im Ausland gelernt hat.
to master — hakim olmak.exen: She masters three languages that she learned abroad.

to trust — güvenmek.exde: Ich traue ihm nicht, weil er oft gelogen hat.
to trust — güvenmek.exen: I don’t trust him because he has lied many times.
to trust — güvenmek.notes: Dative object required. Means trusting a person’s behavior or intentions; more instinctive and often used when expressing doubt. Dative only. Weaker and more personal than vertrauen, which expresses deeper or broader trust (also in things or systems).

to grin — sırıtmak.exde: Er grinst, als er hört, dass er gewonnen hat.
to grin — sırıtmak.exen: He grins when he hears that he has won.

to expand — genişletmek.exde: Die Firma baut ihre Produktion aus, um mehr Kunden zu erreichen.
to expand — genişletmek.exen: The company expands its production to reach more customers.

to identify — tanımlamak.exde: Die Polizei identifiziert den Täter, nachdem neue Beweise auftauchten.
to identify — tanımlamak.exen: The police identify the suspect after new evidence appeared.
to identify — tanımlamak.notes: Used in technical or legal contexts.

to endanger — tehlikeye atmak.exde: Er gefährdet seine Gesundheit, weil er zu viel arbeitet.
to endanger — tehlikeye atmak.exen: He endangers his health because he works too much.

to overcome — üstesinden gelmek.exde: Sie überwindet ihre Angst, indem sie jeden Tag übt.
to overcome — üstesinden gelmek.exen: She overcomes her fear by practicing every day.

to shine / beam — parlamak.exde: Sie strahlt, weil sie gute Nachrichten bekommen hat.
to shine / beam — parlamak.exen: She radiates happiness because she got good news.
to shine / beam — parlamak.notes: Also used for light. Means shining or radiating intensely, literally or emotionally. Stronger and brighter than leuchten (neutral glowing). Unlike scheinen, which also means “to seem,” strahlen emphasizes brightness and positive energy—often used for people “beaming” with joy.

to spread — yayılmak.exde: Das Feuer breitet sich aus, während der Wind stärker wird.
to spread — yayılmak.exen: The fire spreads as the wind grows stronger.

to spread out / unfold — yaymak / sermek.exde: Sie breitet die Decke auf dem Boden aus.
to spread out / unfold — yaymak / sermek.exen: She spreads the blanket out on the floor.
to spread out / unfold — yaymak / sermek.notes: Used for physically spreading or unfolding something so it lies flat (blanket, map, cloth). Much more common than breiten, which is rarely used on its own.

to defend oneself — karşı koymak.exde: Er wehrt sich gegen die Vorwürfe, obwohl sie glaubwürdig wirken.
to defend oneself — karşı koymak.exen: He defends himself against the accusations although they seem convincing.

to assure — temin etmek.exde: Sie versichert ihm, dass alles gut wird.
to assure — temin etmek.exen: She assures him that everything will be fine.

to twitch — seğirmek.exde: Sein Auge zuckt, wenn er gestresst ist.
to twitch — seğirmek.exen: His eye twitches when he is stressed.

to exchange ideas — fikir alışverişi yap.exde: Sie tauschen sich über ihre Erfahrungen aus, nachdem sie das Seminar beendet haben.
to exchange ideas — fikir alışverişi yap.exen: They exchange their experiences after finishing the seminar.

to seize — yakalamak.exde: Die Polizei ergriff die Chance, als der Täter unaufmerksam war.
to seize — yakalamak.exen: The police seized the opportunity when the suspect was distracted.

to equip / provide — donatmak.exde: Die Geräte sind mit moderner Technik versehen, damit sie sicherer sind.
to equip / provide — donatmak.exen: The devices are equipped with modern technology so that they are safer.

to cope with — üstesinden gelmek.exde: Sie bewältigt die Aufgabe, obwohl sie sehr komplex ist.
to cope with — üstesinden gelmek.exen: She handles the task although it is very complex.

to complain — şikayet etmek [sich beklag.exde: Er beklagt sich über die laute Musik, bei seinem Nachbarn.
to complain — şikayet etmek [sich beklag.exen: He complains about the loud music to his neighbor.
to complain — şikayet etmek [sich beklag.notes: More formal than sich beschweren; often used in official contexts.

to complain — şikayet etmek [klagen (übe.exde: Er klagt über Kopfschmerzen, seitdem er schlecht geschlafen hat.
to complain — şikayet etmek [klagen (übe.exen: He complains about headaches since he slept badly.

to stand there — öylece durmak.exde: Er steht da, als ob er nicht wüsste, was passiert ist.
to stand there — öylece durmak.exen: He stands there as if he didn’t know what happened.

to fire / release — işten çıkarmak.exde: Die Firma entlässt mehrere Mitarbeiter, weil sie sparen muss.
to fire / release — işten çıkarmak.exen: The company fires several employees because it has to save money.

to mumble — mırıldanmak.exde: Er murmelt etwas, das niemand versteht.
to mumble — mırıldanmak.exen: He mumbles something that no one understands.

to unite — birleştirmek.exde: Das Projekt vereint Menschen, die ähnliche Ideen haben.
to unite — birleştirmek.exen: The project unites people who have similar ideas.

to announce — duyurmak.exde: Die Regierung verkündet, dass neue Maßnahmen kommen.
to announce — duyurmak.exen: The government announces that new measures are coming.

to exceed — aşmak.exde: Die Kosten überschreiten das Budget, was ein Problem darstellt.
to exceed — aşmak.exen: The costs exceed the budget, which presents a problem.

to be based on — dayanmak [beruhen (auf.exde: Die Theorie beruht auf Daten, die jahrelang gesammelt wurden.
to be based on — dayanmak [beruhen (auf.exen: The theory is based on data that was collected over years.

to be based on — dayanmak [basieren (auf.exde: Die Studie basiert auf Daten, die kürzlich überprüft wurden.
to be based on — dayanmak [basieren (auf.exen: The study is based on data that was recently verified.

to reduce — azaltmak.exde: Wir verringern den Stromverbrauch, damit wir Geld sparen.
to reduce — azaltmak.exen: We reduce electricity use so that we save money.

to run/operate (transport); to socialize.exde: Die Züge verkehren heute nur eingeschränkt, weil auf der Strecke gebaut wird.
to run/operate (transport); to socialize.exen: The trains operate only with limitations today because construction is being done on the line.
to run/operate (transport); to socialize.notes: Often used for public transport meaning “run”; also means “socialize.”

to slam; (business) to strike — çarpmak;.exde: Er schlägt die Tür zu, obwohl wir ihm gesagt haben, leise zu sein.
to slam; (business) to strike — çarpmak;.exen: He slams the door even though we told him to be quiet.
to slam; (business) to strike — çarpmak;.notes: Also used for deals (“to snap up an offer”).

to participate/play along — eşlik etmek.exde: Sie spielt mit, obwohl sie das Spiel nicht gut kennt.
to participate/play along — eşlik etmek.exen: She plays along even though she doesn’t know the game well.

to convert (units or currency) — dönüştü.exde: Er rechnet den Betrag in Euro um, nachdem er die aktuellen Kurse überprüft hat.
to convert (units or currency) — dönüştü.exen: He converts the amount into euros after checking the current rates.

to cover (physically); to cover costs —.exde: Die Plane deckt das Dach ab, damit es nicht nass wird.
to cover (physically); to cover costs —.exen: The tarp covers the roof so that it doesn’t get wet.

to include/integrate — dahil etmek.exde: Die Firma bindet neue Mitarbeiter in wichtige Entscheidungen ein, damit sie sich wertgeschätzt fühlen.
to include/integrate — dahil etmek.exen: The company includes new employees in important decisions so they feel valued.
to include/integrate — dahil etmek.notes: Often used for integration into processes.

to exploit — sömürmek / kullanmak.exde: Er nutzt ihre Gutmütigkeit aus, obwohl sie ihm vertraut.
to exploit — sömürmek / kullanmak.exen: He exploits her kindness even though she trusts him.
to exploit — sömürmek / kullanmak.notes: Can be negative or neutral depending on context.

to expand — genişlemek.exde: Das Gas dehnt sich aus, wenn die Temperatur steigt.
to expand — genişlemek.exen: The gas expands when the temperature rises.

to reflect — yansıtmak.exde: Der Bericht spiegelt wider, wie ernst die Lage wirklich ist.
to reflect — yansıtmak.exen: The report reflects how serious the situation really is.

to step out; to resign from — ayrılmak /.exde: Er tritt aus der Partei aus, nachdem ein Skandal bekannt wurde.
to step out; to resign from — ayrılmak /.exen: He resigns from the party after a scandal became public.

to tolerate — tahammül etmek.exde: Der Lehrer duldet kein schlechtes Verhalten, obwohl die Klasse groß ist.
to tolerate — tahammül etmek.exen: The teacher tolerates no bad behavior although the class is large.

to insult — hakaret etmek.exde: Sie beleidigt ihn, indem sie seine Arbeit herabsetzt.
to insult — hakaret etmek.exen: She insults him by belittling his work.

to get rid of — kurtulmak.exde: Er wird die alten Möbel los, nachdem er endlich einen Käufer gefunden hat.
to get rid of — kurtulmak.exen: He gets rid of the old furniture after he finally found a buyer.

to represent — temsil etmek.exde: Sie repräsentiert das Unternehmen auf der Konferenz, obwohl sie erst seit kurzem dort arbeitet.
to represent — temsil etmek.exen: She represents the company at the conference although she has only worked there briefly.

to remove/eliminate — ortadan kaldırmak.exde: Die Stadt beseitigt den Müll, der sich über das Wochenende angesammelt hat.
to remove/eliminate — ortadan kaldırmak.exen: The city removes the trash that accumulated over the weekend.

to delay — geciktirmek.exde: Die Bauarbeiten verzögern das Projekt, obwohl die Firma zusätzliche Arbeiter eingestellt hat.
to delay — geciktirmek.exen: The construction work delays the project, although the company hired additional workers.
to delay — geciktirmek.notes: Used for delays in schedules, processes, reactions; similar to verschieben but not about rescheduling, rather about slowing down.

to overwhelm — ezmek / etkisi altına alm.exde: Die Menge überwältigt den Sänger, als er die Bühne betritt.
to overwhelm — ezmek / etkisi altına alm.exen: The crowd overwhelms the singer as he steps onto the stage.
to overwhelm — ezmek / etkisi altına alm.notes: Used emotionally or physically; can describe strong impressions or overpowering force.

to add (mathematically) — toplamak.exde: Wir addieren die Zahlen, nachdem wir alle Werte überprüft haben.
to add (mathematically) — toplamak.exen: We add the numbers after checking all values.
to add (mathematically) — toplamak.notes: Strictly mathematical; not used for “adding things to life” (that’s hinzufügen).

to go ahead / progress — ilerlemek.exde: Die Arbeiten gehen schneller voran, seitdem wir neue Maschinen haben.
to go ahead / progress — ilerlemek.exen: The work progresses faster since we have new machines.
to go ahead / progress — ilerlemek.notes: Means “progress,” often used in technical or formal contexts.

to stand out — öne çıkmak.exde: Das Gebäude ragt aus der Skyline heraus, weil es deutlich höher ist.
to stand out — öne çıkmak.exen: The building stands out from the skyline because it is much taller.
to stand out — öne çıkmak.notes: Used visually or metaphorically; something noticeably distinct.

to crumble / disintegrate — dağılmak.exde: Das alte Haus zerfällt langsam, während es jahrelang leer steht.
to crumble / disintegrate — dağılmak.exen: The old house slowly crumbles as it has been empty for years.
to crumble / disintegrate — dağılmak.notes: Physical decay or figurative disintegration (systems, structures).

to emphasize — vurgulamak.exde: Der Lehrer hebt die wichtigsten Punkte hervor, damit alle sie verstehen.
to emphasize — vurgulamak.exen: The teacher emphasizes the most important points so everyone understands them.
to emphasize — vurgulamak.notes: Highlighting key elements; similar to betonen but stronger.

to stretch — uzatmak.exde: Er streckt die Arme, nachdem er lange gearbeitet hat.
to stretch — uzatmak.exen: He stretches his arms after working for a long time.

to stretch out — uzanmak / gerinmek.exde: Er streckt sich auf dem Sofa aus, weil er sehr müde ist.
to stretch out — uzanmak / gerinmek.exen: He stretches out on the sofa because he is very tired.

to combine — birleştirmek.exde: Sie kombiniert verschiedene Methoden, um bessere Ergebnisse zu erzielen.
to combine — birleştirmek.exen: She combines different methods to achieve better results.
to combine — birleştirmek.notes: Joining elements to form something new; common in science and design.

to hug — sarılmak.exde: Sie umarmt ihn, nachdem er die guten Nachrichten erzählt hat.
to hug — sarılmak.exen: She hugs him after he shared the good news.

to prescribe / dictate — zorunlu kılmak.exde: Die Schule schreibt den Schülern vor, dass sie pünktlich erscheinen müssen.
to prescribe / dictate — zorunlu kılmak.exen: The school dictates to the students that they must arrive on time.
to prescribe / dictate — zorunlu kılmak.notes: Imposes rules; formal; stronger than empfehlen.

to aim at — hedef almak.exde: Er zielt auf das Ziel, während er tief einatmet.
to aim at — hedef almak.exen: He aims at the target while taking a deep breath.

to transform / change — dönüştürmek.exde: Die Erfahrung wandelt ihn, obwohl er es erst später erkennt.
to transform / change — dönüştürmek.exen: The experience changes him, although he only realizes it later.
to transform / change — dönüştürmek.notes: Formal; also in compounds like umwandeln.

to avert — bertaraf etmek.exde: Sie wendet die Gefahr ab, indem sie schnell reagiert.
to avert — bertaraf etmek.exen: She averts the danger by reacting quickly.

to separate / divorce — ayırmak / boşanm.exde: Das Paar scheidet, nachdem jahrelange Probleme nicht gelöst wurden.
to separate / divorce — ayırmak / boşanm.exen: The couple divorces after years of unresolved problems.
to separate / divorce — ayırmak / boşanm.notes: Intr = to divorce; tr = to separate things.

to act — hareket etmek.exde: Die Firma agiert vorsichtig, weil der Markt unsicher ist.
to act — hareket etmek.exen: The company acts cautiously because the market is uncertain.
to act — hareket etmek.notes: Often formal; similar to handeln but more strategic.

to overlook — gözden kaçırmak.exde: Er übersieht einen wichtigen Fehler, obwohl er den Text mehrmals liest.
to overlook — gözden kaçırmak.exen: He overlooks an important mistake although he reads the text several times.
to overlook — gözden kaçırmak.notes: Not seeing something; also can mean ignoring intentionally.

to clarify — açıklığa kavuşturmak.exde: Das Beispiel verdeutlicht, wie die Regel funktioniert.
to clarify — açıklığa kavuşturmak.exen: The example clarifies how the rule works.
to clarify — açıklığa kavuşturmak.notes: Stronger than erklären; makes clearer, highlights.

to split — bölmek.exde: Die Diskussion spaltet die Gruppe, weil die Meinungen sehr unterschiedlich sind.
to split — bölmek.exen: The discussion splits the group because opinions differ greatly.

to sweep — süpürmek.exde: Er kehrt den Hof, nachdem der Sturm viele Blätter heruntergeweht hat.
to sweep — süpürmek.exen: He sweeps the yard after the storm blew down many leaves.

to return — geri dönmek.exde: Sie kehrt nach Hause zurück, nachdem sie ein Jahr im Ausland studiert hat.
to return — geri dönmek.exen: She returns home after studying abroad for a year.
to return — geri dönmek.notes: Used for returning to a place; formal, often written.

to isolate — izole etmek.exde: Das Labor isoliert den Stoff, damit er genauer untersucht werden kann.
to isolate — izole etmek.exen: The lab isolates the substance so it can be examined more precisely.

to commit (crime/error) — işlemek.exde: Er begeht einen schweren Fehler, weil er die Warnungen ignoriert.
to commit (crime/error) — işlemek.exen: He commits a serious mistake because he ignored the warnings.
to commit (crime/error) — işlemek.notes: Very specific: crimes (Verbrechen begehen), suicide (Selbstmord begehen), errors.

to hunt / chase — avlamak / kovalamak.exde: Der Polizist jagt den Verdächtigen, nachdem dieser geflohen ist.
to hunt / chase — avlamak / kovalamak.exen: The police officer chases the suspect after he fled.

to pass away — vefat etmek.exde: Sein Großvater verstirbt, nachdem er lange krank war.
to pass away — vefat etmek.exen: His grandfather passes away after being ill for a long time.
to pass away — vefat etmek.notes: More formal and respectful than sterben.

to link — bağlamak.exde: Der Artikel verknüpft historische Fakten mit aktuellen Ereignissen.
to link — bağlamak.exen: The article links historical facts with current events.
to link — bağlamak.notes: Used for abstract connections; computing, thinking.

to edit / work on — işlemek / düzenlemek.exde: Sie bearbeitet die Fotos, damit sie professioneller aussehen.
to edit / work on — işlemek / düzenlemek.exen: She edits the photos so they look more professional.

to sign up / register — kaydolmak.exde: Sie trägt sich in die Liste ein, nachdem der Lehrer sie darauf hingewiesen hat.
to sign up / register — kaydolmak.exen: She signs herself into the list after the teacher pointed it out.

to dominate — hakim olmak.exde: Eine große Firma dominiert den Markt, obwohl neue Konkurrenten auftauchen.
to dominate — hakim olmak.exen: A large company dominates the market although new competitors appear.

to vote — oylamak.exde: Die Mitglieder stimmen über den Vorschlag ab, nachdem er diskutiert wurde.
to vote — oylamak.exen: The members vote on the proposal after it was discussed.

to testify — ifade vermek.exde: Der Zeuge sagt aus, dass er den Vorfall deutlich gesehen hat.
to testify — ifade vermek.exen: The witness testifies that he clearly saw the incident.

to establish — kurmak.exde: Die Firma etabliert ein neues System, das effizienter arbeiten soll.
to establish — kurmak.exen: The company establishes a new system that is supposed to work more efficiently.

to burn — yakmak / birseyin yanarak kul.exde: Er verbrennt alte Dokumente, damit niemand sie lesen kann.
to burn — yakmak / birseyin yanarak kul.exen: He burns old documents so nobody can read them.
to burn — yakmak / birseyin yanarak kul.notes: Both transitive and intransitive; strong verb. Brenenn bir seyin yaniyor olma durumu, verbrennen ise bir seyi yakmak. Intransitiv versiyonu ise birseyin yanarak kul olmasi

to depict — tasvir etmek.exde: Die Grafik bildet genau ab, wie sich die Werte über die Zeit verändert haben.
to depict — tasvir etmek.exen: The graphic accurately depicts how the values changed over time.
to depict — tasvir etmek.notes: Used for images, diagrams, maps; also digital rendering.

to govern — yönetmek.exde: Der Präsident regiert das Land, obwohl die Opposition stark ist.
to govern — yönetmek.exen: The president governs the country although the opposition is strong.

to award / distinguish — ödüllendirmek.exde: Die Jury zeichnet den Film aus, weil er besonders originell ist.
to award / distinguish — ödüllendirmek.exen: The jury awards the film because it is especially original.
to award / distinguish — ödüllendirmek.notes: Awarding prizes; also: be outstanding (sich auszeichnen).

to exercise (rights, influence) — uygula.exde: Sie übt Druck auf die Regierung aus, damit die Regel geändert wird.
to exercise (rights, influence) — uygula.exen: She exerts pressure on the government so that the rule is changed.

to forgive; to allocate — affetmek / ver.exde: Sie vergibt ihm seinen Fehler, nachdem er sich entschuldigt hat.
to forgive; to allocate — affetmek / ver.exen: She forgives him for his mistake after he apologized.
to forgive; to allocate — affetmek / ver.notes: Two meanings: forgive OR assign (einen Platz vergeben).

to pay for / to arise — masrafları karşı.exde: Die Versicherung kommt für den Schaden auf, nachdem der Fall geprüft wurde.
to pay for / to arise — masrafları karşı.exen: The insurance covers the damage after the case was reviewed.
to pay for / to arise — masrafları karşı.notes: Also “emerge” as a topic (Fragen kommen auf).

to grow up — büyümek.exde: Er wächst in einer kleinen Stadt auf, obwohl seine Eltern oft umziehen müssen.
to grow up — büyümek.exen: He grows up in a small town although his parents often have to move.
to grow up — büyümek.notes: Used for childhood development; no direct object.

to test — test etmek.exde: Die Firma testet das Produkt ausführlich, bevor es verkauft wird.
to test — test etmek.exen: The company tests the product thoroughly before it is sold.
to test — test etmek.notes: Used for quality checks, experiments, exams.

to burden / stress — yük olmak.exde: Die zusätzliche Arbeit belastet ihn, weil er kaum Freizeit hat.
to burden / stress — yük olmak.exen: The extra work burdens him because he barely has any free time.

to analyze — analiz etmek.exde: Die Wissenschaftler analysieren die Daten, nachdem sie alle Proben gesammelt haben.
to analyze — analiz etmek.exen: The scientists analyze the data after collecting all samples.

to condemn / sentence — mahkum etmek.exde: Das Gericht verurteilt den Täter, nachdem eindeutige Beweise vorliegen.
to condemn / sentence — mahkum etmek.exen: The court sentences the perpetrator after clear evidence is presented.

to reply / respond — karşılık vermek.exde: Sie erwidert seine Frage, obwohl sie eigentlich keine Zeit hat.
to reply / respond — karşılık vermek.exen: She answers his question although she actually has no time.

to suspend / expose — askıya almak.exde: Die Firma setzt das Projekt aus, bis neue Gelder bereitstehen.
to suspend / expose — askıya almak.exen: The company suspends the project until new funds are available.

to strengthen — güçlendirmek.exde: Regelmäßiges Training stärkt den Körper, sodass man sich fitter fühlt.
to strengthen — güçlendirmek.exen: Regular training strengthens the body so that one feels fitter.

to dedicate — adamak.exde: Er widmet sich seiner Arbeit, obwohl er kaum Anerkennung bekommt.
to dedicate — adamak.exen: He dedicates himself to his work although he receives little recognition.

to support — desteklemek.exde: Die Regierung stützt die Wirtschaft, indem sie neue Programme einführt.
to support — desteklemek.exen: The government supports the economy by introducing new programs.

to be subject to / to lose — yenilmek /.exde: Er unterliegt seinem Gegner, obwohl er hart trainiert hat.
to be subject to / to lose — yenilmek /.exen: He loses to his opponent although he trained hard.
