to be subject to / to lose — yenilmek /.notes: Formal: “is subject to regulations” (etw. unterliegt Regeln).

to transform — dönüştürmek.exde: Die Hitze verwandelt die Landschaft in eine trockene Wüste.
to transform — dönüştürmek.exen: The heat transforms the landscape into a dry desert.

to attack — saldırmak.exde: Der Hund greift den Eindringling an, nachdem dieser den Zaun überstiegen hat.
to attack — saldırmak.exen: The dog attacks the intruder after he climbed over the fence.
to attack — saldırmak.notes: Physical attack; also sports, figurative criticism.

to align / organize — düzenlemek.exde: Die Schule richtet ein Fest aus, damit die Gemeinschaft zusammenkommt.
to align / organize — düzenlemek.exen: The school organizes a festival to bring the community together.
to align / organize — düzenlemek.notes: Also “align” physically; also deliver a message (jdm etw ausrichten).

to be worth it — değmek.exde: Der Aufwand lohnt sich, weil das Ergebnis beeindruckend ist.
to be worth it — değmek.exen: The effort is worth it because the result is impressive.

to catch — yakalamak.exde: Er fängt den Ball, nachdem sein Mitspieler ihn geworfen hat.
to catch — yakalamak.exen: He catches the ball after his teammate threw it.

to dissolve — çözülmek.exde: Die Gruppe löst sich auf, weil die Mitglieder verschiedene Wege gehen wollen.
to dissolve — çözülmek.exen: The group dissolves because the members want to go separate ways.

to rise / open / be solved — doğmak / aç.exde: Die Sonne geht auf, während die Stadt langsam aufwacht.
to rise / open / be solved — doğmak / aç.exen: The sun rises as the city slowly wakes up.

to dare — cesaret etmek.exde: Er wagt den Schritt ins Ausland, obwohl er dort niemanden kennt.
to dare — cesaret etmek.exen: He dares to go abroad although he knows no one there.

to hide — saklamak.exde: Sie verbirgt ihre Gefühle, weil sie niemanden belasten möchte.
to hide — saklamak.exen: She hides her feelings because she doesn’t want to burden anyone.

to impress — etkilemek.exde: Die Präsentation beeindruckt das Publikum, weil sie sehr gut strukturiert ist.
to impress — etkilemek.exen: The presentation impresses the audience because it is very well structured.

to perform (arts) — sahnelemek.exde: Das Theater führt ein neues Stück auf, das vom Publikum begeistert aufgenommen wird.
to perform (arts) — sahnelemek.exen: The theater performs a new play that is enthusiastically received by the audience.
to perform (arts) — sahnelemek.notes: Used for concerts, plays, performances; also “list, enumerate” in formal writing.

to expand/enlarge — genişletmek.exde: Die Universität erweitert ihr Angebot, damit mehr Studierende Zugang zu Kursen haben.
to expand/enlarge — genişletmek.exen: The university expands its offerings so that more students have access to courses.
to expand/enlarge — genişletmek.notes: Both physical expansion and abstract (skills, programs).

to engage/commit — dahil olmak.exde: Er engagiert sich für den Umweltschutz, weil ihm die Zukunft wichtig ist.
to engage/commit — dahil olmak.exen: He commits himself to environmental protection because the future is important to him.

to regulate — düzenlemek.exde: Ein neues Gesetz regelt den Datenschutz, nachdem mehrere Verstöße bekannt wurden.
to regulate — düzenlemek.exen: A new law regulates data protection after several violations became known.

to propose — önermek.exde: Sie schlägt vor, dass wir morgen früher beginnen.
to propose — önermek.exen: She proposes that we start earlier tomorrow.

to obligate — mecbur etmek.exde: Der Vertrag verpflichtet ihn zu regelmäßigen Zahlungen.
to obligate — mecbur etmek.exen: The contract obligates him to make regular payments.

to perceive — algılamak.exde: Er nimmt eine Veränderung wahr, obwohl er sie nicht genau erklären kann.
to perceive — algılamak.exen: He notices a change, although he cannot explain it precisely.
to perceive — algılamak.notes: Sensory perception or awareness; also “to take on duties.”

to transfer — aktarmak.exde: Das Virus wird durch engen Kontakt übertragen, was viele nicht wussten.
to transfer — aktarmak.exen: The virus is transmitted through close contact, which many did not know.
to transfer — aktarmak.notes: Multiple domains: diseases, data, rights, tasks.

to examine/check — incelemek.exde: Die Bank prüft den Antrag, bevor sie eine Entscheidung trifft.
to examine/check — incelemek.exen: The bank checks the application before making a decision.

to criticize — eleştirmek.exde: Er kritisiert ihren Vorschlag, obwohl er keinen besseren hat.
to criticize — eleştirmek.exen: He criticizes her proposal although he doesn't have a better one.

to understand/comprehend — kavramak.exde: Er begreift endlich, warum seine Entscheidung falsch war.
to understand/comprehend — kavramak.exen: He finally understands why his decision was wrong.

to fail — başarısız olmak [scheitern (an.exde: Der Plan ist am Geld gescheitert.
to fail — başarısız olmak [scheitern (an.exen: The plan failed because of money.
to fail — başarısız olmak [scheitern (an.notes: Intransitive; take cause with an + Dat. Misslingen: Means that something fails on its own—an action or attempt does not succeed, without focusing on who is responsible. It is impersonal and used with Dativ for the person (Etwas misslingt mir). Compared to scheitern, which is intransitive and emphasizes breaking down because of a cause (an + Dat.), misslingen highlights the unsuccessful outcome itself, often more formal or literary. Scheitern = the plan collapses due to something; misslingen = the attempt simply doesn’t work out.

to fail — başarısız olmak [scheitern (mi.exde: Er scheitert mit seinem Plan, obwohl er alles sorgfältig vorbereitet hatte.
to fail — başarısız olmak [scheitern (mi.exen: He fails with his plan although he prepared everything carefully.
to fail — başarısız olmak [scheitern (mi.notes: Intransitive; used for plans, negotiations, attempts.

to require/need — ihtiyaç duymak.exde: Wir benötigen mehr Zeit, damit wir alle Aufgaben gründlich bearbeiten können.
to require/need — ihtiyaç duymak.exen: We need more time so we can complete all tasks thoroughly.
to require/need — ihtiyaç duymak.notes: Formal version of brauchen; often used in documents.

to threaten — tehdit etmek [jdn bedrohen.exde: Der Mann bedroht den Zeugen, damit er schweigt.
to threaten — tehdit etmek [jdn bedrohen.exen: The man threatens the witness so that he stays silent.

to threaten — tehdit etmek [drohen].exde: Der Lehrer droht den Schülern mit Strafen, wenn sie weiter stören.
to threaten — tehdit etmek [drohen].exen: The teacher threatens the students with punishment if they continue to disrupt.
to threaten — tehdit etmek [drohen].notes: Used with dative person + mit + Dat (threat).

to state/boast — bildirmek / hava atmak.exde: Er gibt an, dass er bereits Erfahrung hat, obwohl das nicht stimmt.
to state/boast — bildirmek / hava atmak.exen: He states that he already has experience, although that isn't true.
to state/boast — bildirmek / hava atmak.notes: Two meanings: official stating OR bragging (umgangssprachlich).

to record / take in / accept (people) (u.exde: Das Mikrofon nimmt jedes Geräusch auf, sodass man alles klar hören kann. Die Universität hat dieses Jahr nur 200 neue Studenten aufgenommen.
to record / take in / accept (people) (u.exen: The microphone records every sound so that everything can be heard clearly. The university accepted only 200 new students this year.
to record / take in / accept (people) (u.notes: Üç ana kullanım: (1) ses/video kaydetmek, (2) insanları kabul etmek (üniversite, program, kulüp, mülteci kabulü), (3) bir şeye başlamak (Studium aufnehmen).

to appear / have an effect — etki yaratm.exde: Er wirkt müde, weil er kaum geschlafen hat.
to appear / have an effect — etki yaratm.exen: He appears tired because he barely slept.
to appear / have an effect — etki yaratm.notes: Also “have an effect on” (auf + Akk wirken).

to define — tanımlamak.exde: Der Professor definiert den Begriff, damit es keine Missverständnisse gibt.
to define — tanımlamak.exen: The professor defines the term so that there are no misunderstandings.

to handle/deal with — baş etmek.exde: Sie geht sehr sorgfältig mit sensiblen Daten um.
to handle/deal with — baş etmek.exen: She handles sensitive data very carefully.
to handle/deal with — baş etmek.notes: Not to be confused with umgehen = avoid (umgeht, hat umgangen).

to produce/generate — üretmek.exde: Die Maschine erzeugt ein starkes Geräusch, wenn sie startet.
to produce/generate — üretmek.exen: The machine generates a loud noise when it starts.

to trigger — tetiklemek.exde: Die Nachricht löst eine heftige Reaktion aus, weil niemand damit gerechnet hat.
to trigger — tetiklemek.exen: The news triggers a strong reaction because no one expected it.

to direct/aim — yöneltmek.exde: Sie richtet ihre Aufmerksamkeit auf das Problem, nachdem es erneut aufgetreten ist.
to direct/aim — yöneltmek.exen: She directs her attention to the problem after it occurred again.

to demand — talep etmek.exde: Die Situation verlangt schnelle Entscheidungen, damit der Schaden begrenzt wird.
to demand — talep etmek.exen: The situation demands quick decisions so that the damage is limited.
to demand — talep etmek.notes: Stronger and more formal than brauchen. Fordern is more forceful, hard demand. Fordern siyasi, hukuki, resmi talepler, daha yüksek maas, ozgurluk talep ediyoruz gibi. Verlangen ise 'bunun icin yuksek bir fiyat istiyorum' derken wollen wünschen vs degil de verlangen denir, cunku talep ediyoruz, ya da banka belge talep ediyor.

to send off — göndermek.exde: Ich sende das Paket heute ab.
to send off — göndermek.exen: I send the package off today.
to send off — göndermek.notes: Used for official/ formal sending (mail, applications, forms). More procedural than schicken.

to load / charge / load (digitally) — yü.exde: Er lädt die Kisten ins Auto.
to load / charge / load (digitally) — yü.exen: He loads the boxes into the car.
to load / charge / load (digitally) — yü.notes: Hem fiziksel olarak eşya yüklemek (arabaya, kamyona), hem elektronik cihazları şarj etmek(Handy laden), hem de dijital içeriklerin yüklenmesi için kullanılır (Die Seite lädt noch). Ayrıca “einladen” üzerinden davet etmek anlamıyla bağlantılıdır. Beladen yükle doldurmak; aufladen teknik olarak şarj etmek; hochladen internete yüklemek; herunterladen indirmektir.

to soap up — sabunlamak.notes: Washing action focusing on applying soap; often reflexive.

to rinse / wash dishes — bulaşıkları yık.notes: Rinsing/cleaning dishes; contrasts with abwaschen (full washing).

to dry (off) — kurutmak.notes: Drying with a cloth/towel; contrasts with trocknen (air-drying).

to scan — taramak.notes: Digital scanning (documents, barcodes). Often used with einscannen.

to sort — sıralamak.exde: Er sortiert die Briefe nach Datum.
to sort — sıralamak.exen: He sorts the letters by date.
to sort — sıralamak.notes: Organizing by categories; more structured than ordnen.

to crash — çökmek / düşmek.notes: Used for computers crashing, planes falling; sudden total failure.

to fall — düşmek [fallen].exde: Die Preise fallen, weil das Angebot größer geworden ist.
to fall — düşmek [fallen].exen: Prices are falling because the supply has increased.
to fall — düşmek [fallen].notes: Intransitive downward motion; also figurative for decline or loss.

to fall — düşmek [stürzen].notes: Physical falling; stronger than hinfallen(simple fall).

to reset — sıfırlamak.notes: Reset devices/settings/counters to default; stronger than rückgängig machen.

to shy away — çekinmek.exen: He shies away from no effort.
to shy away — çekinmek.notes: Avoid something due to reluctance/fear; often used negatively.

to solve / loosen — çözmek.notes: Solve problems, untie knots, detach parts, dissolve substances.

to drill into — kafasına sokmak.exde: Der Lehrer trichtert ihnen die Regeln ein.
to drill into — kafasına sokmak.exen: The teacher drills the rules into them.

to protect — korumak.notes: Protect from danger/damage; often vor + Dat.

to supply — sağlamak.exde: Wir führen dem Körper Vitamine zu.
to supply — sağlamak.exen: We supply the body with vitamins.

to toil/ grind — çok çalışmak.exde: Er ackert jeden Tag bis spät abends.
to toil/ grind — çok çalışmak.exen: He toils every day until late.
to toil/ grind — çok çalışmak.notes: Informal for working extremely hard; like schuften. This is more of motivational grind - schuften is more of complaint of hard work, feelings of suffering.

to correct — düzeltmek [berichtigen].exde: Der Lehrer berichtigt den Aufsatz, den die Schüler gestern abgegeben haben.
to correct — düzeltmek [berichtigen].exen: The teacher corrects the essay that the students submitted yesterday.

to correct — düzeltmek [korrigieren].notes: Correcting errors; more precise than verbessern.

to turn off / park — kapatmak / park etm.notes: Turn off power/water; or temporarily park items.

to replace — değiştirmek.notes: Substitute or swap out something broken/old.

to ingest — almak (vücuda).notes: Formal/medical: taking food or substances into the body.

to store — depolamak.exde: Wir lagern die Kisten im Keller.
to store — depolamak.exen: We store the boxes in the cellar.

to toil / work hard — çok çalışmak.exde: Er schuftet jeden Tag bis spät in die Nacht.
to toil / work hard — çok çalışmak.exen: He toils every day until late at night.
to toil / work hard — çok çalışmak.notes: Informal; means working extremely hard, usually physically exhausting or poorly paid work. Stronger than hart arbeiten. Often negative or complaining in tone.

to slave away — köle gibi çalışmak.exde: Sie hat sich im Büro völlig abgerackert.
to slave away — köle gibi çalışmak.exen: She completely slaved away at the office.
to slave away — köle gibi çalışmak.notes: Colloquial; emphasizes overworking oneself to the point of exhaustion. Slightly stronger and more self-destructive than schuften. Often reflexive: sich abrackern.

to arise / come into being — ortaya çıkm.exde: Es ist ein neues Problem entstanden.
to arise / come into being — ortaya çıkm.notes: Bir şeyin kendiliğinden ortaya çıkması, zaman içinde oluşması veya meydana gelmesi anlamına gelir; bilinçli bir yapma eylemi vurgulanmaz. Genelde problemler, durumlar, fikirler, doğal oluşumlar için kullanılır. Ancak insan yapımı olsa bile, sonucun ortaya çıkmasına / varlık kazanmasına odaklanıldığında (Das Haus ist in 8 Monaten entstanden) kullanılabilir. Burada “kim yaptı?” değil, ortaya çıkan yeni şeyin oluşumu vurgulanır. Yapım eylemini belirtmek için bauen veya errichten kullanılır.

to subdivide — alt bölümlere ayırmak.exde: Das Gebiet ist in drei Zonen unterteilt.
to subdivide — alt bölümlere ayırmak.exen: The area is subdivided into three zones.
to subdivide — alt bölümlere ayırmak.notes: Bir şeyi bölümlere ayırmak, kategorilere ayırmak; daha teknik ve yapısal bir bölme.

to section off / separate — bölmek / ayı.exde: Sie teilt ein Stück Stoff ab.
to section off / separate — bölmek / ayı.exen: She separates a piece of fabric.
to section off / separate — bölmek / ayı.notes: Bir bütünden parça ayırmak, kesip çıkarmak; fiziksel bir bölme veya parça ayırma.

to allocate / divide up — ayırmak / plan.exde: Ich teile meine Zeit gut ein.
to allocate / divide up — ayırmak / plan.notes: Bir şeyi gruplara, görevlere veya zaman dilimlerine ayırarak planlamak; dağıtmak ve organize etmek odaklı.

to make progress — ilerlemek.exde: Wir kommen mit dem Projekt gut voran.
to make progress — ilerlemek.exen: We are making good progress with the project.
to make progress — ilerlemek.notes: İş, proje veya süreçte ilerleme kaydetmek, gelişme göstermek; mecazi ilerleme.

to catch — yakalamak / ele geçirmek.exde: Die Polizei hat den Dieb erwischt. Ich habe den Bus gerade noch erwischt.
to catch — yakalamak / ele geçirmek.exen: The police caught the thief. I still managed to catch the bus.
to catch — yakalamak / ele geçirmek.notes: Birini veya bir şeyi aniden, beklenmedik şekilde yakalamak; ayrıca “yakalamak (otobüsü)” ya da “birini bir şey yaparken yakalamak” anlamında kullanılır. Onu 31 cekerken yakaladim.

to beg — dilenmek / yalvarmak.notes: Dilenmek anlamında doğrudan; ayrıca mecazi olarak birinden ısrarla, yalvararak bir şey istemek için kullanılır.

to construct / erect — inşa etmek / kurm.exde: Die Firma hat ein neues Gebäude errichtet.
to construct / erect — inşa etmek / kurm.exen: The company has constructed a new building.
to construct / erect — inşa etmek / kurm.notes: Bilinçli ve planlı bir şekilde bina, yapı, anıt, kurum veya sistem inşa etmek/ kurmak anlamına gelir. Bauen’dan daha resmî ve teknik bir kelimedir; genelde büyük, kalıcı veya mühendislik gerektiren yapılar için kullanılır.

to blow-dry — fönlemek / saç kurutmak.exde: Sie föhnt ihre Haare nach dem Duschen.
to blow-dry — fönlemek / saç kurutmak.exen: She blow-dries her hair after showering.
to blow-dry — fönlemek / saç kurutmak.notes: Saçı fön makinesiyle kurutmak anlamına gelir. Hem profesyonel fön çekmek hem de evde saç kurutmak için kullanılır.

to research — araştırmak [forschen (nach.exde: Die Wissenschaftler forschen nach einer Lösung, die langfristig funktioniert.
to research — araştırmak [forschen (nach.exen: The scientists research a solution that works long-term.

to research — araştırmak [recherchieren].exde: Ich recherchiere das Thema für meine Präsentation.
to research — araştırmak [recherchieren].exen: I'm researching the topic for my presentation.
to research — araştırmak [recherchieren].notes: Gazetecilik, akademik veya çevrimiçi bilgi arama için kullanılır; derin veya sistematik araştırma anlamı taşır.

to bite off — ısırarak parça koparmak.exde: Er beißt ein Stück vom Apfel ab.
to bite off — ısırarak parça koparmak.exen: He bites off a piece of the apple.
to bite off — ısırarak parça koparmak.notes: Bir yiyecekten ısırarak parça koparmak; hareket tek seferlik ısırma odaklıdır.

to paint (a surface) — boyamak.exde: Wir streichen die Wand blau an.
to paint (a surface) — boyamak.notes: Bir yüzeyi (duvar, çit) boyamak anlamına gelir. Streichen’den daha spesifik: yüzeyi tamamen boyamak. Anstreichen geniş yüzeyleri (duvar, çit, tavan) normal boya ile boyamak demektir. Lackieren ise vernikli, parlak veya dayanıklı kaplama uygulamak için kullanılır (mobilya, metal, araba, tırnak). Kullanılan boya türü ve amaç tamamen farklıdır.

to cross out — üstünü çizmek.exde: Sie streicht das falsche Wort durch.
to cross out — üstünü çizmek.exen: She crosses out the wrong word.
to cross out — üstünü çizmek.notes: Bir kelime veya metnin üstünü tamamen çizmek; iptal etmek. “Tamamen geçersiz kılma” anlamı taşır.

to wake someone up — uyandırmak.exde: Ich wecke meinen Bruder jeden Morgen auf.
to wake someone up — uyandırmak.exen: I wake my brother up every morning.
to wake someone up — uyandırmak.notes: Birini uyandırmak; aufwachen kişinin kendiliğinden uyanmasıdır, aufwecken birinin uyandırması.

to be honest — dürüst olmak gerekirse.exde: Um ehrlich zu sein, ich bin sehr müde.
to be honest — dürüst olmak gerekirse.exen: To be honest, I'm very tired.
to be honest — dürüst olmak gerekirse.notes: Bir fiil değildir; konuşmada samimiyet, dürüstlük vurgusu yapan kalıptır. Cümleye zayıf bağlaç gibi girer.

to look at one’s phone — telefona bakmak.de: aufs Handy schauen / auf mein Handy schauen
to look at one’s phone — telefona bakmak.exde: Ich schaue auf mein Handy, um die Uhrzeit zu sehen.
to look at one’s phone — telefona bakmak.exen: I look at my phone to check the time.
to look at one’s phone — telefona bakmak.notes: schauen + auf + Akk. = bir şeye bakmak. Telefona göz atmak, bildirimlere bakmak günlük kullanımda çok yaygın.

to depend — bağlı olmak.notes: Ana ve en önemli anlamı “von + Dativ” ile bağlı olmak / depend on” demektir. Bir durumun başka bir faktöre göre değiştiğini ifade eder. (“Arkadaşlarla takılmak” anlamı yan ve ikinci derecedir.)

to elaborate / develop — detaylandırmak.exde: Er arbeitet den Plan bis ins Detail aus.
to elaborate / develop — detaylandırmak.exen: He works out the plan in detail.
to elaborate / develop — detaylandırmak.notes: Bir taslağı veya fikri detaylandırmak, geliştirmek, olgunlaştırmak anlamına gelir. Son haline yaklaşan, detaylı bir çalışma içerir; gestalten’den daha teknik, entwerfen’den daha tamamlayıcıdır.

to put in / grant / admit — yerleştirmek.exde: Sie räumt die Bücher ins Regal ein.
to put in / grant / admit — yerleştirmek.exen: She puts the books into the shelf.
to put in / grant / admit — yerleştirmek.notes: İki ana anlamı vardır: (1) bir şeyi bir yere yerleştirmek (dolap, raf), (2) soyut olarak itiraf etmek, kabul etmek (Fehler einräumen = hatayı kabul etmek).

to put away / clear away — ortadan kaldı.notes: Bir şeyi bulunduğu yerden alıp kaldırmak; ortalığı toplamak, eşyaları yerine koymak. Genelde ev içi düzen/temizlik bağlamında kullanılır.

to throw away — çöpe atmak / atmak.exde: Ich habe die alten Zeitungen weggeschmissen.
to throw away — çöpe atmak / atmak.exen: I threw away the old newspapers.
to throw away — çöpe atmak / atmak.notes: Bir şeyi atmak, çöpe atmak; çok günlük ve konuşma dili. Resmî karşılığı wegwerfen’dir. Bu cope atmak, copu disari atmak bosaltmak da rausbringen

to use — kullanmak.exde: Man kann diesen Ausdruck im Alltag gut gebrauchen.
to use — kullanmak.exen: You can use this expression well in daily life.
to use — kullanmak.notes: Bir şeyi kullanmak anlamına gelir; benutzen ve verwenden’den biraz daha resmî/kitabi tondadır. Hem fiziksel hem soyut kullanımlarda geçer.

to hand over / deliver — teslim etmek /.exde: Er übergibt das Paket an den Kunden.
to hand over / deliver — teslim etmek /.exen: He hands over the package to the customer.
to hand over / deliver — teslim etmek /.notes: Bir şeyi resmî veya kontrollü şekilde teslim etmek, devretmek anlamına gelir. Hem fiziksel teslim (paket, belge) hem soyut devretme (görev, sorumluluk) için kullanılır. “Kusmak” anlamı da vardır (sich übergeben), ancak farklı bir kullanımdır. Kisiye dogrudan elden teslim etmek, devretmek, paket, sorumluluk, proje vs. abgeben bir yere birakip teslim etmek, einreichen bir basvuru icin daha resmi bir belge teslimi

to dare / to have the courage — cesaret.exde: Ich traue mich nicht, das zu sagen.
to dare / to have the courage — cesaret.exen: I don't dare to say that.
to dare / to have the courage — cesaret.notes: Bir şeyi yapmaya cesaret etmek anlamına gelir. Birine güvenmek olan trauen’dan tamamen farklıdır. İçsel cesaret/ çekingenlik bağlamlarında kullanılır.

to knock over — devirmek / yıkmak.exde: Er hat aus Versehen das Glas umgestoßen.
to knock over — devirmek / yıkmak.exen: He accidentally knocked over the glass.
to knock over — devirmek / yıkmak.notes: Bir nesneyi devirmek, yıkmak, kazara veya bilinçli olarak yere düşürmek anlamına gelir. Genelde fiziksel bir nesnenin devrilmesini ifade eder.

to note down — not etmek / yazmak.exde: Ich notiere mir die Adresse, damit ich sie nicht vergesse.
to note down — not etmek / yazmak.exen: I note down the address so I don’t forget it.
to note down — not etmek / yazmak.notes: Bir bilgiyi kısaca not etmek, yazıya geçirmek anlamına gelir. Genelde hızlı, pratik not alma (adres, telefon, hatırlatma) için kullanılır. Aufschreiben ile benzer olsa da notieren daha nötr ve resmî tondadır; kısa ve net bilgi kaydetme odaklıdır.

to write down — yazmak / not almak.exen: Please write down my phone number.
to write down — yazmak / not almak.notes: Bir bilgiyi ayrıntılı veya açıkça yazmak, genelde bir yüzeye (kâğıt, defter, liste) fiziksel olarak yazıya dökmek anlamına gelir. Notieren hızlı, kısa notlar içinken, aufschreiben daha “tam olarak yazmak” anlamı taşır; bilgi saklama ve iletme amacı daha belirgindir.

to send (off) — göndermek / yollamak.notes: E-mail, mektup, belge veya paketi göndermek; fiziksel veya dijital gönderim.

to unlock — kilidini açmak.notes: Anahtarla kapı/kapı kilidi açmak; sadece kilitli şeyler için.

to find out / discover — öğrenmek / orta.exde: Ich habe herausgefunden, wo er wohnt.
to find out / discover — öğrenmek / orta.exen: I found out where he lives.
to find out / discover — öğrenmek / orta.notes: Bir bilgiyi öğrenmek, keşfetmek; araştırarak veya tesadüfen bilgi edinmek.

to queue / to be due — sırada olmak / ku.exde: Es steht eine lange Schlange an.
to queue / to be due — sırada olmak / ku.notes: İki anlam: (1) sırada/kuyrukta beklemek, (2) yapılması gereken bir işin “gündemde/ sırada” olması.

to prefer — tercih etmek.exde: Ich ziehe Kaffee dem Tee vor.
to prefer — tercih etmek.notes: Bir şeyi başka bir şeye tercih etmek; yapı: etwas (Akk.) etwas(Dat.) vorziehen.

to point at sth. — bir şeyi işaret etmek.notes: Bir şeyi parmakla veya elle işaret etmek; auf + Akk. ile kullanılır.

to ladle / to serve (food) — kepçeyle/ka.exde: Er schöpft den Reis auf den Teller.
to ladle / to serve (food) — kepçeyle/ka.exen: He serves the rice onto the plate.
to ladle / to serve (food) — kepçeyle/ka.notes: Restoranda veya yemek servisinde porsiyonları tabağa/kaba koymak; kaşık, kepçe veya servis aletiyle olur. Yemekhanede “yemek koymak” için standart fiil.

to throw out / kick out — dışarı atmak /.exde: Der Chef hat ihn aus dem Büro rausgeschmissen.
to throw out / kick out — dışarı atmak /.exen: The boss kicked him out of the office.
to throw out / kick out — dışarı atmak /.notes: Çok günlük ve konuşma dili; birini veya bir şeyi sert şekilde “dışarı atmak / kovmak”. İnsanlar için de eşyalar için de kullanılır.

to throw out / expel — dışarı atmak / ko.exde: Sie haben den Spieler aus dem Team rausgeworfen.
to throw out / expel — dışarı atmak / ko.exen: They kicked the player out of the team.
to throw out / expel — dışarı atmak / ko.notes: Rausschmeißen ile aynı anlam ama biraz daha nötr; hem konuşma dili hem yazı dilinde kullanılabilir. Birini kovmak, bir şeyi atmak.

to exhibit / to issue (belge, sertifika,.exde: Das Museum stellt neue Gemälde aus.
to exhibit / to issue (belge, sertifika,.exen: The museum is exhibiting new paintings.
to exhibit / to issue (belge, sertifika,.notes: İki ana anlam: (1) eserleri sergilemek, (2) belge düzenlemek/ çıkarmak (Rechnung, Zertifikat ausstellen). Hem kültürel hem idari kullanım vardır.

to complete / to finalize — tamamlamak /.exde: Wir stellen den neuen Umkleidebereich nächste Woche fertig.
to complete / to finalize — tamamlamak /.exen: We will complete the new changing area next week.
to complete / to finalize — tamamlamak /.notes: Teknik, resmî ve proje bağlamında “bitmiş hâle getirmek”. İnşaat, renovasyon, proje, mekân veya büyük işlerin profesyonel şekilde tamamlanmasında kullanılır. fertigmachen’in resmî/teknik versiyonu gibi düşünülebilir.

to finish / to get something done — biti.exde: Ich muss die Aufgabe noch fertigmachen.
to finish / to get something done — biti.exen: I still need to finish the task.
to finish / to get something done — biti.notes: Günlük, genel “bitirmek / tamamlamak”. Ödev, iş, temizlik, hazırlık gibi basit ve kişisel işler için kullanılır. Resmî veya teknik ton taşımaz.

to complete / finish (a course, study, p.exde: Ich habe alle meine Kurse erfolgreich absolviert.
to complete / finish (a course, study, p.exen: I successfully completed all my courses.
to complete / finish (a course, study, p.notes: Eğitim, kurs, modül, staj, sınav veya resmi bir programı tamamlamak/ bir süreçten başarıyla geçmek anlamına gelir. “Dersi vermek / programı bitirmek” için en doğal fiildir; sadece sınavı geçmek anlamındaki bestehen’den daha geniştir.

to inspire someone to do sth — birini bi.exde: Was hat dich dazu inspiriert, dieses Gedicht zu schreiben? / Seine Rede hat mich zu neuen Ideen inspiriert.
to inspire someone to do sth — birini bi.exen: What inspired you to write this poem? / His speech inspired me to new ideas.
to inspire someone to do sth — birini bi.case: Akkusativ + zu + Dat. (jdn zu etw inspirieren)
to inspire someone to do sth — birini bi.notes: Birini bir eyleme, fikre veya yaratıcı bir şeye yönlendirmek, ilham vermek anlamına gelir. Kalıp zorunludur: jdn zu etw inspirieren. “dazu/daran/dafür” gibi Präpositionaladverb'lerle çok sık kullanılır. zu + Dat. çoğu zaman soyut bir eylemi ifade eder (zu kreativem Denken, zu neuen Ideen, zum Schreiben). Nereden ilham alınacağını açıklarken genelde “durch” kullanılır (durch Musik inspiriert).

to get lost / to go wrong — kaybolmak /.exde: Wir haben uns im Wald verlaufen.
to get lost / to go wrong — kaybolmak /.exen: We got lost in the forest.
to get lost / to go wrong — kaybolmak /.notes: İki ana kullanım: (1) yolunu kaybetmek (sich verlaufen), (2) bir sürecin beklenildiği gibi gitmemesi (Das Gespräch ist gut/schlecht verlaufen).

to send / dispatch — göndermek (resmî, s.exde: Die Firma versendet die Ware am selben Tag.
to send / dispatch — göndermek (resmî, s.exen: The company dispatches the goods the same day.
to send / dispatch — göndermek (resmî, s.notes: Abschicken’e göre daha resmî ve kurumsal; lojistik, şirket, online satış bağlamlarında yaygın.

to heat up / warm — ısıtmak, ılıtmak.exde: Ich erwärme das Essen in der Mikrowelle.
to heat up / warm — ısıtmak, ılıtmak.exen: I heat up the food in the microwave.
to heat up / warm — ısıtmak, ılıtmak.notes: Bir şeyin sıcaklığını artırmak; yemek, içecek, oda vb. için kullanılır.

to defend — savunmak.notes: Fiziksel (ülke, kişi) ve soyut (fikir, hak) savunmalar için kullanılır.

to appear / to surface — ortaya çıkmak.notes: Beklenmedik şekilde belirmek; insan, nesne, sorun veya bilgi için.

to hire / to set / to stop — işe almak /.exde: Die Firma stellt neue Mitarbeiter ein.
to hire / to set / to stop — işe almak /.notes: Çok anlamlı: işe almak, ayar yapmak, faaliyeti durdurmak. Anlam bağlama bağlıdır. Telefonun dilini almanca yapinca da bu yaziyor sprach wird eingestellt.. Gibi bisi yaziyor. Iphone daki settings de einstellungen

to simulate / to fake — simüle etmek / n.exde: Er simuliert eine Krankheit, um nicht zur Arbeit gehen zu müssen.
to simulate / to fake — simüle etmek / n.exen: He fakes an illness so he doesn't have to go to work.
to simulate / to fake — simüle etmek / n.notes: To simulate or pretend something. Can mean both technical simulation (ein Experiment simulieren) and faking/pretending (eine Krankheit simulieren).

to join (an organization) — katılmak / ü.exde: Sie ist dem Sportverein beigetreten, weil sie fitter werden wollte.
to join (an organization) — katılmak / ü.exen: She joined the sports club because she wanted to get fitter.
to join (an organization) — katılmak / ü.notes: To become a member of a group, organization, or party. Takes Dativ: einem Verein beitreten. Unlike 'teilnehmen an' (to participate), beitreten implies formal membership.

to get engaged — nişanlanmak.exde: Sie haben sich letztes Jahr verlobt und planen die Hochzeit im Sommer.
to get engaged — nişanlanmak.exen: They got engaged last year and are planning the wedding in summer.
to get engaged — nişanlanmak.notes: Almost always used reflexively: sich verloben (mit jemandem). Describes the act of getting engaged to be married.

to count — saymak.exde: Das Kind zählt die Sterne am Himmel, bevor es einschläft.
to count — saymak.exen: The child counts the stars in the sky before falling asleep.
to count — saymak.notes: To count objects (Akkusativ) or to count/matter (intransitiv): 'Jede Stimme zählt' = every vote counts. Also used with 'zu': 'Er zählt zu den Besten' = he is among the best.

to attach / to install — takmak / monte.exde: Er hat ein neues Regal an der Wand angebracht.
to attach / to install — takmak / monte.exen: He installed a new shelf on the wall.
to attach / to install — takmak / monte.notes: To fasten, mount, or install something in place. Also used figuratively: eine Bemerkung anbringen = to make a remark.

to cross / to fold (arms) — kavuşturmak.exde: Sie verschränkt die Arme und wartet ungeduldig auf eine Antwort.
to cross / to fold (arms) — kavuşturmak.exen: She crosses her arms and waits impatiently for an answer.
to cross / to fold (arms) — kavuşturmak.notes: To cross or interlock, most commonly used with arms (die Arme verschränken) or fingers (die Finger verschränken). Implies a deliberate folding or interlocking.

to make a mistake inadvertently / before.exde: Ehe man sich versieht, ist der Urlaub schon wieder vorbei.
to make a mistake inadvertently / before.exen: Before you know it, the vacation is already over.
to make a mistake inadvertently / before.notes: Reflexive verb with two main uses: 1) 'sich versehen' = to make an accidental mistake, 2) 'ehe man sich versieht' = before you know it (very common idiom). Also: 'sich mit etwas versehen' = to equip oneself with something.

to hide — saklamak / gizlemek.exde: Die Kinder verstecken sich hinter dem Sofa, damit niemand sie findet.
to hide — saklamak / gizlemek.exen: The children hide behind the sofa so no one can find them.
to hide — saklamak / gizlemek.notes: To hide something (transitive: etwas verstecken) or to hide oneself (reflexive: sich verstecken). Unlike 'verbergen' (more literary/formal), verstecken is the everyday word for hiding.

to wake (someone) up — uyandırmak.exde: Kannst du mich morgen um sechs Uhr wecken?
to wake (someone) up — uyandırmak.exen: Can you wake me up tomorrow at six o'clock?
to wake (someone) up — uyandırmak.notes: To wake someone else up (transitive). Unlike 'aufwachen' (to wake up oneself, intransitive), wecken always requires an object — someone being woken up.

to get / to obtain / to take care of — t.exde: Kannst du mir bitte noch Milch besorgen, wenn du einkaufen gehst?
to get / to obtain / to take care of — t.exen: Can you please get me some milk when you go shopping?
to get / to obtain / to take care of — t.notes: To obtain, procure, or take care of something. Very common in everyday speech: 'Ich besorge das' = I'll take care of it. Can also mean 'to worry' in the adjective form (besorgt).

to attain / to achieve — elde etmek / er.exde: Nach jahrelangem Studium hat sie endlich ihren Doktortitel erlangt.
to attain / to achieve — elde etmek / er.exen: After years of study, she finally attained her doctorate.
to attain / to achieve — elde etmek / er.notes: A formal verb meaning to attain or acquire something, often used for abstract things: Ruhm erlangen (to gain fame), Bedeutung erlangen (to gain significance). More formal than 'bekommen' or 'erreichen'.

to pray — dua etmek / ibadet etmek.exde: Sie betet jeden Abend, bevor sie ins Bett geht.
to pray — dua etmek / ibadet etmek.exen: She prays every evening before going to bed.
to pray — dua etmek / ibadet etmek.notes: To pray, either religiously or figuratively. Intransitive, but can take 'für + Akkusativ' (to pray for someone) or 'zu + Dativ' (to pray to God). Not to be confused with 'bitten' (to ask/request).

to tax — vergilendirmek.exde: Der Staat besteuert Luxusgüter höher als alltägliche Waren.
to tax — vergilendirmek.exen: The state taxes luxury goods higher than everyday goods.
to tax — vergilendirmek.notes: To impose a tax on something. Related to 'die Steuer' (tax). Used in economic and political contexts.

to announce — duyurmak / ilan etmek [ank.exde: Die Regierung kündigte neue Maßnahmen an.
to announce — duyurmak / ilan etmek [ank.notes: To announce or declare in advance; public or formal notification of a plan or event.

to announce — duyurmak / ilan etmek [bek.exde: Die Regierung hat die neuen Maßnahmen offiziell bekanntgegeben.
to announce — duyurmak / ilan etmek [bek.exen: The government officially announced the new measures.
to announce — duyurmak / ilan etmek [bek.notes: To publicly announce or make known. A separable verb (gibt bekannt). More formal than 'sagen' or 'mitteilen'. Often used for official announcements.

to check — kontrol etmek / anlamak (günl.exde: Hast du schon deine E-Mails gecheckt?
to check — kontrol etmek / anlamak (günl.exen: Have you checked your emails yet?
to check — kontrol etmek / anlamak (günl.notes: Colloquial/informal verb borrowed from English. In everyday German, also means 'to understand/get it': 'Ich check das nicht' = I don't get it. More informal than 'überprüfen' or 'kontrollieren'.

to secure / to save / to back up — güven.exde: Vergiss nicht, deine Dateien regelmäßig zu sichern.
to secure / to save / to back up — güven.exen: Don't forget to back up your files regularly.
to secure / to save / to back up — güven.notes: To secure, safeguard, or save/back up data. Daten sichern = to back up data, Beweise sichern = to secure evidence. Related to 'die Sicherheit' (security/safety).

to shake — sallamak / çalkalamak.exde: Er schüttelt den Kopf, weil er mit dem Vorschlag nicht einverstanden ist.
to shake — sallamak / çalkalamak.exen: He shakes his head because he doesn't agree with the proposal.
to shake — sallamak / çalkalamak.notes: To shake something back and forth. Common expressions: den Kopf schütteln (shake one's head), jemandem die Hand schütteln (shake someone's hand), eine Flasche schütteln (shake a bottle).

to be connected / to be related — bağlan.exde: Die steigende Arbeitslosigkeit hängt mit der Wirtschaftskrise zusammen.
to be connected / to be related — bağlan.exen: The rising unemployment is connected to the economic crisis.
to be connected / to be related — bağlan.notes: To be related or connected to something. Always intransitive, used with 'mit + Dativ'. Describes a causal or logical connection between things.

to pollute / to get dirty — kirletmek /.exde: Die Fabrik hat den Fluss über Jahre hinweg verschmutzt.
to pollute / to get dirty — kirletmek /.exen: The factory has polluted the river for years.
to pollute / to get dirty — kirletmek /.notes: Transitive (hat verschmutzt): to pollute/dirty something. Intransitive (ist verschmutzt): to become dirty. Die Umwelt verschmutzen = to pollute the environment.

to foam — köpürmek.exde: Das Bier schäumt über, wenn man es zu schnell einschenkt.
to foam — köpürmek.exen: The beer foams over if you pour it too quickly.
to foam — köpürmek.notes: To produce foam or froth. Also used figuratively: 'vor Wut schäumen' = to be foaming with rage. Related to 'der Schaum' (foam).

to practice — pratik yapmak / alıştırma.exde: Sie übt jeden Tag Klavier, um sich auf das Konzert vorzubereiten.
to practice — pratik yapmak / alıştırma.exen: She practices piano every day to prepare for the concert.
to practice — pratik yapmak / alıştırma.notes: To practice or exercise a skill. Can be transitive (Klavier üben) or intransitive (fleißig üben). Also: 'Kritik üben' = to criticize, 'Geduld üben' = to be patient.

to eavesdrop / to wiretap / to test oral.exde: Die Polizei hat das Telefon des Verdächtigen monatelang abgehört.
to eavesdrop / to wiretap / to test oral.exen: The police wiretapped the suspect's phone for months.
to eavesdrop / to wiretap / to test oral.notes: Multiple meanings: 1) to wiretap/eavesdrop (ein Telefon abhören), 2) to test orally (Vokabeln abhören = to quiz someone on vocabulary), 3) to listen to with a stethoscope (einen Patienten abhören).

to lock up / to imprison — hapsetmek / k.exde: Der Verbrecher wurde für zehn Jahre eingesperrt.
to lock up / to imprison — hapsetmek / k.exen: The criminal was locked up for ten years.
to lock up / to imprison — hapsetmek / k.notes: To lock someone up or imprison. Can be used literally (in a room/cell) or for prison sentences. More colloquial than 'inhaftieren' (to incarcerate).

to be brief / to keep it short — kısa tu.exde: Bitte fassen Sie sich kurz, wir haben nicht viel Zeit.
to be brief / to keep it short — kısa tu.exen: Please keep it brief, we don't have much time.
to be brief / to keep it short — kısa tu.notes: Reflexive separable verb meaning to express oneself briefly. Very useful in formal settings: 'Um mich kurzzufassen: ...' = To keep it short: ...

to destroy / to annihilate — yok etmek /.exde: Das Feuer hat das gesamte Gebäude innerhalb weniger Stunden vernichtet.
to destroy / to annihilate — yok etmek /.exen: The fire destroyed the entire building within a few hours.
to destroy / to annihilate — yok etmek /.notes: To completely destroy or annihilate. Stronger than 'zerstören' (to destroy) — implies total obliteration. Also used for documents: Akten vernichten = to shred/destroy files.

to colonize — sömürgeleştirmek.exde: Europäische Mächte haben im 19. Jahrhundert große Teile Afrikas kolonialisiert.
to colonize — sömürgeleştirmek.exen: European powers colonized large parts of Africa in the 19th century.
to colonize — sömürgeleştirmek.notes: To colonize a territory or people. A historical/political term. Also used: 'kolonisieren' as an alternative form.

to decolonize — sömürgecilikten kurtarma.exde: Viele afrikanische Länder wurden in den 1960er Jahren entkolonialisiert.
to decolonize — sömürgecilikten kurtarma.exen: Many African countries were decolonized in the 1960s.
to decolonize — sömürgecilikten kurtarma.notes: The reverse of 'kolonialisieren'. Describes the process of freeing a territory from colonial rule. Often used in passive voice (wurde entkolonialisiert).

to confuse — kafasını karıştırmak / şaşı.exde: Die widersprüchlichen Aussagen haben mich total verwirrt.
to confuse — kafasını karıştırmak / şaşı.exen: The contradictory statements totally confused me.
to confuse — kafasını karıştırmak / şaşı.notes: To confuse or bewilder someone. The past participle 'verwirrt' is also used as an adjective: 'Ich bin verwirrt' = I am confused. Related to 'die Verwirrung' (confusion).

to describe / to denote / to refer to as.exde: Man bezeichnet ihn als einen der besten Ärzte der Stadt.
to describe / to denote / to refer to as.exen: He is referred to as one of the best doctors in the city.
to describe / to denote / to refer to as.notes: To label, describe, or refer to something/someone as. Common pattern: 'jemanden/etwas als ... bezeichnen'. Also means to mark/label (ein Paket bezeichnen).

to scratch — kaşımak / çizmek / tırmalam.exde: Die Katze kratzt an der Tür, weil sie raus will.
to scratch — kaşımak / çizmek / tırmalam.exen: The cat scratches at the door because it wants to go outside.
to scratch — kaşımak / çizmek / tırmalam.notes: To scratch a surface or to scratch oneself. 'sich kratzen' = to scratch oneself. Often used with 'an + Dativ': an der Tür kratzen. Related to 'der Kratzer' (scratch mark).

to itch — kaşınmak / kaşındırmak.exde: Mein Arm juckt so sehr, dass ich nicht aufhören kann zu kratzen.
to itch — kaşınmak / kaşındırmak.exen: My arm itches so much that I can't stop scratching.
to itch — kaşınmak / kaşındırmak.notes: To itch. Often used impersonally: 'Es juckt mich am Arm' = My arm itches. Figuratively: 'Das juckt mich nicht' = I don't care about that (colloquial). Unlike kratzen (to scratch), jucken describes the sensation.

to cool down — soğumak / soğutmak / seri.exde: Lass den Kuchen erst abkühlen, bevor du ihn anschneidest.
to cool down — soğumak / soğutmak / seri.exen: Let the cake cool down first before you cut it.
to cool down — soğumak / soğutmak / seri.notes: Transitive (hat abgekühlt): to cool something down. Intransitive (ist abgekühlt): to cool down by itself. Also used figuratively: 'Die Beziehung hat sich abgekühlt' = the relationship has cooled off.

to overwhelm / to overburden — bunaltmak.exde: Die vielen Aufgaben gleichzeitig überfordern die neuen Mitarbeiter.
to overwhelm / to overburden — bunaltmak.exen: The many tasks at once overwhelm the new employees.
to overwhelm / to overburden — bunaltmak.notes: To demand too much of someone, to overwhelm. Very commonly used as adjective: 'Ich bin überfordert' = I'm overwhelmed / in over my head. Opposite: 'unterfordern' (to underchallenege).

to suspect — şüphelenmek / ...den şüphe.exde: Die Polizei verdächtigt den Nachbarn, das Fenster eingeschlagen zu haben.
to suspect — şüphelenmek / ...den şüphe.exen: The police suspect the neighbor of having smashed the window.
to suspect — şüphelenmek / ...den şüphe.notes: To suspect someone of something. Pattern: 'jemanden verdächtigen, etwas getan zu haben'. Related to 'der Verdacht' (suspicion) and 'verdächtig' (suspicious).

to carry out / to execute — uygulamak /.exde: Der Ingenieur führt die Anweisungen des Projektleiters sorgfältig aus.
to carry out / to execute — uygulamak /.exen: The engineer carefully carries out the project manager's instructions.
to carry out / to execute — uygulamak /.notes: To execute, carry out, or perform a task/order. Also means to export (Waren ausführen). Common in formal/professional contexts: einen Befehl ausführen = to execute a command.

to strive — çabalamak / gayret etmek / ç.exde: Er strebt nach Perfektion in allem, was er tut.
to strive — çabalamak / gayret etmek / ç.exen: He strives for perfection in everything he does.
to strive — çabalamak / gayret etmek / ç.notes: To strive or aspire toward something. Used with 'nach + Dativ': nach Erfolg streben (to strive for success). Related to 'das Streben' (ambition/striving) and 'strebsam' (ambitious).

to gobble / to wolf down — tıkınmak / ac.exde: Er schlingt sein Essen immer so schnell herunter, dass er kaum schmeckt, was er isst.
to gobble / to wolf down — tıkınmak / ac.exen: He always wolfs down his food so fast that he barely tastes what he eats.
to gobble / to wolf down — tıkınmak / ac.notes: To eat greedily or hastily, to gulp down food. Strong verb (schlingt, schlang, geschlungen). Also means 'to wind/wrap around': eine Schlange schlingt sich um den Ast.

to intend — niyet etmek / amaçlamak / pl.exde: Wir beabsichtigen, das Projekt bis Ende des Monats abzuschließen.
to intend — niyet etmek / amaçlamak / pl.exen: We intend to complete the project by the end of the month.
to intend — niyet etmek / amaçlamak / pl.notes: A formal verb meaning to intend or plan. More formal than 'vorhaben' (to plan/intend). Pattern: beabsichtigen + zu + Infinitiv. Related to 'die Absicht' (intention).

to approach / to get closer — yaklaşmak.exde: Die beiden Länder haben sich in den letzten Jahren politisch angenähert.
to approach / to get closer — yaklaşmak.exen: The two countries have grown politically closer in recent years.
to approach / to get closer — yaklaşmak.notes: Reflexive: sich annähern (+ Dativ). To approach or draw nearer, both physically and figuratively. 'sich einer Lösung annähern' = to approach a solution. Related to 'nah' (near) and 'die Annäherung' (approach/rapprochement).

to hurt — acıtmak / ağrımak / canını yak.exde: Mein Kopf tut so weh, dass ich mich kaum konzentrieren kann.
to hurt — acıtmak / ağrımak / canını yak.exen: My head hurts so much that I can barely concentrate.
to hurt — acıtmak / ağrımak / canını yak.notes: To cause pain, to hurt. Takes Dativ: 'Es tut mir weh' = It hurts me. Separable verb. Can be physical or emotional pain: 'Deine Worte tun mir weh' = Your words hurt me.

to set off / to start / to begin — yola.exde: Wir müssen jetzt losgehen, sonst verpassen wir den Zug.
to set off / to start / to begin — yola.exen: We have to leave now, otherwise we'll miss the train.
to set off / to start / to begin — yola.notes: To set off, to get going, or to start. Very common in everyday speech. 'Wann geht es los?' = When does it start? 'Jetzt geht's los!' = Here we go! Uses 'sein' as auxiliary.

to have on / to have open / to have as h.exde: Sie hat heute einen schönen Hut auf.
to have on / to have open / to have as h.exen: She has a nice hat on today.
to have on / to have open / to have as h.notes: Colloquial separable verb with multiple meanings: 1) to wear (hat/glasses): 'eine Brille aufhaben', 2) to have open: 'Die Tür aufhaben', 3) to have homework: 'Wir haben heute viel auf'. Informal alternative to 'tragen', 'geöffnet haben'.

to be missing / to lack — eksik olmak /.exde: Es fehlt uns an Zeit, um das Projekt rechtzeitig fertigzustellen.
to be missing / to lack — eksik olmak /.exen: We lack the time to finish the project on time.
to be missing / to lack — eksik olmak /.notes: Impersonal construction: 'es fehlt jemandem an etwas' = someone lacks something. Also personal: 'Du fehlst mir' = I miss you. 'Was fehlt Ihnen?' = What's wrong? (at the doctor).

it is due to / it depends on — ...den ka.exde: Es liegt an dir, ob wir heute Abend ausgehen oder nicht.
it is due to / it depends on — ...den ka.exen: It's up to you whether we go out tonight or not.
it is due to / it depends on — ...den ka.notes: Impersonal construction 'es liegt an + Dativ' = it is due to / it depends on. 'Woran liegt es?' = What's the reason? 'Es liegt daran, dass...' = It's because...

to have come across something — bir şeye.exde: Ich bin gestern auf einen interessanten Artikel gestoßen, den du unbedingt lesen solltest.
to have come across something — bir şeye.exen: I came across an interesting article yesterday that you absolutely have to read.
to have come across something — bir şeye.notes: Based on 'auf etwas stoßen' = to come across, to stumble upon something unexpectedly. Strong verb: stößt, stieß, ist gestoßen. Very useful in everyday speech for discovering things by chance.

to implore / to beg — yalvarmak.exde: Das Kind flehte seine Mutter an, ihm noch ein Eis zu kaufen.
to implore / to beg — yalvarmak.exen: The child begged his mother to buy him another ice cream.
to implore / to beg — yalvarmak.notes: To desperately beg or implore someone. Stronger and more emotional than 'bitten' (to ask/request). Pattern: jemanden anflehen + zu + Infinitiv.

to catch up — arayı kapatmak / yetişmek.exde: Nach einer schwachen ersten Halbzeit konnte die Mannschaft in der zweiten Halbzeit aufholen.
to catch up — arayı kapatmak / yetişmek.exen: After a weak first half, the team was able to catch up in the second half.
to catch up — arayı kapatmak / yetişmek.notes: To catch up, to make up for lost ground. Used in sports, academics, and general contexts. 'einen Rückstand aufholen' = to make up a deficit. Also intransitive: 'Wir müssen aufholen' = we need to catch up.

to insert — eklemek / yerleştirmek / ara.exde: Kannst du bitte noch ein Bild in die Präsentation einfügen?
to insert — eklemek / yerleştirmek / ara.exen: Can you please insert another image into the presentation?
to insert — eklemek / yerleştirmek / ara.notes: To insert or add something into an existing structure. Common in digital contexts (Strg+V = Einfügen = Paste). Also reflexive: 'sich einfügen' = to fit in, to adapt.

to look up (in a reference) — (sözlükte.exde: Wenn du ein Wort nicht kennst, schlag es im Wörterbuch nach.
to look up (in a reference) — (sözlükte.exen: If you don't know a word, look it up in the dictionary.
to look up (in a reference) — (sözlükte.notes: To look up information in a book, dictionary, or reference work. Strong verb: schlägt nach, schlug nach, hat nachgeschlagen. The go-to verb for consulting reference materials.

to make clear / to clarify — açıkça beli.exde: Der Lehrer hat deutlich gemacht, dass die Prüfung nicht verschoben wird.
to make clear / to clarify — açıkça beli.exen: The teacher made it clear that the exam will not be postponed.
to make clear / to clarify — açıkça beli.notes: A verb-adjective combination: 'etwas deutlich machen' = to make something clear/evident. Used when emphasizing or clarifying a point. 'deutlich' = clear/obvious.

to make known / to introduce — tanıtmak.exde: Darf ich Sie mit meinem Kollegen bekannt machen?
to make known / to introduce — tanıtmak.exen: May I introduce you to my colleague?
to make known / to introduce — tanıtmak.notes: Two main uses: 1) to introduce people: 'jemanden mit jemandem bekannt machen', 2) to publicize/announce: 'etwas bekannt machen'. More formal than 'vorstellen' for introductions.

to spit at — (birine) tükürmek.exde: Es ist extrem respektlos, jemanden anzuspucken.
to spit at — (birine) tükürmek.exen: It is extremely disrespectful to spit at someone.
to spit at — (birine) tükürmek.notes: To spit at someone. The prefix 'an-' indicates direction toward someone. Very offensive action. Base verb 'spucken' = to spit (intransitive).

to turn something into something — bir ş.exde: Die Renovierung hat das alte Haus zu einem gemütlichen Zuhause gemacht.
to turn something into something — bir ş.exen: The renovation turned the old house into a cozy home.
to turn something into something — bir ş.notes: Construction: 'etwas zu etwas machen'. The 'zu' triggers Dativ. Used for transformations: 'Das macht ihn zum Experten' = That makes him an expert.

to empty — boşaltmak.exde: Vergiss nicht, den Briefkasten zu leeren, bevor wir in den Urlaub fahren.
to empty — boşaltmak.exen: Don't forget to empty the mailbox before we go on vacation.
to empty — boşaltmak.notes: To empty a container or space. Related to 'leer' (empty). Also reflexive: 'Der Saal leerte sich' = the hall emptied out. Opposite: 'füllen' (to fill).

to put on (clothes) / to attract — giyme.exde: Zieh dir eine warme Jacke an, es ist heute sehr kalt draußen.
to put on (clothes) / to attract — giyme.exen: Put on a warm jacket, it's very cold outside today.
to put on (clothes) / to attract — giyme.notes: Multiple meanings: 1) to put on clothes: 'sich anziehen' or 'etwas anziehen', 2) to attract: 'Magnete ziehen Metall an', 3) to tighten: 'eine Schraube anziehen'. Opposite for clothes: 'ausziehen' (to take off).

to give along / to send with — yanında v.exde: Meine Mutter hat mir Kuchen für die Nachbarn mitgegeben.
to give along / to send with — yanında v.exen: My mother gave me cake to bring to the neighbors.
to give along / to send with — yanında v.notes: To give someone something to take along. Pattern: 'jemandem etwas mitgeben'. Also figurative: 'Das hat mir mein Vater mitgegeben' = that's something my father instilled in me.

to give away (as a gift) — hediye etmek.exde: Sie hat ihre alten Bücher an die Bibliothek verschenkt.
to give away (as a gift) — hediye etmek.exen: She gave away her old books to the library.
to give away (as a gift) — hediye etmek.notes: To give something away as a gift, for free. Unlike 'schenken' (to give as a gift), 'verschenken' emphasizes giving something away completely, sometimes with a sense of wastefulness: 'sein Talent verschenken' = to waste one's talent.

to challenge — meydan okumak / zorlamak.exde: Der junge Boxer forderte den Weltmeister zu einem Kampf heraus.
to challenge — meydan okumak / zorlamak.exen: The young boxer challenged the world champion to a fight.
to challenge — meydan okumak / zorlamak.notes: To challenge someone to a competition, fight, or duel. Also means to provoke: 'das Schicksal herausfordern' = to tempt fate. Related to 'die Herausforderung' (challenge).

to carry up — yukarı taşımak.exde: Kannst du mir helfen, die Kisten in den dritten Stock hochzutragen?
to carry up — yukarı taşımak.exen: Can you help me carry the boxes up to the third floor?
to carry up — yukarı taşımak.notes: To carry something upward/upstairs. Separable verb from 'hoch' (up) + 'tragen' (to carry). Strong verb conjugation follows 'tragen': trägt, trug, getragen.

to speak of / to talk about — bahsetmek.exde: Er spricht oft von seiner Kindheit in der Türkei.
to speak of / to talk about — bahsetmek.exen: He often speaks about his childhood in Turkey.
to speak of / to talk about — bahsetmek.notes: To talk or speak about something/someone. 'sprechen von + Dativ'. Similar to 'sprechen über + Akkusativ', but 'von' is often used when mentioning something in passing, while 'über' implies a more detailed discussion.

to lie to (someone) — (birine) yalan söy.exde: Du hast mich die ganze Zeit angelogen, und das kann ich nicht verzeihen.
to lie to (someone) — (birine) yalan söy.exen: You lied to me the whole time, and I can't forgive that.
to lie to (someone) — (birine) yalan söy.notes: To lie directly to someone's face. The prefix 'an-' indicates direction toward a person. Strong verb: lügt an, log an, hat angelogen. Stronger and more personal than just 'lügen' (to lie in general).

to make fun of — alay etmek / dalga geçm.exde: Es ist gemein, sich über andere lustig zu machen.
to make fun of — alay etmek / dalga geçm.exen: It's mean to make fun of others.
to make fun of — alay etmek / dalga geçm.notes: Reflexive construction: 'sich über jemanden/etwas lustig machen'. To mock or ridicule. 'lustig' normally means 'funny', but in this construction it means making fun of someone.

to result in / to yield; (sich) to surre.exde: Die Untersuchung hat ergeben, dass keine Fehler gemacht wurden.
to result in / to yield; (sich) to surre.exen: The investigation revealed that no mistakes were made.
to result in / to yield; (sich) to surre.notes: Multiple uses: 1) 'etwas ergibt etwas' = something yields/produces something, 2) 'sich ergeben' = to surrender, 3) 'es ergibt sich' = it turns out / it arises. Strong verb: ergibt, ergab, ergeben. Also: 'Das ergibt keinen Sinn' = That doesn't make sense.

to google — Google'da aramak / internett.exde: Ich habe das Rezept schnell gegoogelt, bevor ich mit dem Kochen angefangen habe.
to google — Google'da aramak / internett.exen: I quickly googled the recipe before I started cooking.
to google — Google'da aramak / internett.notes: A colloquial verb borrowed from the brand name Google, fully integrated into German with regular conjugation. Officially recognized in German dictionaries since 2004.

to wobble / to shake / to be loose — sal.exde: Der Tisch wackelt, weil ein Bein kürzer ist als die anderen.
to wobble / to shake / to be loose — sal.exen: The table wobbles because one leg is shorter than the others.
to wobble / to shake / to be loose — sal.notes: To wobble, shake, or be unsteady. Intransitive: things wobble on their own. 'Der Zahn wackelt' = the tooth is loose. Also figurative: 'Sein Stuhl wackelt' = his position is shaky.

to penetrate / to press / to urge — girm.exde: Wasser ist durch das undichte Dach in den Keller gedrungen.
to penetrate / to press / to urge — girm.exen: Water penetrated through the leaky roof into the basement.
to penetrate / to press / to urge — girm.notes: Strong verb with several uses: 1) 'in etwas dringen' = to penetrate into (ist gedrungen), 2) 'auf etwas dringen' = to insist on (hat gedrungen), 3) 'nach außen dringen' = to leak out (information). Related to 'dringend' (urgent).

to resemble — benzemek.exde: Das Kind gleicht seinem Vater so sehr, dass man sie sofort als Familie erkennt.
to resemble — benzemek.exen: The child resembles his father so much that you can immediately recognize them as family.
to resemble — benzemek.notes: To resemble or be similar to. Takes Dativ: 'jemandem/etwas gleichen'. Strong verb: gleicht, glich, hat geglichen. Also: 'sich gleichen' = to be alike. 'Die Häuser gleichen sich wie ein Ei dem anderen' = the houses are identical.

to charge / to load — şarj etmek / yükle.exde: Vergiss nicht, dein Handy aufzuladen, bevor wir losfahren.
to charge / to load — şarj etmek / yükle.exen: Don't forget to charge your phone before we leave.
to charge / to load — şarj etmek / yükle.notes: To load or charge. Most common modern use: to charge a device (Handy aufladen). Also: to load cargo (einen Lkw aufladen). Strong verb following 'laden': lädt, lud, geladen. Also figurative: 'emotional aufgeladen' = emotionally charged.

to stroll / to go for a walk — gezinmek.exde: Wir sind am Sonntag gemütlich durch den Park spaziert.
to stroll / to go for a walk — gezinmek.exen: We strolled leisurely through the park on Sunday.
to stroll / to go for a walk — gezinmek.notes: To stroll or walk for pleasure. Uses 'sein' as auxiliary. Often combined with 'gehen': 'spazieren gehen' = to go for a walk (more common in everyday speech than 'spazieren' alone).

to rub — ovmak / sürtmek.exde: Sie reibt sich die müden Augen, nachdem sie stundenlang am Computer gearbeitet hat.
to rub — ovmak / sürtmek.exen: She rubs her tired eyes after working on the computer for hours.
to rub — ovmak / sürtmek.notes: Strong verb: reibt, rieb, hat gerieben. To rub or grate. Also used for grating food: 'Käse reiben' = to grate cheese. Reflexive: 'sich die Augen reiben' = to rub one's eyes.

to wrestle / to struggle — güreşmek / mü.exde: Er ringt seit Wochen mit der Entscheidung, ob er den Job wechseln soll.
to wrestle / to struggle — güreşmek / mü.exen: He has been wrestling with the decision of whether to change jobs for weeks.
to wrestle / to struggle — güreşmek / mü.notes: Strong verb: ringt, rang, hat gerungen. Physical wrestling or figurative struggling. 'um etwas ringen' = to struggle for something, 'mit etwas ringen' = to wrestle with something, 'nach Luft ringen' = to gasp for air.

to roll / to turn over — yuvarlamak / çe.exde: Er wälzt sich die ganze Nacht im Bett, weil er nicht einschlafen kann.
to roll / to turn over — yuvarlamak / çe.exen: He tosses and turns in bed all night because he can't fall asleep.
to roll / to turn over — yuvarlamak / çe.notes: To roll something heavy, or reflexively to toss and turn. 'sich im Bett wälzen' = to toss and turn. 'Bücher wälzen' = to pore over books. Also: 'Probleme wälzen' = to mull over problems.

to shift / to pass on (responsibility) —.exde: Der Chef wälzt die Verantwortung immer auf seine Mitarbeiter ab.
to shift / to pass on (responsibility) —.exen: The boss always shifts the responsibility onto his employees.
to shift / to pass on (responsibility) —.notes: To shift or offload something (usually blame, responsibility, costs) onto someone else. Pattern: 'etwas auf jemanden abwälzen'. Negative connotation — implies unfairly passing burden to others.

to stride / to step — adımlamak / ilerle.exde: Die Königin schritt würdevoll durch den Saal.
to stride / to step — adımlamak / ilerle.exen: The queen strode gracefully through the hall.
to stride / to step — adımlamak / ilerle.notes: Strong verb: schreitet, schritt, ist geschritten. A formal, literary way of saying 'to walk' — implies dignity or deliberation. Also: 'zur Tat schreiten' = to take action, 'zum Äußersten schreiten' = to resort to extreme measures.

to stage a coup — darbe yapmak.exde: Das Militär hat gegen die demokratisch gewählte Regierung geputscht.
to stage a coup — darbe yapmak.exen: The military staged a coup against the democratically elected government.
to stage a coup — darbe yapmak.notes: To carry out a coup d'état. Related to 'der Putsch' (coup). Often used with 'gegen + Akkusativ'. A political term describing the violent overthrow of a government.

to pretend — ...mış gibi yapmak / numara.exde: Er tut so, als ob er alles verstanden hätte, aber in Wirklichkeit hat er keine Ahnung.
to pretend — ...mış gibi yapmak / numara.exen: He pretends as if he understood everything, but in reality he has no clue.
to pretend — ...mış gibi yapmak / numara.notes: Fixed expression: 'so tun, als ob' + Konjunktiv II. Used to describe pretending or acting as if. 'als ob' triggers subjunctive mood. Can also be shortened: 'Er tut so, als verstünde er alles'.

to barely fit — zar zor sığmak.exde: Die Hose passt mir kaum noch, seit ich zugenommen habe.
to barely fit — zar zor sığmak.exen: The pants barely fit me anymore since I gained weight.
to barely fit — zar zor sığmak.notes: Combination of 'kaum' (barely/hardly) + 'passen' (to fit). Describes something that just barely fits, whether clothing, into a space, or figuratively into a schedule.

to point / to direct / to show — gösterm.exde: Der Wegweiser weist auf den Ausgang hin.
to point / to direct / to show — gösterm.exen: The sign points to the exit.
to point / to direct / to show — gösterm.notes: Strong verb: weist, wies, hat gewiesen. Multiple uses: 'auf etwas hinweisen' = to point something out, 'jemandem den Weg weisen' = to show someone the way, 'von sich weisen' = to reject/dismiss. Related to 'der Hinweis' (hint/reference).

to continue — devam etmek [fortsetzen].exde: Sie setzt das Gespräch fort, obwohl sie müde ist.
to continue — devam etmek [fortsetzen].exen: She continues the conversation although she is tired.
to continue — devam etmek [fortsetzen].notes: Separable in theory, but written as one word.

to continue — devam etmek [fortfahren].exde: Nachdem alle Platz genommen hatten, fuhr der Redner mit seinem Vortrag fort.
to continue — devam etmek [fortfahren].exen: After everyone had taken their seats, the speaker continued with his presentation.
to continue — devam etmek [fortfahren].notes: Strong verb: fährt fort, fuhr fort. When meaning 'to continue' (mit etwas fortfahren), uses 'hat'. When meaning 'to drive away', uses 'ist'. More formal than 'weitermachen'. Pattern: 'mit etwas fortfahren'.

to hike / to wander — yürüyüş yapmak / d.exde: Am Wochenende wandern wir gerne in den Bergen und genießen die frische Luft.
to hike / to wander — yürüyüş yapmak / d.exen: On weekends we like to hike in the mountains and enjoy the fresh air.
to hike / to wander — yürüyüş yapmak / d.notes: To hike or go on a long walk in nature. Uses 'sein' as auxiliary (movement verb). Also figurative: 'Der Brief wanderte in den Papierkorb' = the letter ended up in the trash. Related to 'die Wanderung' (hike).

to kill — öldürmek.exde: Der Jäger hat das Tier mit einem einzigen Schuss getötet.
to kill — öldürmek.exen: The hunter killed the animal with a single shot.
to kill — öldürmek.notes: To kill (general term). Regular weak verb. Unlike 'umbringen' (colloquial, to kill/murder) or 'ermorden' (to murder, premeditated), 'töten' is the most neutral and broad term for causing death. Can be used for people, animals, or figuratively: 'die Zeit töten' = to kill time.

to kill / to murder (colloquial) — öldür.exde: Er hat gedroht, ihn umzubringen, aber niemand hat ihn ernst genommen.
to kill / to murder (colloquial) — öldür.exen: He threatened to kill him, but nobody took him seriously.
to kill / to murder (colloquial) — öldür.notes: Colloquial/everyday term for killing. Separable strong verb: bringt um, brachte um, hat umgebracht. More informal than 'töten'. Also reflexive: 'sich umbringen' = to kill oneself (commit suicide). Common idiom: 'Das bringt mich um!' = That's killing me! (figurative).

to murder — katletmek / cinayete kurban.exde: Der Journalist wurde wegen seiner kritischen Berichte ermordet.
to murder — katletmek / cinayete kurban.exen: The journalist was murdered because of his critical reports.
to murder — katletmek / cinayete kurban.notes: To murder — implies intentional, premeditated killing. Inseparable verb, regular conjugation. Stronger than 'töten' (to kill) and more formal than 'umbringen'. Related to 'der Mord' (murder) and 'der Mörder' (murderer). Legally distinct from 'totschlagen' (manslaughter).

to mark / to highlight — işaretlemek / v.exde: Kannst du die wichtigen Stellen im Text markieren?
to mark / to highlight — işaretlemek / v.exen: Can you mark the important parts in the text?
to mark / to highlight — işaretlemek / v.notes: To mark, highlight, or select. Used for text highlighting, selecting items, or marking positions. 'einen Text markieren' = to highlight a text. Also used in sports: 'einen Spieler markieren' = to mark a player.

to tag — etiketlemek / taglemek.exde: Ich habe dich auf dem Foto getaggt, damit du es siehst.
to tag — etiketlemek / taglemek.exen: I tagged you in the photo so you can see it.
to tag — etiketlemek / taglemek.notes: Borrowed from English. Used mainly in social media context: to tag someone in a photo or post. Fully integrated with German conjugation.

to label / to mark — etiketlemek / işare.exde: Alle Produkte müssen klar gekennzeichnet werden.
to label / to mark — etiketlemek / işare.exen: All products must be clearly labeled.
to label / to mark — etiketlemek / işare.notes: Formal term for labeling or marking. Used for products, warnings, signs. Related to 'das Kennzeichen' (license plate, characteristic). More official than 'markieren'.

to label / to put a label on — etiket ya.exde: Die Mitarbeiterin hat alle Pakete sorgfältig etikettiert.
to label / to put a label on — etiket ya.exen: The employee carefully labeled all the packages.
to label / to put a label on — etiket ya.notes: To physically put a label/sticker on something. Related to 'das Etikett' (label/tag). Used for packages, products, price tags.

to click — tıklamak.exde: Klick auf den Link, um die Datei herunterzuladen.
to click — tıklamak.exen: Click on the link to download the file.
to click — tıklamak.notes: To click (mouse/button). 'auf etwas klicken' = to click on something. 'anklicken' = to click on (separable, more specific). Related to 'der Klick' (click).

to misclick — yanlış yere tıklamak.exde: Entschuldigung, ich habe mich verklickt und die falsche E-Mail gelöscht.
to misclick — yanlış yere tıklamak.exen: Sorry, I misclicked and deleted the wrong email.
to misclick — yanlış yere tıklamak.notes: Reflexive verb: sich verklicken. Very common in everyday digital German. The prefix 'ver-' indicates doing something wrong, like 'sich versprechen' (to misspeak), 'sich verwählen' (to misdial).

noun.meaning: slice of bread — bir dilim ekmek

noun.plural: Kohle (very rare; usually NO PLURAL FORM)
NO PLURAL FORM (“Wässer” teknik olarak var ama mineral su için, normalde yok)
NO PLURAL FORM (“Milche” çok teknik, normalde yok)

noun.notes: Bir seyin kalitesi, fiziksel kondisyonu. Araba iyi durumda (bakimli).
im ersten Stock = 1. katta, im zweiten Stock = 2. katta, im dritten Stock = 3. katta. Synonym: das Stockwerk. 'Wie viele Stockwerke hat das Gebäude?' = Bina kaç katlı?

noun.meaning: protein / egg white — protein / yumurta akı

noun.notes: 1- Lage den daha spesifik lokasyon, parmakla gosterilebilecek gibi. (yara bandini tam yaranin oldugu yere yapistir) (die wunde Stelle) 2- en yaygin, is pozisyonu: Bosch'ta yeni bir pozisyon buldum. 3- tavsiye, senin yerinde olsam kalibi: An deiner Stelle würde ich mehr lernen.
Genel konum,durum. Situation daha gecici, Lage daha kalici.
Anlik, gecici durum (utanc verici bir durum).
general introduction, not related to topic, maybe brief description of structure.
experience you get from a rollercoaster ride, experiencing something. Erfahrung is experience you gain from something.

noun.meaning: birth control pill — doğum kontrol hapı

noun.notes: introduction to a topic, more educative than einleitung. Can be remembered as tour guide explaining something, as in 'führen'

noun.meaning: weapons of mass destruction — kitle imha silahları
shortage of skilled workers — nitelikli eleman açığı

noun.notes: fiziksel lokasyon, whatsappta live standort diye geciyor canli konum da.
nadiren kullanılır
çoğunlukla tekil
birleşik kelime
nadiren plural
zayıf çekim
genelde plural
Almanca çoğulu yok
(disease = der Krebs, no plural)
soyut, çoğulu nadir
singular kullanılmaz

noun.meaning: hustle, activity, goings-on — faaliyet, kargaşa, telaş

noun.notes: die Leiter = ladder (fem.), der Leiter = leader/conductor (masc.)
From sammeln (to collect). Eine Briefmarkensammlung = stamp collection, eine Kunstsammlung = art collection.
Everyday word for a place to eat/drink. More casual than Restaurant, broader than Kneipe. "ein nettes Lokal" = a nice place to eat.
Physical label/tag on products, clothing, packages. Also figurative: jemandem ein Etikett aufdrücken = to label someone.

noun.meaning: license plate; characteristic, mark — plaka; ayırt edici özellik, işaret
noun.notes: Two main uses: 1) car license plate (Autokennzeichen, Nummernschild), 2) distinguishing feature/characteristic (ein besonderes Kennzeichen = a distinguishing mark).

noun.meaning: basement floor — alt kat, bodrum kat
noun.notes: Abbreviated UG. Also called Kellergeschoss. The floor below Erdgeschoss.

noun.meaning: attic floor, top floor — çatı katı
noun.notes: Abbreviated DG. The floor directly under the roof. Often converted into apartments (Dachgeschosswohnung).

examples: Ich möchte kommen, aber ich habe keine Zeit.
Es ist kalt, aber wir gehen spazieren.
Er ist müde, aber er arbeitet weiter.
Ich bleibe zu Hause, denn ich bin müde.
Wir essen jetzt, denn wir haben Hunger.
Er kommt nicht, denn er hat viel zu tun.
conjunctions.notes: “Weil” gibi neden verir ama ana cümle kurar.

examples: Ich war müde, doch ich habe weitergelernt.
Es regnet, doch wir gehen spazieren.
Er ist streng, doch gerecht.
Trinken wir Kaffee oder Tee?
Kommst du mit oder bleibst du hier?
Wir können joggen oder schwimmen.
Er trinkt keinen Kaffee, sondern Tee.
Ich bin nicht müde, sondern hungrig.
Das ist nicht leicht, sondern schwierig.
Ich kaufe Brot und Butter.
Sie liest und schreibt jeden Tag.
Er arbeitet und lernt gleichzeitig.
Als ich klein war, spielte ich viel.
Als er ankam, waren wir schon da.
Als sie mich sah, lächelte sie.
Bevor ich gehe, rufe ich dich an.
Wir essen, bevor wir arbeiten.
Bevor es regnet, fahren wir heim.
Warte hier, bis ich zurückkomme.
Ich bleibe, bis es endet.
Er arbeitet, bis er fertig ist.
Da es regnet, bleiben wir zu Hause.
Da er krank ist, kommt er nicht.
Da ich keine Zeit habe, mache ich es morgen.
conjunctions.notes: “Weil” ile aynı ama daha resmi ve bilinen nedeni verir.

examples: Ich lerne viel, damit ich bestehe.
Sie wiederholt alles, damit sie es merkt.
Er spart, damit er reisen kann.
Ich weiß, dass du recht hast.
Sie sagt, dass sie später kommt.
Er glaubt, dass es klappt.
Geh nicht, ehe du gegessen hast.
Er duscht, ehe er zur Arbeit geht.
Sie bezahlt, ehe sie fährt.
Falls es regnet, bleiben wir drinnen.
Falls du kommst, ruf vorher an.
Falls er Zeit hat, hilft er uns.
Er verbessert sein Deutsch, indem er spricht.
Sie spart Geld, indem sie weniger kauft.
Er bleibt gesund, indem er Sport macht.
Nachdem ich gegessen habe, arbeite ich.
Wir gehen raus, nachdem es aufgehört hat.
Nachdem er angekommen war, rief er mich an.
Obwohl es regnet, gehen wir raus.
Ich komme, obwohl ich müde bin.
Er arbeitet, obwohl er krank ist.
Seit ich hier wohne, bin ich glücklicher.
Seit er arbeitet, spart er Geld.
Seit wir uns kennen, verstehen wir uns gut.
Seitdem er umgezogen ist, sehen wir uns selten.
Seitdem ich lerne, spreche ich besser.
Seitdem sie hier ist, regnet es oft.
Es regnet stark, sodass wir nicht rausgehen.
Er war müde, sodass er früh schlafen ging.
Sie hatte viel zu tun, sodass sie nicht kam.
Solange ich lebe, lerne ich weiter.
Solange es warm ist, bleiben wir draußen.
Solange du willst, helfe ich dir.
Sooft ich ihn sehe, lächelt er.
Sooft es regnet, bleibe ich zu Hause.
Sooft sie anruft, freue ich mich.
Während ich koche, hört er Musik.
Während sie schläft, lese ich.
Während es regnet, bleiben wir drinnen.
Ich bleibe zu Hause, weil ich krank bin.
Er geht nicht raus, weil es kalt ist.
Wir essen früh, weil wir früh aufstehen.
conjunctions.notes: En temel sebep bağlacı, fiil sona gider.

examples: Wenn es regnet, bleiben wir zu Hause.
Wenn du willst, helfe ich dir.
Wenn ich Zeit habe, komme ich vorbei.
Er mag Kaffee, wohingegen sie Tee bevorzugt.
Ich bleibe hier, wohingegen er geht.
Sie arbeitet hart, wohingegen er faul ist.
Ich wollte kommen, allerdings hatte ich keine Zeit.
Es ist warm, allerdings regnet es.
Er hat recht, allerdings übertreibt er.
Es regnet, also bleiben wir zu Hause.
Ich bin müde, also gehe ich schlafen.
Er hatte Zeit, also half er uns.

conjunctions.meaning: on the other hand / diğer yandan
examples: Ich mag Kaffee, andererseits trinke ich gern Tee.
Das ist gut, andererseits teuer.
Er ist nett, andererseits ehrlich hart.
Wir essen, anschließend gehen wir spazieren.
Anschließend rief er mich an.
Anschließend haben wir gelernt.
Es ist kalt, außerdem windig.
Sie ist klug, außerdem fleißig.
Außerdem habe ich keine Zeit.
Ich wollte arbeiten, dabei war ich müde.
Er spart, dabei verdient er gut.
Sie lachte, dabei war sie traurig.
conjunctions.notes: Hem “bu sırada” hem “ama” olabilir. Bağlama dikkat.

examples: Es regnet, dadurch wird alles nass.
Er lernt viel, dadurch wird er besser.
Sie spart, dadurch hat sie mehr Geld.
Ich habe kein Geld, dafür Zeit.
Er hilft mir, dafür danke ich ihm.
Sie kocht, dafür räume ich auf.
Ich mag Kaffee, er dagegen Tee.
Sie ist ruhig, er dagegen laut.
Ich gehe raus, er dagegen bleibt.
Ich arbeite, danach gehe ich joggen.
Wir essen und danach schlafen wir.
Danach rufe ich dich an.
Wir essen, dann gehen wir.
Ich lerne, dann mache ich Pause.
Dann sehen wir weiter.
Es regnete, darauf hörte es auf.
Er sprach kurz, darauf ging er.
Wir warteten, darauf kam er.
Es ist spät, darum gehe ich.
Ich habe Hunger, darum esse ich.
Darum frage ich dich.
Ich habe gegessen, davor war ich hungrig.
Wir trafen uns, davor kannte ich ihn nicht.
Davor hat es geregnet.
Ich koche Pasta, dazu Salat.
Er arbeitet viel, dazu lernt er.
Dazu habe ich keine Zeit.
Es ist kalt, deshalb bleibe ich zu Hause.
Ich bin müde, deshalb schlafe ich früh.
Er hat Hunger, deshalb kocht er.
Es regnet, deswegen bleiben wir drin.
Ich habe Hunger, deswegen esse ich.
Deswegen bin ich sauer.
Einerseits ist er nett, andererseits ist er sehr streng.
Einerseits will ich reisen, andererseits muss ich Geld sparen.
Einerseits mag ich Ruhe, andererseits höre ich gern Musik.
Er ist klug, ferner fleißig.
Ferner möchte ich etwas sagen.
Ferner ist das wichtig.
Es regnet, folglich bleiben wir drin.
Er lernte viel, folglich bestand er.
Sie sparte, folglich hatte sie Geld.
Ich mache es genauso wie du.
Er arbeitet genauso hart.
Sie sieht genauso aus wie früher.
Es regnet, immerhin ist es warm.
Er ist langsam, immerhin zuverlässig.
Sie kommt spät, immerhin kommt sie.
Ich koche, inzwischen deckt er den Tisch.
Inzwischen ist es dunkel.
Inzwischen habe ich gelernt.
Ich wollte kommen, jedoch war ich krank.
Es ist warm, jedoch windig.
Er hat Zeit, jedoch keine Lust.
Wir warteten lange, schließlich kam er.
Schließlich haben wir gewonnen.
Schließlich verstand ich alles.
Wir treffen uns, später essen wir zusammen.
Er arbeitete lange, später machte er eine Pause.
Sie war unterwegs, später rief sie mich an.
Es regnet, trotzdem gehen wir raus.
Er ist müde, trotzdem arbeitet er weiter.
Ich habe wenig Zeit, trotzdem helfe ich dir.
conjunctions.notes: En güçlü “yine de”. Fiil 2. sıraya gelir.

examples: Ich habe gegessen, vorher war ich sehr hungrig.
Wir trafen uns, vorher kannte ich ihn kaum.
Er machte seine Hausaufgaben, vorher spielte er ein bisschen.
Wir gingen spazieren, zuvor hatte es stark geregnet.
Ich rufe dich an, zuvor schreibe ich dir eine Nachricht.
Er begann zu arbeiten, zuvor trank er einen Kaffee.
Weder er noch ich habe Zeit.
Weder Kaffee noch Tee schmeckt mir.
Weder du noch sie kommt heute.

conjunctions.meaning: indeed … but / her ne kadar … olsa da
examples: Zwar ist es kalt, aber wir gehen raus.
Zwar habe ich wenig Zeit, aber ich helfe dir.
Zwar ist er müde, aber er arbeitet weiter.
Entweder du kommst mit, oder ich gehe allein.
Entweder wir kochen, oder wir bestellen Essen.
Entweder er ruft an, oder er schreibt.
Ich lerne Deutsch, um in Deutschland zu arbeiten.
Er steht früh auf, um den Bus zu nehmen.
Sie spart Geld, um ein Auto zu kaufen.
Er ging weg, ohne etwas zu sagen.
Sie fährt Auto, ohne aufzupassen.
Er ist gegangen, ohne sich zu verabschieden.
Anstatt zu schlafen, spielt er am Handy.
Sie liest, anstatt fernzusehen.
Er arbeitet, anstatt Pause zu machen.
conjunctions.notes: Değişim: bir şeyi yapmak yerine diğerini.

examples: Es ist wichtig, Deutsch zu lernen.
Ich habe vergessen, die Tür zu schließen.
Er beginnt, das Projekt zu planen.
